story:
OK, we are in an elevator - let me tell you what this is and why I'd like for you to be a part of it.  By the way, what floor?

The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money to print a 9x12 soft back run of the first book in my new comic series “The Adventures of Ribbit and Snibbit.” 

What is Ribbit and Snibbit? 

It is a story set 1,000 years in the future about  two genetically enhanced frog brothers that live in a small, post apocalyptic, steam-punk style village full of other special animals on the edge of a pond in Montana.  The pond is located in the midst of a fertile peaceful valley on a site which was the premiere scientific military application research center on what used to be Malmstrom Air Force Base. 

What is the story about exactly?

Ribbit and Snibbit is a tale that began as an oral bedtime story told to my daughter every night for the last six years and now it has become a gorgeous book with detailed illustrations that will charge children’s imaginations with fascinating scientific facts and theories and is quite child friendly and lighthearted (apart from a small nuclear threat, a few nefariously cunning and rabid weasels and some corrupted political leaders here and there – I assure you I’m not talking about congress, this is a children’s book after all).

To me the most important thing is how the story develops over the chapters.  These books celebrate uniqueness, individuality, self reliance and thinking for one’s self.  While I’m not going to give away plot points I do think it is important to mention that the special needs community as well as their treatment by others is responsibly addressed and effective at portraying their differences as strengths that must be utilized in order for the protagonists to succeed.  

When I say it is LOST meets Mad Max, 24, X-Files, Sherlock Holmes and Whinnie the Pooh I’m being quite literal and readers will be engrossed in the evergreen story line that has been developed over the last 6 years.

The other night I offered to begin reading Homer’s Iliad and the Odyssey to my daughter as I had read it at her age.  I did my best to sell Homer’s awesome work to her and she politely looked up at me and said; “No thanks.  I prefer Ribbit and Snibbit.”  Needless to say that made me feel good about the story and what it means to her.  It’s my hope that the story will mean just as much to others as well.  I still say Homer is the man – not Simpson, the Homer that didn’t have a last name and lived in 700BC.

Zsolt Ercsei, the head of Involved Channel in Transylvania describes the story well and it is in a really cool accent!  Worth watching: http://youtu.be/KySEYc1W9rQ

What will the book be like?

I asked some close friends that are involved in helping me with this project what they thought my generous and heroic readers would appreciate for a hypothetical Ribbit and Snibbit book.  The overwhelming majority wished to see two variations of it beginning with the whole story as an individual library of large 9x12 colorful books and later a high quality series of gallery quality collectible books, each containing 3-4 books that would total about 120 pages.

So that's the way it'll be, we will start with the individual books and then offer 4 book compilation books eventually.  Here's my little mock-up of the first planned softbound book:

This will be the only print run I'm planning on of making of this comic right now, so the first book will be pretty much a limited edition until the graphic novel gallery compilation of the story comes out.  I'll get enough books printed so that those of you who can't grab a copy during this campaign can snap one up later on, but they won't stay in abundance and they won’t be signed or come with the other cool reward stuff. 

Q: Why did these frogs cross the road?  A: To get to the other side

So if the goal is met this is basically a grand preorder event for the first of a series of books but it is so much more.  The whole reason “The Adventures of Ribbit and Snibbit” made it beyond the oral version told to my daughter at bedtime was to fund and start a foundation that will help special children from 0-5 with physical and mental challenges like my son Joe through the design of an incredible positive patient outcome website.  The website will eventually be located at www.ribbitandsnibbit.org –  Please read more about it here if you are interested.

If we don’t achieve the total goal then we can still ship a smaller amount of books, the difference being that the production costs will be more expensive and the amount going to fund the foundation will not be as much.  If we do meet the goal however, then we can print the books and effectively start the foundation which will help a whole lot of families and their amazing kids have brilliant futures.  

Those who submit donations will also receive the monthly newsletter called “Tails from The Pond” which will deliver regular progress on the website, info about new graphic novels and be able to take part in helping to craft elements in the story line going forward.

“Joe Momma" so smart she is the mother of invention!

Simply put, my wife (Joe’s mom) started all this by telling me about her desire for us to advocate for other local parents of other special needs children.  I saw a need; I looked for an existing solution and found none.  So I started the process of figuring out how to fill in the gaps for other families who were in a similar situation to us and make it free for parents while being self funded into the future.  That last part relies on the success of this crowd funding event for this book.  If crowd funding fails then everything will be much harder to achieve – I will not give up, but it will be much harder. 

STRETCH GOALS

It should also be noted that while I’m increasing the quality of the product with some of the stretch goals listed below, the site’s total funding cost of $100,000 can get started with sufficient momentum with the original goal of $25,000 being met.  That is a bargain especially when you consider that the new government healthcare site cost over $600 Million to develop and didn't even work at launch – You might call that a crowd funding project since it was paid for with tax dollars.  Meanwhile, my programmers have guaranteed their work to “function properly” and not exceed the budgeted amount including beta testing.  This site will also be completely free for parents to use.  You can learn all about it on the website.

Since the initial goal of $25,000 will cover expenses and shipping costs for the first book as well as being able to get started on the positive patient outcome site here are some goals that I've set for the fantastic reality of achieving and surpassing the initial goal.  My hope is that by having a crowd funding event for the first book followed by books 2 and 3 and finally offering the special edition graphic novel we can continue to publish the book without needing a publisher and also to put in even more money into the foundation.  Remember, the entire cost of the site is $100,000 so if we could reach anywhere near that, it would be an unbelievable achievement for two amphibians that started with a cause.

Initial Goal: $25,000

The following items will be added to all book orders of $25 or more as the following stretch goals are met.

$35,000

We’ll throw in an extra signed mini-comic (sketched not yet colored) and add it to the digital bundle.  This will be the first half of the second book or entire layout if it is possible to get that completed in time.  Everybody who got a digital bundle (which is all levels of contribution) will receive this as soon as it has been completed, approved and is ready to move on to the coloring stage in digital format.

$40,000

Signed Ribbit and Snibbit Magnum Card 6” x 4” Gloss.  Signed and personalized.

$45,000

Signed Magnum Card, Included in the first book will be an extra 12 pages of artwork including original sketches, studies and designs of the characters as well as a secret research section including photos of the actual environments that inspired my vision of the pond community.

$50,000

Signed Magnum Card, I will convert the extra 12 pages and double it to a separate 24 page gallery book filled with study pictures and original art and background information about the creation of “The Adventures of Ribbit and Snibbit.”

$60,000

Signed Magnum Card, 24 page gallery book filled with study pictures and original art and background information.  An extra 4 pages of story can also be added to the comic that I had to cut because of budget concerns.  Made me cry to cut it but having it in there will enrich the story that much more.

$75,000+

Signed Magnum Card, 24 page gallery book filled with study pictures and original art and background information.  An extra 4 pages of story will be added to the comic.

I will be able to get the trailer for the animated series started and those who were at the $75 level and over will receive executive producer credits on the trailer as well as a limited gold edition special signed DVD of the trailer.  Everybody will receive a copy of the trailer with their digital bundle when it has been completed.
story_txt:
OK, we are in an elevator - let me tell you what this is and why I'd like for you to be a part of it.  By the way, what floor?
The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money to
print a 9x12 soft back run of the first book in my new comic series “The Adventures
of Ribbit and Snibbit.” What is Ribbit and Snibbit? It is a story set 1,000 years in the future about  two genetically enhanced frog brothers that
live in a small, post apocalyptic, steam-punk style village full of other
special animals on the edge of a pond in Montana.  The pond is located in the midst of a fertile
peaceful valley on a site which was the premiere scientific military
application research center on what used to be Malmstrom Air Force Base.  What is the story about exactly?
Ribbit and Snibbit is a tale that began as an oral
bedtime story told to my daughter every night for the last six years and now it
has become a gorgeous book with detailed illustrations that will charge
children’s imaginations with fascinating scientific facts and theories and is
quite child friendly and lighthearted (apart from a small nuclear threat, a few
nefariously cunning and rabid weasels and some corrupted political leaders here
and there – I assure you I’m not talking about congress, this is a children’s
book after all). 
To me the most important thing is how the story develops
over the chapters.  These books celebrate
uniqueness, individuality, self reliance and thinking for one’s self.  While I’m not going to give away plot points I
do think it is important to mention that the special needs community as well as
their treatment by others is responsibly addressed and effective at portraying
their differences as strengths that must be utilized in order for the
protagonists to succeed.  When I say it
is LOST meets Mad Max, 24, X-Files, Sherlock Holmes and Whinnie the Pooh I’m
being quite literal and readers will be engrossed in the evergreen story line that has been developed over the last 6 years.
The other night I offered to begin reading Homer’s Iliad and
the Odyssey to my daughter as I had read it at her age.  I did my best to sell Homer’s awesome work to
her and she politely looked up at me and said; “No thanks.  I prefer Ribbit and Snibbit.”  Needless to say that made me feel good about
the story and what it means to her.  It’s
my hope that the story will mean just as much to others as well.  I still say Homer is the man – not Simpson,
the Homer that didn’t have a last name and lived in 700BC.Zsolt Ercsei, the head of Involved Channel in Transylvania describes the story well and it is in a really cool accent!  Worth watching: http://youtu.be/KySEYc1W9rQWhat will the book be
like?
I asked some close friends that are involved in helping me
with this project what they thought my generous and heroic readers would appreciate
for a hypothetical Ribbit and Snibbit book.  The overwhelming majority wished to see two
variations of it beginning with the whole story as an individual library of
large 9x12 colorful books and later a high quality series of gallery quality
collectible books, each containing 3-4 books that would total about 120 pages. 
So that's the way it'll be, we will start with the
individual books and then offer 4 book compilation books eventually.  Here's my little mock-up of the first planned
softbound book:
This will be the only print run I'm planning on of making of
this comic right now, so the first book will be pretty much a limited edition until the
graphic novel gallery compilation of the story comes out.  I'll get enough books printed so that those
of you who can't grab a copy during this campaign can snap one up later on, but
they won't stay in abundance and they won’t be signed or come with the other
cool reward stuff. 
Q: Why did these frogs
cross the road?  A: To get to the other side
So if the goal is met this is basically a grand preorder
event for the first of a series of books but it is so much more.  The whole reason “The Adventures of Ribbit
and Snibbit” made it beyond the oral version told to my daughter at bedtime was
to fund and start a foundation that will help special children from 0-5 with
physical and mental challenges like my son Joe through the design of an
incredible positive patient outcome website. 
The website will eventually be located at www.ribbitandsnibbit.org –  Please read more about it here if you are interested. 
If we don’t achieve the total goal then we can still ship a
smaller amount of books, the difference being that the production costs will be
more expensive and the amount going to fund the foundation will not be as
much.  If we do meet the goal however,
then we can print the books and effectively start the foundation which will
help a whole lot of families and their amazing kids have brilliant futures.  Those who submit donations will also receive the
monthly newsletter called “Tails from The Pond” which will deliver regular
progress on the website, info about new graphic novels and be able to take part in helping
to craft elements in the story line going forward.“Joe Momma" so smart
she is the mother of invention!
Simply put, my wife (Joe’s mom) started all this by telling
me about her desire for us to advocate for other local parents of other special
needs children.  I saw a need; I looked
for an existing solution and found none. 
So I started the process of figuring out how to fill in the gaps for
other families who were in a similar situation to us and make it free for
parents while being self funded into the future.  That last part relies on the success of this
crowd funding event for this book.  If crowd
funding fails then everything will be much harder to achieve – I will not give
up, but it will be much harder.  
STRETCH GOALSIt should also be noted that while I’m increasing the
quality of the product with some of the stretch goals listed below, the site’s
total funding cost of $100,000 can get started with sufficient momentum with
the original goal of $25,000 being met. 
That is a bargain especially when you consider that the new government
healthcare site cost over $600 Million to develop and didn't even work at launch
– You might call that a crowd funding project since it was paid for with tax
dollars.  Meanwhile, my programmers have
guaranteed their work to “function properly” and not exceed the budgeted amount
including beta testing.  This site will also be completely free for parents to use. 
You can learn all about it on the website.
Since the initial goal of $25,000 will cover expenses and
shipping costs for the first book as well as being able to get started on the positive patient outcome site here are some goals that I've set for the
fantastic reality of achieving and surpassing the initial goal.  My hope is that by having a crowd funding
event for the first book followed by books 2 and 3 and finally offering the
special edition graphic novel we can continue to publish the book without
needing a publisher and also to put in even more money into the foundation.  Remember, the entire cost of the site is
$100,000 so if we could reach anywhere near that, it would be an unbelievable
achievement for two amphibians that started with a cause.
Initial
Goal: $25,000
The following items will
be added to all book orders of $25 or more as the following stretch goals are
met.
$35,000
We’ll throw in an extra signed mini-comic (sketched not yet
colored) and add it to the digital bundle. 
This will be the first half of the second book or entire layout if it is
possible to get that completed in time. 
Everybody who got a digital bundle (which is all levels of contribution)
will receive this as soon as it has been completed, approved and is ready to
move on to the coloring stage in digital format.

Signed Ribbit and Snibbit Magnum Card 6” x 4” Gloss.  Signed and personalized.

extra 12 pages of artwork including original sketches, studies and designs of

double it to a separate 24 page gallery book filled with study pictures and

of Ribbit and Snibbit.”

pictures and original art and background information.  An extra 4 pages of story can also be added to
the comic that I had to cut because of budget concerns.  Made me cry to cut it but having it in there
will enrich the story that much more.
$75,000+

I will be able to get the trailer for the animated series

will receive a copy of the trailer with their digital bundle when it has been completed.

story:
Katy is on a train journey to a not-so-far-off destination, you have limited time to speak with her before her stop. What will you ask Katy?

 

“What is it Katy?” is an interactive graphic novel I began in the middle of June, 2011. Based in part on a lot of feelings and thoughts I had had on my regular 10 hour train journeys around the coast to-and-from university, the comic is a reflection of a lot of my own personal musings on mortality through the medium of sequential art.

But for me, it was also a significant experiment in terms of story-telling. I previously had made comics that were really only intended for the medium of print, and I wanted to see if I could connect with audiences in a new or different way. The result ended up as a comic that wasn't as much mine as it is everyone's. It became vitally important that each reader bonded with the comic in their own unique way, so that they could work together to solve the mystery of Katy's story. 

171 followers, 294 comments and 54 pages later on 30th January 2012, 'What is it Katy?' finally reached its conclusion. You can read the full story here.

 

Funding “What is it Katy?”

The funding goal for this campaign ($500) covers a small limited print run of a perfect-bound paperback “What is it Katy?” book and creation of bonus material for the book. 

The campaign will last until the end of April, at which time I will be printing the book for debut at MCM Expo in London in May if I meet the funding goal. 

In return for any help you can give me, I’ve added perks to the side, ranging from a mention in the book up to an entire goody-bag of comicky yum-yums.

 

$5 Stranger to Katy
A contribution of this much will have your name printed in the ‘Thank you’ portion of the book. :)


$15 Acquainted with Katy
A contribution of this much will serve as a pre-order for the finished Katy book. You will get your name in the ‘Thank you’ portion and a copy of the book posted to you. (Or if you are going to an event such as London MCM Expo, you can choose to pick up the book from me in person if you like!)


$50 Friends with Katy
Along with the previous perks (a dedication within the book and a copy of the book itself), I will also draw and ink original inside cover art in your book!


$70 Bestest-Friend-Ever with Katy!
Not only will you receive the mention on the ‘Thank You’ pages, receive a copy of the book, with original inside cover artwork, but you will also receive a copy of Those of No Class #1 and the Those of No Class Concept Book AND an A3 poster of my work.

Note: If you are from outside the United Kingdom and choose to receive a copy of the book, I'd be very grateful if you could add an extra $5 onto your pledge to cover postage! <3

Other ways you can help

If you can't help fund Katy, don't worry! Another way you can help is by spreading the word about her, and Katy has her own twitter page (@WildCardKaty) you can follow!

Much thanks to everybody who has shown this comic support so far, I hope you will continue to enjoy it as we begin to wrap up Katy's story.

story:
HENRY THE HEART BOY: The BOOK 

Fund Raiser / Pre-Order Book Campaign



*HENRY: THE HEART BOY blog:  http://henrytheheartboy.blogspot.com/

*KEN TURNER blog: http://kenturner.blogspot.com/

*KEN TURNER PORTFOLIO blog: http://kenturnerportfolio.blogspot.com/



A new book by illustrator and award-winning director, Ken Turner.  This book represents the 5th illustrated book made in the last three years.  All previous books were paperback, completely self-financed and only 100 were made of each edition.  The plan is to produce at least 1000 hardcover copies of the "Heartboy" book.  Please help realize this vision, and also, please check out the many perks I offer in appreciation of this support.  Thanks!


“Henry: The Heart Boy” is an illustrated story book about a boy who has taken the phrase "wearing your heart on your sleeve" quite literal.  It's a story that might just pull at your heart strings.  We all go through love, relationships and breakups, but sometimes it can be a bloody nightmare! 


Help by becoming a funding partner and pre-ordering your book today!

Thank you for your support.

-----------------------------------------------

About Me

My name is Ken Turner and I'm an animator/illustrator currently residing in Toronto who has worked in the animation, illustration and film industry.

I graduated from the BAA Animation program in 2007 at Sheridan College. During which I collaborated on a short film called “Umbrella Boy”, which won 2nd place at the Ottawa Animation Film Festival in 2006. Later that year I directed my first 2D animated group short film, “Attack of the Giant Vegetable Monsters”. It would go on to win the 2008 Jackson Hole/MovieHatch.com Cowboy Award for Best Animation. In 2007 I directed my final film and first stop motion animated short film, “TiM”, which was a homage to my favorite film director Tim Burton. In 2011 it played at the New York LES (lower east side) Film Festival as an official opening night and animation night selection.  I've worked as a character designer and animator for various studios such as C.O.R.E Toons (Iggy Arbuckle), Cookie Jar Entertainment, 9 Story Entertainment/Nelvana (My Friend Rabbit, Spliced) and Cuppa Coffee Studios (Ugly Americans).

From 2008 to 2010, I have self published four books.  My first illustrated book was called “A Night at the Movies”, which was a surreal take on the communal experience of going to a theatre to see films.  My next two books were illustrated humor books called “Eye Candy Volume #1: The Village Idioms” and “Eye Candy Volume #2: Apples and Idioms.”  Its best described as the literal visual interpretations of idioms and sayings.  Lastly, I made a mini comic entitled “The World of Snowboy and Crow” about the misadventures of boy made from snow and his friend a crow.

-----------------------------------------------

It will be a hard-cover book with full color covers, and full color interior pages, measuring 11 inches x 9 inches.

The money raised through IndieGoGo will go towards the production and shipping costs.  The total costs for "Henry: The Heart Boy" Book (hardcover) will be $6,000 USD.  These funds will finance the actual hands-on production of the book + print costs for the completed books + costs for the shipping and handling of the books + marketing.  Please consider pledging, it'll really help out plus you can pre-order the book and get additional rewards in the process (shipping and handling is included in each pledge tier).

"GOAL" REWARDS:

If all of the 40 available $100 pledge packages are taken then those pledgers, as a bonus, will get: one additional "Post Card Print".
If all of the 15 available $250 pledge packages are taken then those pledgers, as a bonus, will get: two additional "Post Card Prints" + one "Signed Personal Artwork Print by Ken Turner".
If all of the 5 available $500 pledge packages are taken then those pledgers, as a bonus, will get:
three additional "Post Card Prints" + one additional "Signed Personal Artwork Print by Ken Turner".

If the midway mark goal of $3000 is reached, everyone who pledged will get:
"E-book PDF of the A Night at the Movies Book".

If the goal of $6000 is reached, everyone who pledged will get:
"E-book PDF of Eye Candy Volume 1 Book".
- More goal rewards to come. Stay Tuned. -

The perks for your pledging contribution include:

$30
- a signed copy of the "Henry The Heartboy" book.

$50
- a signed copy of "Henry The Heartboy" book
- a signed limited edition "Heartboy" print.

$100
- a signed copy of "Henry: The Heartboy" book
- signed limited edition "Heartboy" print
- your name in the credits of the book under "Special Thanks"
- mini comic "The World of Snowboy and Crow" Book One
- one post-card size print.

$250
- a signed copy of "Henry: The Heartboy" book
- a signed limited edition "Heartboy" print
- your name in the credits of the book under "Special Thanks"
- mini comic "The World of Snowboy and Crow" Book One
- one post-card size print
- one Original commission piece of your choice by Ken Turner.
- signed "Eye Candy" Volume 2 Book

$500
- a signed copy of "Henry: The Heartboy" book
- a signed limited edition "Heartboy" print
- your name in the credits of the book under "Special Thanks"
- mini comic "The World of Snowboy and Crow" Book One
- one post-card size print
- one Original commission piece of your choice by Ken Turner.
- signed "Night At the Movies" Book
- signed "Eye Candy" Volume 1 Book
- signed "Eye Candy" Volume 2 Book
- two signed personal artwork prints by Ken Turner

Reward Details:

- The signed limited edition "Heartboy" prints will all be 8.5"x11" inches and come in a protective sleeve.

- The postcard prints are 5.5"X4" in size. please click link for "front side" and "back side" samples.  Each postcard comes with one envelope.

- The "goal" reward signed prints will all be 8.5"x11" inches and come in a protective sleeve.  These prints will be personal artwork prints by Ken Turner.

- The original commissions will be done by Ken Turner and be the pledgers choice of subject matter.

- All books (Heartboy, Night at the Movies, Eye Candy) are all signed and numbered.

Rewards will be sent to pledgers sometime in July of 2011.

----------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help

I am very excited by this opportunity and can't wait to get started --
but I can't do it without your help!!!

Get the word out about the Henry: The Heart Boy Book!

Tell your family and friends about this project. 

Please post a link to this campaign on your:

facebook, twitter, myspace, blogs, tumblr, wordpress, flickr, etc.


Please visit http://henrytheheartboy.blogspot.com/ for more details and to get a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the book by following my production journal. It will feature regular updates of the production artwork and other news.


Cheers

-----------------------------------------------

Project location: Toronto, Canada

- The original commissions will be done by Ken Turner and be the pledgers choice of subject matter.
- All books (Heartboy, Night at the Movies, Eye Candy) are all signed and numbered.
 Rewards will be sent to pledgers sometime in July of 2011.
----------------------------------------------
Other Ways You Can HelpI am very excited by this opportunity and can't wait to get started -- but I can't do it without your help!!!Get the word out about the Henry: The Heart Boy Book!Tell your family and friends about this project.  
Please post a link to this campaign on your: 
facebook, twitter, myspace, blogs, tumblr, wordpress, flickr, etc.
Please visit http://henrytheheartboy.blogspot.com/
 for more details and to get a behind-the-scenes look at the making of 
the book by following my production journal. It will feature regular 
updates of the production artwork and other news.

Cheers
-----------------------------------------------
Project location: Toronto, Canada

story:
Live Action Comics implements a new innovative comic process called "Live Action." This process utilizes feature film aspects, such as actors on-location, props, makeup and wardrobe; an advanced level of photographs are then shot, edited and used for illustrations, creating an epic graphic experience. 

We have a total of 5 new comic titles that we are working on.
1. Maximus Giganticus | Giant of the Ancient World
2. Nibiru | Origin of Humanity
3. Seraphim | The Burning Ones
4. Sienna Moss | Bread from Witchcraft
5. Element X | Continued 
  •  I began to create my own superhero role after being told by executives at the company behind Man of Steel that “maybe we should have screen-tested you for Superman.” Initially a movie script which took a year of writing, I transformed the script into Element X, the comic, Utilizing Live Action Comics, an innovative and ground-breaking genre for modern comics. Element X debuted its storyline in 2014.

⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️
***CLICK HERE*** to sign-up for our SUPER mailing list!!!⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️⬆️

Party

If you are in the Los Angeles area please join us for the launch party. Time and Date TBA.

The process

                  Live Action Comics is a combination of my computer skills along with my modeling background. It all came together organically for me. Your contributions will help me bring to life five more comic universes. Element X is the first but, I have many more to come! With your help you get to see a new up and coming creative team produce what will hopeful (with the grace of God) compete with the likes of DC Comics and Marvel. 

Behind the scenes

  • Here is some behind the scenes footage from the Element X - Evolution shoot at the United States Armed Forces Reserves Base in Bell Califonia. It was a great day, and  it was an awesome opportunity to add priceless production value. That day set the bar in attaining a level that I wish to maintain. Below is a video and photo from that day. This will give an idea of how this process works! 

***If you have any questions please send us a message and we will be more than happy to answer!***

  • Social Media  www.liveactioncomics.com

@liveactioncomics
@elementx
Twitter: 
@GrandscopeEnt
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/toddchristian
www.facebook.com/liveactioncomics
www.facebook.com/GrandscopeEntertainment

www.liveactioncomics.com

story:
EXTRA EXTRA! READ ALL ABOUT IT!

The Sunday Comics return to their former glory! 300+ Creators have joined The Sunday Comics to bring you an unparalleled variety of comic content that can't be seen anywhere else. Presented to you on GIANT sized 15" Inch X 22" Inch broadsheet newspaper! Get your copy while it's HOT!

For anyone that had questions, we want to clear them up. We've already reached all our previous stretch goals and are adding a BONUS IndieGoGo Stretch Goal! If we reach $5,000 we'll have a DOUBLE SIZED LAST ISSUE for you FREE with the purchase of a 12 month subscription to The Sunday Comics, join us today!

Please note, if you want to add any reward to your current subscription tier, like "Getting Drawn Into a Comic", one of the T-shirts, the print package or any others, just send a message to us or change your pledge and we'll let you know how much to add to your pledge! Hope that will answer any questions! If you want any additional add ons please just send us a message if you need further explanation!

A staple of every generations Sunday morning. Whether it was sharing the paper at breakfast with family, meeting up with friends to enjoy the funny pages, or looking forward to your weekly dose of comics every Sunday, everyone has a special place in their heart for The Sunday Comics!

We have taken a timeless classic and added an entirely new spin on it! A modern take on a traditional art form is what we knew would drive the ultimate success of our project. By fusing together comic strips with serialized comic books, illustrated stories and many other art forms, GOLDEN BELL has published a work of art that you won't forget!

What's the "ZERO" Issue & how often will future issues come out?

The "ZERO" Issue of our planned monthly publication will house 12 FULL COLOR pages of original content for you to enjoy. We'll have serialized stories continued in Issue "ONE" of The Sunday Comics in just a few months & we already have a year's worth of content lined up for you! 

Which creators will be in the "ZERO" issue of The Sunday Comics?

Creators included in the "ZERO" issue; Mike Edholm, Ron Ferdinand, Jim Davis, John Sanford, Tom Bancroft, Paul Dini & Dave Alvarez, Johnny Hart, Richard Thompson, Kishore Mohan, Geoff Grogan, Julieta Colas, Neil King, Rodrigo Bravo & Robert Iveniuk, Paul Fell, Daryl Cagle, Kevin Kallaugher, George Rottkamp, Mark Wheatley, Miriam Katin, Theo Ellsworth, Travis Hanson, Tobias Tak, Marc Goldner, Rachel Korsen & Rob Otto Gross!

There certainly isn't a shortage of content in this action packed issue. There's even a plethora of previews for many syndicated comic strips such as Little Nemo in Slumberland, Tarzan, Dennis the Menace, Garfield, Archie, Dick Tracy, Peanuts, Rugrats and many other surprises in store for you!

LOVE what you see? Well after you pick up your favorite reward tier come check out our website at www.GoldenBell.TV to see all our latest projects including The Sunday Comics and everything else that we're working on!

Want a preview of what's in store for The Sunday Comics? Check it out! You might even see one of the "Surprise Prints" below. Enjoy, Folks!

After printing The Sunday Comics, we didn't want to wait a moment longer to share this treasure with you. We've set a goal that we feel will cover the bare minimum expenses (such as shipping, transportation costs from the printing company, IndieGoGo fees, and everyone's favorite...taxes) to get this to your door! Check out our various reward tiers above to get the monthly subscription for The Sunday Comics up and running to your doorstep!

Who are we and why are we qualified to do this?

The core team here founded Golden Bell with a basic principle, "Comics for Change". We set our sights on the world to bring diversity to a medium that has less then often ever seen any real change. While Rachel Korsen is an Artist & Animator, Marc Goldner & Rob Gross are writers. We've always decided to put creative above all else because without a good idea to develop, there will be nothing for anyone to execute. While Marc operates daily business activity including expanding the Golden Bell family, Rachel & Rob are creating brand new and original content every day. As publishers, we've launched our imprint with The Sunday Comics and have already printed our "ZERO" issue that we know you're all going to adore & love!

300 creators are part of The Sunday Comics? Who are they?!

Our creators are what have made this whole adventure possible. Without them we don't know where we would be. While we may not have enough room to spotlight everyone, we wanted to give you just a taste of the sheer level of talent that are creating brand new original content for The Sunday Comics. If you'd like to see a full list of the creators and check out their other works please visit our website at www.TheSundayComics.com 

What Syndicates & License will be part of The Sunday Comics?

You name it, we've worked out a deal! Whether it's Dennis The Menace or Prince Valiant or Popeye from King Features, Garfield or Peanuts from Universal UClick, Archie or Rugrats from Creators, Dick Tracy from Tribune, we'll have it here! Additionally, we've partnered with Playtonic Games to create the original Yooka-Laylee comic! There's a couple other surprises; our creators will be making original Garfields for the first time ever and we'll be featuring TARZAN from the Edgar Rice Burroughs company! We have also reached a deal with The Ohio State University's Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum to bring you archives that are public domain!

Risks and challenges

Our biggest risks and challenges when we started The Sunday Comics was the potential for delays in printing and artist submissions. We've luckily now avoided those risks by staying a month ahead of schedule and printing the "ZERO" Issue of The Sunday Comics and having the first years worth of "The Sunday Comics" lined up and ready for the printer. It should be smooth sailing from here, folks! Let us know if you have any questions or concerns and we will address each and ever single one of you. Thanks!

We've always decided to put creative above all else because without a good idea to develop, there will be nothing for anyone to execute. While Marc operates daily business activity including expanding the Golden Bell family, Rachel & Rob are creating brand new and original content every day. As publishers, we've launched our imprint with The Sunday Comics and have already printed our "ZERO" issue that we know you're all going to adore & love!

While we may not have enough room to spotlight everyone, we wanted to give you just a taste of the sheer level of talent that are creating brand new original content for The Sunday Comics. If you'd like to see a full list of the creators and check out their other works please visit our website at www.TheSundayComics.com 

Garfield - Mark Mariano, Marc Jackson Yooka-Laylee - Rachel Korsen, Marc Goldner, & Rob Gross

Jorge Gutierrez, Director of "The Book of Life"

Bill Plympton, Creator of Guard Dog

story:
Short Summary

Hello internet! I'm Nigel Zackerhia Blackman III aka Nigz Blackman and this project is going to be a much needed push to get my comic/manga out there. I've been creating manga/comics for about 6-7 years now and I now I need your help! My biggest issue over the years has been lack of funds towards getting books printed and advertising however I feel now is the time to really get things moving forward with my latest comic/manga project Double Blackness.

Story

It's 1987 and press start is the hottest arcade around! Everyone comes from far and wide to play at this arcade to prove they are the best. 2 different sets of teens rule the arcade Double Blackness made up of Nick Fever and Joe Powerfist and the Lightspeed Rockers made up from Jarrel Lee and Andrew Fullz and they are always challenging each other for top spot at the arcade. One day a new girl shows up and gets in the middle of thier battle and is caught in all the drama, but this is the least of thier worries because something will go down that will change all of thier lives.. forever!

What We Need & What You Get

For those of you who are wondering exactly where the 10 000$ is going I'll break it down for ya. 


15% of it is going towards repairing a damaged work space (my office flooded with water so it needs new floors, the mold in the walls need to be fix as well as the source of where the water is coming from) 

20% towards advertising and promotional costs. A big chunk of that is going towards getting a new website professionally done, it's not a cheap thing to get if you want to get it done 100% right. I want to do more events and live things but they cost money to book. I would like to hit about 10 events for the year and with this extra push i could boost it to about 15-20

45% of this money is going just straight to the printing costs of books 4 and 5

20% is going towards art supplies and general office supplies including: Copic marker 72 set B & D, a stand up lamp, a new stand for my camera so I can do weekly live broadcasts of my work, organizational units to store and hold everything and other things of that nature

UPDATES

Preview of page 1-3 of volume 4 are up! 

New website is up: www.luckyhitcrew.com

story:
If you're insane then you will love Death Cat Comics!

Surviving as an artist is hard if you're not rich!

I want YOU and your pets, your priest and your meth dealer to read "Death Cat Comics"!

Getting a copy in your hands helps me get copies in stores!

Money goes to printing these!  The more money, the more can be printed!

story:
Wallace House is a project funded on Kickstarter by over 200 backers, that reached a 8700 euros goal (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/greenmoona...) 

About

"My name is Santana, friends call me Santana. This is our Indiegogo campaign to print the first issue of our adventure. Adventure? Better call it a tragedy, since everyone here has lost something precious... Who cares! If you really want to know about it, you should support us in this campaign, I'm tired of doing the talking. Move on."

The story

Wallace House is a fantasy comic book that roots in the superhero and nerd culture of our times.

In a sick society ruled by criminals and delinquency, Pacific City youth has just two choices: being victims of the system or joining it. No option grants them a rosy future, so, many guys are looking for a shelter in a world of fantasy, where they can live like heroes and heroines, and where it’s still possible to believe in hope and justice.

Teenagers indulge in their imagination until they can no longer distinguish fantasy from reality. A facility  will help the most needy teenagers: Wallace House. Or at least that's how it looks like.

What happens in Wallace House? Why some of its guests are starting to show unique abilities that transcend human limits?

Meanwhile the city is under Smile gang control, led by the eccentric Lullaby. Arika is an orphan with a dire background. She’s tired of the cynicism and the apathy that pervades the city. So, she decides to step in and declares war on crime in Pacific City. Arika will be the enemy of the Smile gang: a conflict with unpredictable and unexpected results.

Chiara Colasanti 's drawing of Arika for GreenMoonArtist

Wallace House shows how heroes are not just made by superpowers or huge wealth: this story tells about the potential that each of us has got within themselves. The comic book tells about out-of-the-ordinary teenagers. Their passions and dreams are a source of courage, perseverance, and desire to prove themselves. And there is even an animal you will be surprised of: wait for a fantasy twist!

Wallace House is a story in three volumes of over 85 pages per volume. This comic book is suitable for all ages, a mix of many elements that comes from the nerd culture.

There’re many different traits and artists that alternate themselves in a perfect mix of humor and action, combined with a healthy dose of realism and introspection.

The book

WALLACE HOUSE FIRST VOLUME FEATURES

1) Hard Cover with black and white paper, 176x250mm sized

2) Original and alternative version in English and Italian by Massimiliano Veltri

3) 92 pages = 85 comic pages + 1 page about green moon + 1 page for aknowledgements (Mr Green Moon's dedication page)

A white page with only the title, to be used for original drawings

And 3 pages dedicated to characters comparison (all of the pages are in black and white except the covers)

<<SEE PDF PREVIEW>>

The team

Green Moon Artists is a newcomer in the publishing panorama, born from the desire to make and spread comics, graphic novels and short stories with a creative spirit.

Green Moon Artists promotes young and emerging talents. We include them in important projects with internationally renowned artists.

Our editorial team aims to create works inspired by passion, dedication and professionalism. Green Moon Artists contributes to launching new artists through comics and satirical strips of different genres.

Green Moon Artists is a new editorial group. We adopt one of the most innovative methodologies of recent years: Crowdfunding.

Crowdfunding engages and enlarges a community and guarantees credibility and financial transparency.

At the moment, we’re working on new stories and projects marked by an innovative spirit. Our authors propose high-quality products.

Green Moon Artists: Comics and short stories for out-of -the-ordinary dreamers .

Creators Group of Green Moon Artist

The Creators Group of Green Moon Artist is a group of readers and comic book fans, designed to give a pre-production full view of the subject and its possible developments, by working through feedback and proposing appropriate solutions. In the Wallace House graphic novel contributed the authors Antonio Migliuri, Gaspare Belmonte and Antonio Galluccio.

Introduction to some characters

LULLABY

The mysterious leader of the Smile band. In a few years he succeeded in imposing himself as the kingpin of Pacific City. Haunted by a troubled past, he floods the streets of the city with his anger and his drug, bringing hundreds of youngsters to destruction and killing anyone on his way. What hides the heavy makeup that covers the face of this sadistic and eccentric character? What links him to Wallace House?

JOE SANTANA

A melancholic middle-aged man who seems to have lost interest in life and other people. This troublesome guest of Wallace House with a grumpy and brusque nature is the nightmare of the recovery institution's staff. Much older than others living in the nursing home and apparently without psychic problems. What does he share with the others at Wallace House? What holds him in the building?

ARIKA

Don't call her snotty. The girl could cut you in so many pieces she could challenge the most Michelin starred chef in the world's tartare. So graceful as lethal, the girl can't stand anymore the dreariness in which Pacific City collapsed and decides to clean it up with martial arts and the steel of her katanas. What is the real reason behind her fight against the crime? Why does she fight against it with a cat on her side?

Our rewards

Extra goal

Risks & Challenges

We are aware and prepared for the work that awaits, we are already in the final stages of the project. Both English and Italian editions are ready, as well as most of the prizes of the campaign. We will keep in touch with the public for any perplexity and we'll always strive to meet pre-set delivery times with frequent communications with our supporters.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you doesn't have the money to support this campaign, you can help us sharing this page and follow us on our social media pages:

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/WallaceHoseStory
Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/greenmoonartists/
story_txt:
Wallace House is a project funded on Kickstarter by over 200 backers, that reached a 8700 euros goal (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/greenmoona...) 

About
"My name is Santana, friends call me Santana. This is our Indiegogo campaign to print the first issue of our adventure. Adventure? Better call it a tragedy, since everyone here has lost something precious... Who cares! If you really want to know about it, you should support us in this campaign, I'm tired of doing the talking. Move on."
The story
Wallace House is a fantasy comic book that roots in the superhero and nerd culture of our times.
In a sick society ruled by criminals and delinquency, Pacific City youth has just two choices: being victims of the system or joining it. No option grants them a rosy future, so, many guys are looking for a shelter in a world of fantasy, where they can live like heroes and heroines, and where it’s still possible to believe in hope and justice.
Teenagers indulge in their imagination until they can no longer distinguish fantasy from reality. A facility  will help the most needy teenagers: Wallace House. Or at least that's how it looks like.
What happens in Wallace House? Why some of its guests are starting to show unique abilities that transcend human limits?
Meanwhile the city is under Smile gang control, led by the eccentric Lullaby. Arika is an orphan with a dire background. She’s tired of the cynicism and the apathy that pervades the city. So, she decides to step in and declares war on crime in Pacific City. Arika will be the enemy of the Smile gang: a conflict with unpredictable and unexpected results.

Chiara Colasanti 's drawing of Arika for GreenMoonArtist
Wallace House shows how heroes are not just made by superpowers or huge wealth: this story tells about the potential that each of us has got within themselves. The comic book tells about out-of-the-ordinary teenagers. Their passions and dreams are a source of courage, perseverance, and desire to prove themselves. And there is even an animal you will be surprised of: wait for a fantasy twist!
Wallace House is a story in three volumes of over 85 pages per volume. This comic book is suitable for all ages, a mix of many elements that comes from the nerd culture.
There’re many different traits and artists that alternate themselves in a perfect mix of humor and action, combined with a healthy dose of realism and introspection.




The book

WALLACE HOUSE FIRST VOLUME FEATURES
1) Hard Cover with black and white paper, 176x250mm sized
2) Original and alternative version in English and Italian by Massimiliano Veltri
3) 92 pages = 85 comic pages + 1 page about green moon + 1 page for aknowledgements (Mr Green Moon's dedication page)
A white page with only the title, to be used for original drawings
And 3 pages dedicated to characters comparison (all of the pages are in black and white except the covers)
<<SEE PDF PREVIEW>>
The team
Green Moon Artists is a newcomer in the publishing panorama, born from the desire to make and spread comics, graphic novels and short stories with a creative spirit.
Green Moon Artists promotes young and emerging talents. We include them in important projects with internationally renowned artists.
Our editorial team aims to create works inspired by passion, dedication and professionalism. Green Moon Artists contributes to launching new artists through comics and satirical strips of different genres.
Green Moon Artists is a new editorial group. We adopt one of the most innovative methodologies of recent years: Crowdfunding.
Crowdfunding engages and enlarges a community and guarantees credibility and financial transparency.
At the moment, we’re working on new stories and projects marked by an innovative spirit. Our authors propose high-quality products.
Green Moon Artists: Comics and short stories for out-of -the-ordinary dreamers .
Creators Group of Green Moon Artist
The Creators Group of Green Moon Artist is a group of readers and comic book fans, designed to give a pre-production full view of the subject and its possible developments, by working through feedback and proposing appropriate solutions. In the Wallace House graphic novel contributed the authors Antonio Migliuri, Gaspare Belmonte and Antonio Galluccio.
Introduction to some characters
LULLABY

The mysterious leader of the Smile band. In a few years he succeeded in imposing himself as the kingpin of Pacific City. Haunted by a troubled past, he floods the streets of the city with his anger and his drug, bringing hundreds of youngsters to destruction and killing anyone on his way. What hides the heavy makeup that covers the face of this sadistic and eccentric character? What links him to Wallace House?
JOE SANTANA

A melancholic middle-aged man who seems to have lost interest in life and other people. This troublesome guest of Wallace House with a grumpy and brusque nature is the nightmare of the recovery institution's staff. Much older than others living in the nursing home and apparently without psychic problems. What does he share with the others at Wallace House? What holds him in the building?
ARIKA

Don't call her snotty. The girl could cut you in so many pieces she could challenge the most Michelin starred chef in the world's tartare. So graceful as lethal, the girl can't stand anymore the dreariness in which Pacific City collapsed and decides to clean it up with martial arts and the steel of her katanas. What is the real reason behind her fight against the crime? Why does she fight against it with a cat on her side?
Our rewards

Extra goal


Risks & Challenges
We are aware and prepared for the work that awaits, we are already in the final stages of the project. Both English and Italian editions are ready, as well as most of the prizes of the campaign. We will keep in touch with the public for any perplexity and we'll always strive to meet pre-set delivery times with frequent communications with our supporters.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you doesn't have the money to support this campaign, you can help us sharing this page and follow us on our social media pages:Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/WallaceHoseStoryInstagram: http://www.instagram.com/greenmoonartists/

story:
Founded by a group of graduates; Animation Artists, Comic Artists, Programmers and a professional, we have engaged ourselves towards becoming an Independent Production Studio/Publisher. As artists, we formed "FMS Games Corp" a new digital media, game, and comic book company creating a new line up of great titles.


FMS Games was formed as a new digital media, game, and comic book company slating a new line up of great titles. We want to uniformly express our passions and visions while constantly contributing in creating new and interesting projects for the world to see. 


And here we are; wanting to share & release our vision to the public.


Lets make a Comic :



This story is so cool, we decided to create a series. 

Developing such a comic takes a lot of labour and resources. Basically a lot of time and money. The later not being so easy.  

As you can see from the artwork below, a lot of time has been spent in creating. 

With your help, we want to create a 25 page "first issue"(Issue#1) comic. 

If the campaign succeeds past our expectations then we would like to conquer even more issues! 


A ten issue format (Issue#1 thru Issue#10) would be awesome! But one step at a time.


SYNOPSIS:

After the highly publicized death of his estranged uncle, Brian Baccino, a young and very promising scientist, discovers that the man who raised him was not who he appeared to be. Killed on the doorstep of the RDI Corporation, representatives from the conglomerate deem the man a killer and a thief, calling the incident the consequences of corporate espionage.

Brian struggles to accept that the man he knew to be moral and just could not be responsible for the things for which he is accused. After finding a letter from his uncle contradicting those accusers, Brian becomes determined to find answers and sets out to uncover the truth, braving death, tempting fate and retracing his uncle’s steps. Soon, Brian finds himself scaling the walls of the technologies superpower and waist deep in a conspiracy that may alter the lives of millions.

Just when it appears he may be destined to share his uncle’s fate, Brian stumbles across something extraordinary. He finds a suit, which once on, seems to allow its user to defy the laws of physics. What he does not know, is that his discovery will soon make him the tip of the spear in an all out battle for the not only his own survival, but for the fate and future of entire human race.

 


THE TEAM:


STORY CREATOR / PRODUCER    |    Plato  FOUNTIDAKIS 

From an early age he constantly collected and read comics, always dreaming up super-heros. He built an early career as a Technical Illustrator by marketing campaigns for a diverse group of clients. 

   By the mid 90's, his passion of martial arts led him to Asia where he was expedited into the North American film and television realm as a Stunt &Fight Coordinator/ Action Director were he is accredited in an enviable list of productions.

Plato’s continued aspiration for growth forced him to venture into creating and developing new media in the entertainment sector acting as a Action Director, and Producer. He never departed from his long time goals and dreams of creating super-hero realms.



INKING / WRITER / PROJECT MANAGER    |    Aaron ONG

Aaron graduated from Seneca College as an Animation/ Motion Capture/ Game Design specialist. Throughout his career he has the opportunity to be involved in graphic design, web design, educational video games, VFX and work in AAA games including in-game cinematic motion capture projects.

 Aaron has also taught in a variety of schools, Seneca College, Recording Arts Canada, and Neilson Park Creative Centre, consistently teaching 3D animation, Motion Capture, and Cartooning.



PENCILER    |    Vince SUNICO

Vince's introduction to comics began back in the late 70's influenced by the Spiderman cartoon series from the 1960's.  A graduate from Sheridan College (Animation Program) he continuously worked with his skill sets as a student/freelance Penciler for years. Constantly honing my skills.



COLORIST    |    Toby MEDEIROS

As a young child, Toby's uncle decided that it was imperative for him to development as a human being by understand the worlds of Marvel and DC. He started him on Spiderman and encouraged him to continue studies with X-men and Batman.

Ten years and many drawing pads later Toby has devoted all his spare time towards either reading about the characters or drawing them. Comics are his passion & obsession, but drawing is his life.  The fact that the two go hand in hand is a happy little bonus for him. He aspires to publish his own works along side the greats one day, hopefully very soon.





We can't wait to show everyone our teams talents. Exposing us to the world and showing people that it is possible for an Independent Team to complete and release comics, and much more.
In order to complete the first issue our team would have to finish the full scripting, illustrations, penciling, artwork/colouring and printing.
 The budget would be $300.00 US dollars per page, we need to complete 25 pages, that brings the budget to $7500.00 US dollars. Then there is (P&A) print & marketing cost of $1000.00 US dollars. 
Total Budget of $8500.00 US dollars.
I believe together we can achieve this goal and bring an awesome comic to the world!

Check out our perks below! 
And please don't forget to share this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for all your help! 

And remember. 

All campaign contributors shall receive a low resolution electronic copy of the comic! 

**It seems that there is new interest to make this into a film/ tv series. The story has been optioned!

 This is great news!!! 

Who shall be cast? We will keep you posted.

story:
Mankind routed from their cities, people and animals perverted into horrors!

 

Ten Years Ago: mankind tried to open a path through the stars, but something else came through first. It turned all the major cities into madhouses of impossible creatures and warped locales. The rural settlements the survivors fled to aren’t much safer: horribly changed wildlife stalk the night and the worst of humanity have banded together into outlaw tribes. At least whatever has made its home in the cities hasn’t ventured out… yet.

 

 

 

Five Years Ago: a young girl named Geri is surprised by bandits while outside her village. Hiding from them in a field, in a blink she finds herself rescued and trapped at the same time. Geri finds herself in a concrete room with no windows and one locked door. When she finally dozes off, she awakes by the bonfire in her village. Nobody saw her arrive.

 

Three days ago: after Geri’s village of Ashford is raided, a man named Smythe appears with medicine and supplies that will mean survival for the settlement. Geri, now a scout and scavenger for her people, is fascinated by the stranger, who carries no weapon but comes and goes without fear of man or mutant. She shadows the stranger, hoping to find out his sneaking technique. What she finds could get both of them killed, or could possibly save all mankind.

 

 

Help Bring this Story to Life!

I am mainly short on tools and free time here. The total is only $2,000.00, which I hope is a realistic goal for a first-timer. The first $1,000.00 is going to a Cintiq tablet, so I can create this digitally, instead of with pencil and sharpie (my current art supplies). After that, I will be starting on the story, regardless of further funding. The rest will go toward allowing me to take off from work and focus on the first story arc until I reach this goal, which will allow for more frequesnt updates, as well as a buffer of pages in case of emergency. Please visit my gallery, and see if my style is for you.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Remember, even if you can’t contribute, you can still make a difference! Use the share tools below; blow me up on twitter, share the page on facebook. Get the word out!

story:
It will be great if you can share above with a comment about Parshu /Us/both. 

About Us

Greetings and thank you for visiting our page. We are Orange Radius Arts Private Limited, a content creation and publishing firm into English comics and graphic novels based out of Mumbai, India. Founded in September last year, our aim is to produce new-age, slick and original content for the Indian comics industry. 

We work with a small but very talented bunch of illustrators and content/story creators and believe in promoting new and upcoming talent by giving them an opportunity to showcase their work through our Graphic Novels. The market is growing and readers demand better content- we understand this and hence our endeavor to bring cutting edge, awesome content through our comics. 

Call us defiant for we don't believe in following an established norm for churning out content, we create original content with a fresh take on genres. While the Indian comics industry is flush with stories about Indian mythology we want to usher in fresh, contemporary and alternative stories for our readers. It is this approach towards our content that has built up a huge fan following for us pan-India.


Our first title 'Parshu' launched at the September Comic Con in India is a Superhero-Warrior series that blends mythology with the modern, takes a completely new take on the Superhero genre and delivers pure awesomeness.

'Parshu' has three issues launched since September namely 'Origins' , 'Rise of the Warrior' and 'Retribution' completing the first arc. 

    


             ISSUE 1                                     ISSUE 2                      ISSUE 3                                  

It is the story of a young warrior born in the lineage of a god, a mystical weapon that finds it's worthy wielder, the journey of the warrior and weapon becoming one, a path of justice riddled with pain and loss.

Our Vision of Parshu is not to limit it to a single Superhero-Warrior, instead to create a complex universe of Superheroes, organisations, supervillains and more, based on a larger theme of mystical weapons and ulterior motives. 


      

The future arcs have been written where we bring in new characters, build on sub-plots and make the storyline more fertile.  We have kept our characters grounded in the ethoes of our generation that thrives on technology and yet consumes and appreciates our mythology. 

   

       

Parshu- Arc 2

As we gear up for the second arc, we've taken the story and the art to a whole new level! We intend to bring the best ever in the Indian Comics industry to our readers with the Parshu second arc. 

With our second arc we not only introduce more inherent malice and evil intentions, we create sub-arcs for newer characters to expand the Parshu universe. Weapons and technology form the core theme of this arc while we redesign Parshu's suit, his gadgets and up the capabilities of his mystical axe. This is our most ambitious project so far and we have ensured that the pace of story, depth of the characters and their conflict, and the quality of the 80 pager comic, is nothing short of a path breaking event in the Indian comics industry. 

     


The story has been written by Raveesh Mohan and illustrated by the supremely talented Tarun Kumar Sahu and the output is nothing but explosive.  

The Comic will be released in September 2014 at the Bangalore India Comic Con and a host of marketing activities have been planned to make sure that it is roaring success. But the most critical aspect to it is the money, which is where we seek your help and patronage. 

     

To visit Parshu's official page, click here

SOME OF OUR OTHER ORIGINAL WORK

To showcase our dedication towards exceptional art, alternate genre and zero compromise on quality we are sharing some of our work from 'Blind Spot' an anthology of illustrated short stories launched by us earlier this year at the Delhi India Comic Con. 

   


WHAT DO WE NEED...

Thanks to the tireless work of our team, we have already finished 50% of inking and the coloring of the same will start this week. 

We have budgeted the cost at 2500$, of which all funds will be going towards our printing, shipping and marketing costs.

Below is a brief rundown of the costs we expect to incur...

Printing Costs: $1000

We plan on an initial run of 1000 copies. These will be sold primarily in the 4 comic cons across India- Bangalore, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi. 

Illustration(with coloring): $1200

Though we have a great team of illustrators, none of them work for free :). Even then it comes to $15 per page which is only because of our relationship with them. 

Marketing & Incidentals: $300

There is a lot of great stuff we want to give you guys for supporting this campaign. This, along with any Indiegogo admin cost and Shipping cost we need to pay, will also be covered in our budget.

What happens if we fail to hit our funding goal?

If we fall short then we most likely will be forced to reduce our initial printing run and possibly delay the launch of Parshu second arc in September at the Bangalore India Comic Con. Further due to funds crunch we will fall short of our aim to launch the Third Parshu arc in December at the Mumbai India Comic Con. However the more money we raise, the more money we can put into the second arc and plan our future arcs. 

    What is in it for me?

    We are deeply passionate about comics and storytelling, and believe that a lot needs to be done in the indian fantasy entertainment space. We have the talent, the capability, the right infrastructure and as the recent spate of superhero movies prove, the right demand as well. 

    All we need now are people ready to make a dent in this industry, and we believe that as we are rightly placed. If you are someone who believes that the next marvel or DC is going to sprout from India, then we would like you to place faith in us and help us shape the future of content in fantasy entertainment space in india. 

      Risks & Challenges

      We are banking a lot on this Issue and believe it to be a major milestone for us. But there is clear chance that we might not be able to achieve what we have set out for, this year. 

      But rest assured that we, Raveesh Mohan, Director and Priyank Loonker, Senior Partner will put in all their energies into making it a powerhouse of character based entertainment. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If for some reason you are not able to donate, do share this campaign with your friends and colleagues.

These will be sold primarily in the 4 comic cons across India- Bangalore, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi. Illustration(with coloring): $1200Though we have a great team of illustrators, none of them work for free :). Even then it comes to $15 per page which is only because of our relationship with them. Marketing & Incidentals: $300There is a lot of great stuff we want to give you guys for supporting this campaign. This, along with any Indiegogo admin cost and Shipping cost we need to pay, will also be covered in our budget.What happens if we fail to hit our funding goal?If we fall short then we most likely will be forced to reduce our initial printing run and possibly delay the launch of Parshu second arc in September at the Bangalore India Comic Con. Further due to funds crunch we will fall short of our aim to launch the Third Parshu arc in December at the Mumbai India Comic Con. However the more money we raise, the more money we can put into the second arc and plan our future arcs.   What is in it for me? We are deeply passionate about comics and storytelling, and believe that a lot needs to be done in the indian fantasy entertainment space. We have the talent, the capability, the right infrastructure and as the recent spate of superhero movies prove, the right demand as well. All we need now are people ready to make a dent in this industry, and we believe that as we are rightly placed. If you are someone who believes that the next marvel or DC is going to sprout from India, then we would like you to place faith in us and help us shape the future of content in fantasy entertainment space in india.   Risks & Challenges We are banking a lot on this Issue and believe it to be a major milestone for us. But there is clear chance that we might not be able to achieve what we have set out for, this year. But rest assured that we, Raveesh Mohan, Director and Priyank Loonker, Senior Partner will put in all their energies into making it a powerhouse of character based entertainment.   Other Ways You Can Help If for some reason you are not able to donate, do share this campaign with your friends and colleagues.

story:
Short Summary

A story about a former Marine turned deadly assassin who is tasked with taking out radical community leaders by a smooth talking politician who may be getting orders from higher up. Sexy seduction, brutal precision, and warm-hearted love come together in one amazing woman. Follow as she learns why her latest missions mean more than anyone is letting on, and see how she deals with being manipulated into betraying her own ideals.

For mature readers only.

 

Alé Garza Main Cover

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our target is $6,000 for this campaign. What does that cover? First and foremost that gets this book printed and in your hands. Anything beyond the cost of printing and shipping the book and stretch goals goes right into issue number two!

In issue one you get a 23-page story picking up with Clarissa as she begins on a series of targets that leads her down a path toward powerful people with powerful agendas. Issue #1 is the start of an ongoing series of comics telling that story.

 

The Impact

This is the first comic book project for Jim Healis, who took the risk of hiring experienced professionals to make this comic book. Making this a success will mean a future for Blue Mamba and continued stories for all the spy comic fans.

Risks & Challenges

This book is finished! All the pages are done, the variant covers are finished, art for the stretch goals is scheduled. There is no risk for this comic book if it gets funded (unless a meteor hits the Earth).

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't back the book financially? Then give us a share on your favorite social media. Getting the word out to comic fans, spy thriller fans, and people interested in great new comic characters will help us get funded and get the comic into the hands of everyone.

story:
Temporal Comics was created to bring fun back to comics.

Our first venture is a multi-issue comic book featuring original profiles on public domain superheroes mostly from the golden age, but some will be silver age. We are going to include the most known, with full profiles, to unknowns that have very little information as they made only a few appearance and in some cases just one.

The most exciting part is the all-new artwork by Chris Malgrain. Many of the adventurers of the golden age were often drawn by sub-par artists - not everyone could hire Reed Crandall or Lou Fine. I have seen most of the art for our first issue and I promise you won't be disappointed. Just check a few sample pages below. I think you'll agree Chris does wonderful work.

The first issue will feature:

  • Amazing Man
  • American Crusader
  • Atom Wizard
  • Atoman
  • Atomic Thunderbolt
  • The Avenger
  • Black Cat
  • Black Panther
  • Blue Lady
  • Captain Flash
  • Captain Future
  • Captain Tootsie
  • Daredevil
  • Detective Eye
  • Fantom of the Fair
  • The Flag
  • Green Giant
  • Masked Marvel
  • MiniMidget
  • Miss Fury
  • Miss Masque
  • Moon Girl
  • Pat Parker, War Nurse
  • Rainbow
  • Red Rocket
  • The Shark
  • The Silver Streak
  • Target
  • Vapo-Man
  • Wonder Boy
  • Wonderman
  • Yankee Girl

How many issues will we be doing?
The project is open-ended as there are hundreds of public domain characters. The deciding factor will always be if we can raise funds to produce the comics. With your help, I think we are good hands. :)

How many profiles can we expect for each issue?
Our first issue will feature 32 profiles. Following issues will be 24 pages with a slightly lower goal.

Regular Edition Cover

All-art Edition Cover

Variant Cover Edition

All 3 covers of our First Issue

What We Need & What You Get

To cover costs of artwork and printing our goal is $3500 CAD. If we exceed this goal, We will add extra pages and other perks. There are many pledge levels to chose from and we appreciate each and every contribution towards this project.

The first issue will feature:

  1. Amazing Man
  2. American Crusader
  3. Atom Wizard
  4. Atoman
  5. Atomic Thunderbolt
  6. The Avenger
  7. Black Cat
  8. Black Panther
  9. Blue Lady
  10. Captain Flash
  11. Captain Future
  12. Captain Tootsie
  13. Daredevil
  14. Detective Eye
  15. Fantom of the Fair
  16. The Flag
  17. Green Giant
  18. Masked Marvel
  19. MiniMidget
  20. Miss Fury
  21. Miss Masque
  22. Moon Girl
  23. Pat Parker, War Nurse
  24. Rainbow
  25. Red Rocket
  26. The Shark
  27. The Silver Streak
  28. The Target
  29. Vapo-Man
  30. Wonder Boy
  31. Wonderman
  32. Yankee Girl

The Team

Darrin Wiltshire - Layouts, Colour Assist
Richard Boucher - Researcher, Editor
Chris Malgrain - Art, Colours

Now a little about me:

I have always loved superheroes!

Since I was about 7 and my dad bought me my first Batman comic book, I have been fascinated by these costumed crime-fighters. I especially loved team books as they had more heroes.

Then around 1999, I had stumbled upon the golden age of comics. I was stunned to learn of guys like the Flame, Pyroman, Black Terror and so many more. It was at this time, on a message board, I first contacted Richard Boucher. After several conversations, we decided to start a website called "The Good Guys & Gals of the Golden Age".

Our goal was to catalog every single character that was active during the Golden Age (plus some others as well). I believe at that time our list was about 1100+ - no small task. It featured well known and obscure heroes and heroines and ran 22 issues

Risks & Challenges

No risks as the artwork is already completed and pages are being put together during the next few weeks.
