story:
We saw the sun rise, and called it God. We saw it move, and called us Center. Then stories, and myths, and happy little comforts- but they held us. Bound and in stupor we crept. Until, we learned the beauty of being wrong. It swept away the spell of firmament, until we finally gazed down upon our suspended world. We moved far, building, and changing other worlds. Slowly, did we do this, for the oceans and valleys of our world ill prepared us for the utter cold and licking heat of Space. And the dull, chill, quiet .  

     But still longing for a voice, the old melodies rang like brass bells in the minds of the lonely few. Contact made, a deal struck, and the lonely would return to their myths. Calamity and Choir. And so ended science, and the love of being wrong..  

     But such a legacy was not without its artifacts. A child was born on a satellite - our furthest reach from home. Ignorant to the dire transaction the world had made, she returns sleeping in her capsule. Science, meet the Choir.


Too cryptic? OK, I'll give away a bit more. After the Gold Rush tells the story of the Titan-born Scout, as she returns to her ancestral home of Earth. The first issue is a little more Twilight Zone than the rest of the series. But, like science, After the Gold Rush starts with a mystery. So that's all for now! 

   As we have it planned, the story unfolds over twenty five issues. ATGR #1 is 22 pages, for the main story, with several pages of special features. We plan on doing a series of paper issues, digital issues, and trade paper backs later on. But this campaign is to get that all rolling! 


   After the Gold Rush has three major goals. The first is to tell a good story that will matter. None of our other aspirations will manifest without a rich narrative. The motivations for ATGR are much more - but they are nothing without a rich narrative. 

    At a con last year, I saw some wonderful and a few worrying trends in comics. The wonderful was the focus on perspectives from many different sub-cultures. I am a huge fan of Silver Age books; the early Marvel books created the artistic dialect for most of the medium. The good of this precedent is the optimistic Sci-Fi expansionism, heroic deeds, and fantastic ideas. The bad was that these wonderful stages lack diversity in their actors. This is now changing in Comics. But while I saw this inclusion for so many groups, I did not see a single book that was openly created by or for atheists, skeptics, and the hard science crowd.

    The worrying trend is fear. Science has been playing the role of the atom bomb again, instead of the moon-lander. Tomorrow will be dark, there will be zombies, the buildings around you will be empty, you will be scavenging, the robots are coming, there is no help, the future will crush us, technology will twist and defame us – The end is now. No! This is not how it’s going to be. I grew up watching Cosmos and Star Trek, and that’s the future I see. That is what I want to bring back.


Miles Greb - Creator & Writer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator who's obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone. 

Isaac La Russa - Lead Artist & Concept Artist -Based in Illinois, he wears motley flannels and owns two ungrateful cats.

Michael Shepard - Colorist -  Very much like Mario Paint for SNES, but far more useful.

Andrew Pierce - Editor - Lovable goof and word-launderer. Escaped Kipling protagonist. 

Jamie Me - Lettering - Letterer who spends his time wearing pajamas called a 'gi' while learning the art of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.

Michelle Man - Guest Artist - Former New Yorker, current San Fransisco-ER? Kinder towards plants and other people's animals than probably anyone she's met.

Barry Blankenship -Cover Artist & Logo Design - Amateur cursing cat ventriloquist.

Ben Rodgers - Assistant Editor - Historian of historical biographies, at least he was historically.

Poster Team - David Hovey and Chris Lewis Lee.

You can follow the project closer at - @Goldrushcomic. 



After the Gold Rush #1 is complete, and printed. Thanks to our other funding efforts we also have the bare-bones funding we need to keep the story going through Issue #4. However, the funds we have are the minimum needed to keep Scout's story alive. The funds from this Indemand campaign will go to further the book's ambitions. 

If we meet out goal in this campaign we will have enough to take After the Gold Rush to more conventions - a critical part of an indie comic's progression. This way, we can get the book into more hands, and help promote science!

(Below is an idea of the budget for each printed copy of ATGR as it stands now. This is not the budget of the project in total.)


The funds are also needed for additional printings of the book. As it stands we can not afford to print issues 2-4, and are only distributing them digitally. Hopefully, the more exposure we get from conventions, and with your support, this can change! 

Additionally, much of the art team has been working on a very slim budget. I would like to be able to pay them a more respectable fee for their quality services. 

Now to the fund part! We have the book, four wonderful posters, hand crocheted scarfs, custom drawings, and more! 

Due to the high cost of shipping internationally, only some levels are available for our international fans. Of course, the digital version of the book is accessible to all peoples from all planets. Except to Cardassians! 

The first issue is finished now, and the posters are already printed. 

All Backers of the Hydrogen Level and higher get digital copies of After the Gold Rush #1-2. 

Posters

Posters will be printed roughly 18x12, with a glossy finish, on a quality stock. The posters are also shipped bagged, in a firm mailer.


                                                      David Hovey Poster


                                                Chris Lewis Lee Poster


                                  Cover Art Poster by Barry Blankenship 


Natasha Alterici Poster


Bonus!

If this Campaign gets over $4000 in total everyone who is getting a 18x12 poster will also get this "Strange Waters" print for free!


One-of-a Kind Art!

If you back us at the Margret Hamilton Level, you will get the only copy of these darling watercolors by @aimee_zhou.



Perk Levels





Risks & Challenges

Thankfully, the first book is finished, printed, and ready to ship to you and yours. The next book is well underway and is expected out in a few months. So the risks of this project are low. 

  • Budgeting for future issues can always come up short if there are unforeseen problems. So far, this has not been the case.
  • International shipping can be cumbersome at times, but our logistics have held so far. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Think our cause is important but don't like comics? We could still use your support. I have donated copies of After the Gold Rush to the secular summer camp - Camp Quest. By supporting the book, I can continue to do this with that, and other secular organizations. I believe positive science fiction and hard science based media are important and can help change minds. Your contributions help create more of it! 

If you are low on funds but dig the project, sharing us on reddit, facebook, twitter, etc are all amazing ways to help! Thank you for anything you can do.

story:
What is...?

Ski Ninjas is a comic strip that started in 2007, since 2012 has updated five days a week, free-now-and-forever, Monday to Friday. It's a no-plots, few-recurring-jokes, I-just-want-to-make-you-laugh strip. I want to make you laugh and not starve to death doing it!

I'm a cartoonist living in Thunder Bay, Ontario, who has been making comics for fun and profit since 2005. In 2012, Ski Ninjas was listed among the top five Canadian university comics by Maclean's On Campus. I have several comic series under my belt, and am currently working with Blood 2 Blood and AIDS Thunder Bay in producing a series of Hepatitis C awareness comics.


But Why Would You...?

Look, the internet is great, I know it, you know it. But you don't want to print out the almost three hundred comics that I made in 2012 and staple them together. You can, but it's a dumb idea.

Forget I mentioned that.

I've added up the cost of printing and binding these guys, and it's downright reasonable for someone who has a regular day job and no super-cool ten year old daughters to feed. Guess which one of those things I have!

The content is there, the InDesign template for putting the content in book form is there, the bonus content is clogging up my computer. The only thing missing is YOU!

I've been making comics since 2005, and right now, Ski Ninjas is my baby. My baby with a terrible name that doesn't make sense (like Pilot Inspektor). I'm coming up on my five hundredth strip, but other than some tiny little minicomics, there has never been a collection of any of these, or any of my work. I want to fix that problem, and I can't do it alone. I need your help.


So What Do I...?

Click that button that says "contribute now!" Share this page with your friends! Share this page with your enemies, and tell them that you don't want to see this campaign be successful!

Oh, you were going to say "what do I get?" Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt you.

Well, just look at the neat things you can get!

Forget I mentioned that.
I've added up the cost of printing and binding these guys, and it's downright reasonable for someone who has a regular day job and no super-cool ten year old daughters to feed. Guess which one of those things I have!
The content is there, the InDesign template for putting the content in book form is there, the bonus content is clogging up my computer. The only thing missing is YOU!
I've been making comics since 2005, and right now, Ski Ninjas is my baby. My baby with a terrible name that doesn't make sense (like Pilot Inspektor). I'm coming up on my five hundredth strip, but other than some tiny little minicomics, there has never been a collection of any of these, or any of my work. I want to fix that problem, and I can't do it alone. I need your help.

So What Do I...?

Click that button that says "contribute now!" Share this page with your friends! Share this page with your enemies, and tell them that you don't want to see this campaign be successful!
Oh, you were going to say "what do I get?" Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt you.
Well, just look at the neat things you can get!

story:
They called him Cuchulain, or 'Hound', Ireland's brave defender...

Following the Hound...

BreakThru Films, the Oscar-winning independent studio behind stop-motion animated classic Peter and the Wolf, and Pillarstone Productions are looking for your help to bring Hound, their epic re-telling of the Cúchulainn legend, to life. As our stunning new film version begins production, they're offering the first volume of their upcoming three-volume graphic novel for pre-order.

BreakThru Films are an independent studio dedicated to bringing incredible stories to life. As well as Peter & the Wolf we have also created the magical Études, 3D animations inspired by the music of Chopin. Pillarstone Productions is the brain-child of veteran writer, director and artist Paul Bolger. With Hound they're teaming up to create an immersive and multi-platform experience for audiences, creating new ways to follow Ireland's mythical hero on his adventure.

Volume 1 of Hound is a thrilling 200-page graphic novel by Paul Bolger and Barry Devlin that sees the creation of a hero and the beginning of his epic quest. Every donation will guarantee a copy of the finished volume, and we're also offering some exclusive collectors items for those who can give a little more.

 

Helping the Hound...

In order to publish the first volume of the Hound graphic novel, we need your help. We're a small independent studio determined to deliver the most ambitious and highest quality work possible, and that means reaching out to you to put your trust in our project. Hound is about delivering the most faithful re-telling of this incredible Irish myth, we know that's what our readers will want and that's what we're dedicated to providing.

We're not asking for money for nothing, we're asking you to pre-order an exclusive copy of the first volume. You can already see the incredible quality of the artwork, and we'll be releasing additional pages as we hit our funding mile-stones.

  

You can also help by spreading the word, by sharing a link to this page and telling others about the campaign...

story:
Print That Doujin

PAGE SAMPLES CAN BE FOUND HERE

Hey all doxy here! Living in japan, and making doujins.

Been in the adult art industry for 10+ years. Creating and print Doujin's in japan is a new thing for me and I felt my western fan base may be interested in the process. THE GOAL here is to print the doujin, send it to those who ordered a copy and put the book in doujin stores and sell them in comic conventions. 

What is it?

Pooters is a series of comics by well known erotic artist Butcha-u/eroquis. Many in the west are familiar with it and I suggest you check out his works. My fan comic is a futa version of his works and is 10 pages long. Additional pages will be added with increasing support.

How do I get a copy?!

I need about 800usd to make a proper run of 200 copies or more. If you support for a physical copy you will get a physical copy. Simple as that!

FAQ

  • Will it be censored?
    • Yes the print edition will. All adult works in Japan and must be censored. Digital editions will be uncensored.
  • Will it be Japanese?
    • Print edition will be Japanese. Making an english print double the work order and unless the support doubles or triples it's not really worth considering due to entry cost to print (print jobs always have a base cost even for a very small amount of comics done)
  • Why is it so expensive to ship?
    • Shipping is just expensive and it also include shipping material and time spent shipping.  Reduction in price may be possible for North America but the rest of the world will be tough to reduce.
  • When will I receive the digital files.
    • I'll send those out once shipping of the physical copies is nearly complete. I delay the digital edition as to not spoil the story for those buying a physical copy. Thanks for understanding.
  • More to be added as asked.

Risks & Challenges

I forgot few issues for this project as I've printed multiple books before and managed several funders successfully.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like my art or don't want a physical copy you can still help out by promoting the funder.

story:
THE UNBREAKABLE IRON RANGER COMES TO PRINT

The hit webcomic that’s been running for 2 years, finally makes its way to print! This is the DEFINITIVE way to read the tale of the Iron Ranger himself. Enclosed within this fabulous first volume is the beginning of The Iron Ranger's incredible journey: the Heart of Gold arc!

  • 200 Pages of content
  • 5 Episodes + the Prologue and interludes merged into the episodes
  • New story content
  • Refined and updated art
  • Behind the scenes content and author’s notes on each episode
  • Variant covers by guest artists
  • Featuring fan art from fans of the series
  • All in a 6.63 x 10.24 papertrade book

 

THE TALE OF THE MAN WITH AN UNBREAKABLE WILL

“It's a mad, mad world; one that needs a man with an unbreakable will, an undying body, and an unstoppable resolve. This is the tale of the Unbreakable, Iron Ranger!”



Unbreakable Iron Ranger follows the story of Ben Young, a youth of 21 who seeks to protect the underworld of monsters and crypts at the behest of his late grandfather, Dr. Fleetwood. An intended product of destruction for his undying body, Ben heads off into the world to make sure that no one follows in the path of Dr. Styx who tried to use crypts like him for world domination.
 

However, as he begins his journey he discovers what dangers await in the world, and that the mad doctor that Fleetwood took care of may not be dead after all...

 

Its a tale of danger, hope and hot blooded action. A modern day cowboy story with classic monsters and myths crossed with the Wild West.



 

 

READ THE WEBCOMIC HERE:

https://www.webtoons.com/en/challenge/unbreakable-iron-ranger/list?title_no=279422

 

THE GOAL FOR THE PROJECT

The general idea for this project is to create a collection of the first five episodes of UIR (with extra content) for readers to enjoy. The series was created with the intent of always coming to print, so its content was made as traditional pages first before becoming reformatted for being a vertical webcomic.

The upside is, because the already print based pages exist, the process itself should be easy. All this is is getting the already future proofed pages to print, as well as getting them touched up..

But to summarize, these are basic points I’m wanting to achieve.

GOALS:

  • Create a 200 paged paper trade containing the first five episodes, plus bonus content
  • Update the art and improve the quality (Regardless of the campaign’s success, these art updates and fixes will be uploaded to the official webcomic either way)
  • Fund for a bare minimum of 200 books for readers
  • Ship books to US and Canada (Minimum goal)

 

Despite a dedicated fan base, UIR’s reader base is small compared to others, so I’m keeping the goals small and focused for now. If the demand is higher I’ll be sure to ship more books out, this is all just a baseline goal for the project. I find trying to add too much often causes a downfall and delays for a project. That’s why I’ve waited to make sure I had the content ready for the most part instead of just only now redoing the comic to be for print and potentially causing more issues and delays.

I don’t intend for this to be a simple collection either, I wanna make sure that this volume is the best way to enjoy the series. Which is why I’ll be making sure to clean up the art, add some behind the scenes stuff, new story bits, and so on.

Here’s what y’all will be getting if you back this...

 

THE DEFINITIVE UNBREAKABLE IRON RANGER EXPERIENCE

 

UPDATED ART:

UIR as a whole has been an artistic evolution, the first three episodes especially having different styles from one another. I want to preserve the art as much as possible, but some changes have to be made to make it more professional. Most of this is just cleaned up art and some fixes to match the current style more without changing too much.


(These edits were made as examples, they are still subject to change. Quality may be compressed on here)

 

However, some pages WILL be needing a much needed overhaul, such as the splash pages. Just as an example, here’s Barry’s entrance (one of the villain’s in the comic) as it was done in 2018.


 

Now, here’s the overhauled page as of 2020 to better illustrate his daunting size and appearance dwarfing over our titular and comparatively diminutive hero.

 

In essence, that’s what these fixes are being used for. To enhance the original without messing too much with the overall art where I would have to back and change everything. The whole idea is to preserve as much as possible while making it look more professional and higher quality.

Even if the campaign doesn’t work out, these changes will be applied to the comic when the campaign ends. That’s a promise.
 

 

VARIANT COVERS

Included in this volume there will be awesome and dynamic variant covers to go along with each episode made by guest artists. There will be the proper covers and the alternate covers which also be used on the main webcomic.



This daunting and foreboding piece for Episode 1 I had commissioned  from my good bud WhatAHero, the creator of the hit Tapas series The Witch’s Throne (https://tapas.io/series/thewitchsthrone)

The Episode 3 one was done by Shaoz, and the Episode 5 one was done by Captain Ahab, both talented freelance artists, and both of them you can find on twitter! (@AhabsArtwork and @ShaozChampion)

. Besides these covers there are two other amazing covers I can’t wait to show you when the time is right, they are still being worked on as we speak!

 

 

BEHIND THE SCENES CONTENT:

 

Get some behind the scenes content with this volume, including author’s notes as well as thoughts from our editor Delta (he’s been a huge factor in making sure UIR is in top quality and dealing with my bull), and some concept art involving the episodes, key art, eyecatches and more.





 

FANART:

Fanart from the fans of the series will be included as well! This isn’t a tier reward either, we’re featuring art from the fans, mainly of course featuring art from the first five episodes to fit with the volume. If you made fanart, this will be your time show it off!

 

I’ll be working on a proper means to collect the fanart, updates on that soon.

 

STRETCH GOALS:

 

Some campaigns get more than enough funding needed. If we hit these marks before the end, here’s what will happen. More will happen if succeed the goal and the current stretch goal, but for now here it is.

15,000 - PAPER TRADES UPGRADED TO HARD COPIES

These are at the end of the day stretch goals, they are the icing on the cake. The main focus is the main volume with five episodes and bonus content, but if we can surpass these marks that would be amazing. If more stretch goals are made more may be considered depending on the demand.

 

RISKS

Look these projects will always come with risk and reward. With COVID-19 having impacted things so much and for so long it may end up causing delays. Gonna be keeping y’all up to date weekly on what the situation is, as well as providing progress on the project too. To make sure backers stay safe this is a fixed campaign, meaning if we don’t make our goal your money goes back to you. Refunds will also be offered during the campaign, as well as the first two weeks. After that the sales are final, set in stone. 
 

As said though there won’t be any art delays on the main pages, and variants are already underway with three more to go. Most of the potential delays will come with the printing and shipping for the books and rewards, the art itself is fine as that will be done during the campaign, not after.

To also note, the planned campaign will go as such

  • SEPTEMBER 4th - OCTOBER 19th: The initial campaign
  • OCTOBER 19 - NOVEMBER 2: Collecting funds and dishing out final refunds if needed, the PDFs being emailed to backers.
  • NOVEMBER - DECEMBER PERIOD: All rewards and products ship to the backers.

 

I hope you help support this project and help spread the tale, of the Unbreakable Iron Ranger!

story:
Welcome to a return to old-school black and white horror comics!  Welcome to The Muffenman Issue #1 from Limitless Comics!

The Story

Created over fifteen years ago, The Muffenman has finally found the right team and time to publish and share it with the world. This story is the beginning of an ongoing series which will give you thrills and chills for years to come!

The Muffenman is a sewer-dwelling monster who lives under Boston. In fact, he has resided there peacefully for decades, but now other beings are beginning to rise. Beings who aren't as peaceful as the Muffenman. So, he takes it upon himself to stand up to these intruders and protect his home. 

Some absolutely beautiful covers for MuffenMan #1

Limitless Comics and the Muffenman

The Muffenman is the newest character to come crashing out of the stable of Limitless Comics! If you are new to Limitless, we are an independent comic book publishing company. Owned and created by Anthony Moore, Limitless Comics has previously published 6 comic books in the world of the Realmz.

Now, we are kicking off with our second title, The MuffenMan #1. This horror/action comic is going to change the world of indie comics forever. And the train isn't going to be stopping here, so why don't you hop on board! 

Here are the first four beautifully-detailed black and white pages, right here and right now! Drawn by Jo Galicia, the stunning levels of intricate detail caused us to decide against using color and instead to publish the beautiful inks as is. 

 

The Artwork

The Muffenman isn't alone in his efforts to protect his home in Boston though. In this comic book, you will also be introduced to his sidekick with a thirst for blood, Lil' Ms. Patty Cakes. The two of them will eventually meet the dangerous and beautiful Thirst, queen of the dead.

Lil' Miss Patty Cakes, drawn by Jo Galicia

Not everybody is as friendly with Muffenman as Patty is, though. In this story, you can also discover the horrific, mutated Angler Monster! Plus, get a peek at the origins of another dangerous sewer dweller, Maggot.  Also, another future antagonist of the Muffenman whom you will meet in this story is the mercenary who don't play by the numbers, 88!

88, drawn by Jo Galicia

In addition to the absolutely gorgeous artwork for the book itself, a couple pieces of Jo's art have been selected to be featured as free trading cards exclusive to returning backers of Limitless Comics and to those current backers who pledge in the first 24 hours after launch.

Thirst trading card, exclusive to first-day backers. Drawn by main artist Jo Galicia and colored by Iwan Joko.

Muffenman and Lil' Miss Patty Cakes having some fun in the sewers: another beautiful trading card drawn by Jo Galicia, this will be available to backers who have supported Limitless Comics in the past.

Limitless has decided to use even MORE of Jo's artwork as special 8.5x11 pin-up prints! A total of 8 will be available, and backers will get an allotted amount dependent upon their pledge level. You can choose which pin-ups you will receive! This will be an option in the survey at the end of the funding period.

The 8 pin-ups featuring various characters by Jo Galicia

The Limitless Team is also proud to present the work of another one of our artists, Ben Jucal! Ben has come up with some absolutely astonishing drawings which will be featured as trading cards.

Trading cards featuring various characters, drawn by one of Limitless' artists, Ben Jucal

Limitless has also been blessed to receive work from other artistic and talented people who are fans of what the company has been doing. Shortly after the Realmz #01 crowdfunding ended, we hosted a fan contest for a MuffenMan variant cover. We had many great submissions, but we could only choose one winner and that winner was Brian Payne. We were also lent the amazing talents of Ryan Frazier for an incredibly cool reward available at the higher tiers: 3D printed Boston Sewer manhole covers!

A special cover from Limitless fan and indie comic veteran, Brian Payne

Steven Butler variant

The Rudy AO deadly dual​

Rudy Ao's dark tunnel variant

3-D printed sewer covers, designed by Ryan Frazier

 

The Funding

We are very excited for this Indiegogo and have extreme faith in the abilities for it to be funded. In the spirit of transparency, we want to share with our backers the breakdown of our required funds in order for you to understand what your money is going towards.

As you can see, we have 4 major expected expense areas, totaling the funding goal:

Reward Fulfillment - This is our largest expense, totaling almost 1/2 of our expenses. This covers all the things needed to get the tiers completed; from shipping expenses (not just the actual delivery cost from Tony to you, but also shipping from the printer to us, shipping to and from Indonesia for the tiers which include Rudy Ao's signature, as well as materials for sturdy shipping), to the amounts needed to completely finalize everything.

Printing - This is about 1/3 of our expenses and will cover the cost of printing the trading cards, pin-ups, and the comic books themselves.

Fees - Indiegogo fees.

Contingency - This is a small percentage of our expenses, but it is important to have a small buffer in case anything goes wrong along the way.

 

 The Limitless Comics Guarantee

Limitless Comics lives by the LC100% Guarantee. If there is not something right, message us and we will make it right. If there is something you're unhappy with, let us know and we will do everything we can to guarantee your happiness. We take pride in our stories, our characters, our art, and our books. We want to make you as proud to own these items as we are proud to have created them. It doesn't matter if you pledge at the lowest tier or the highest, we want to make everyone's experience as good as we can. That is what the LC100% Guarantee means.

Our Parting Thanks

Limitless Comics thanks each and every one of you for your kind support and generous pledges. Without your generosity and loyalty, we would not be what we are today. We have various titles in the works and this year you will be introduced to all of them.

I want to give a heartfelt thanks to all of the previous pledgers and supporters who have believed in our comics since day one. My vision lives only because of your belief in what I can achieve. I would also love to give a special thanks and a big hug to the man who was gone too soon, but who left me the blueprint to success. Jack Prihoda. This one's for you, Papa.

From myself, Jerry, Taylor, and the rest of the Limitless Comics family, welcome to the second book from the Limitless Comics vault: The Muffenman!

This story is the beginning of an ongoing series which will give you thrills and chills for years to come!The Muffenman is a sewer-dwelling monster who lives under Boston. In fact, he has resided there peacefully for decades, but now other beings are beginning to rise. Beings who aren't as peaceful as the Muffenman. So, he takes it upon himself to stand up to these intruders and protect his home. Some absolutely beautiful covers for MuffenMan #1Limitless Comics and the MuffenmanThe Muffenman is the newest character to come crashing out of the stable of Limitless Comics! If you are new to Limitless, we are an independent comic book publishing company. Owned and created by Anthony Moore, Limitless Comics has previously published 6 comic books in the world of the Realmz.Now, we are kicking off with our second title, The MuffenMan #1. This horror/action comic is going to change the world of indie comics forever. And the train isn't going to be stopping here, so why don't you hop on board! Here are the first four beautifully-detailed black and white pages, right here and right now! Drawn by Jo Galicia, the stunning levels of intricate detail caused us to decide against using color and instead to publish the beautiful inks as is.  The ArtworkThe Muffenman isn't alone in his efforts to protect his home in Boston though. In this comic book, you will also be introduced to his sidekick with a thirst for blood, Lil' Ms. Patty Cakes. The two of them will eventually meet the dangerous and beautiful Thirst, queen of the dead.Lil' Miss Patty Cakes, drawn by Jo GaliciaNot everybody is as friendly with Muffenman as Patty is, though. In this story, you can also discover the horrific, mutated Angler Monster! Plus, get a peek at the origins of another dangerous sewer dweller, Maggot.  Also, another future antagonist of the Muffenman whom you will meet in this story is the mercenary who don't play by the numbers, 88!88, drawn by Jo GaliciaIn addition to the absolutely gorgeous artwork for the book itself, a couple pieces of Jo's art have been selected to be featured as free trading cards exclusive to returning backers of Limitless Comics and to those current backers who pledge in the first 24 hours after launch.Thirst trading card, exclusive to first-day backers. Drawn by main artist Jo Galicia and colored by Iwan Joko.Muffenman and Lil' Miss Patty Cakes having some fun in the sewers: another beautiful trading card drawn by Jo Galicia, this will be available to backers who have supported Limitless Comics in the past.Limitless has decided to use even MORE of Jo's artwork as special 8.5x11 pin-up prints! A total of 8 will be available, and backers will get an allotted amount dependent upon their pledge level. You can choose which pin-ups you will receive! This will be an option in the survey at the end of the funding period.The 8 pin-ups featuring various characters by Jo GaliciaThe Limitless Team is also proud to present the work of another one of our artists, Ben Jucal! Ben has come up with some absolutely astonishing drawings which will be featured as trading cards.Trading cards featuring various characters, drawn by one of Limitless' artists, Ben JucalLimitless has also been blessed to receive work from other artistic and talented people who are fans of what the company has been doing. Shortly after the Realmz #01 crowdfunding ended, we hosted a fan contest for a MuffenMan variant cover. We had many great submissions, but we could only choose one winner and that winner was Brian Payne. We were also lent the amazing talents of Ryan Frazier for an incredibly cool reward available at the higher tiers: 3D printed Boston Sewer manhole covers!A special cover from Limitless fan and indie comic veteran, Brian PayneSteven Butler variantThe Rudy AO deadly dual​Rudy Ao's dark tunnel variant3-D printed sewer covers, designed by Ryan Frazier The FundingWe are very excited for this Indiegogo and have extreme faith in the abilities for it to be funded. In the spirit of transparency, we want to share with our backers the breakdown of our required funds in order for you to understand what your money is going towards.As you can see, we have 4 major expected expense areas, totaling the funding goal:Reward Fulfillment - This is our largest expense, totaling almost 1/2 of our expenses. This covers all the things needed to get the tiers completed; from shipping expenses (not just the actual delivery cost from Tony to you, but also shipping from the printer to us, shipping to and from Indonesia for the tiers which include Rudy Ao's signature, as well as materials for sturdy shipping), to the amounts needed to completely finalize everything.Printing - This is about 1/3 of our expenses and will cover the cost of printing the trading cards, pin-ups, and the comic books themselves.Fees - Indiegogo fees.Contingency - This is a small percentage of our expenses, but it is important to have a small buffer in case anything goes wrong along the way.  The Limitless Comics GuaranteeLimitless Comics lives by the LC100% Guarantee. If there is not something right, message us and we will make it right. If there is something you're unhappy with, let us know and we will do everything we can to guarantee your happiness. We take pride in our stories, our characters, our art, and our books. We want to make you as proud to own these items as we are proud to have created them. It doesn't matter if you pledge at the lowest tier or the highest, we want to make everyone's experience as good as we can. That is what the LC100% Guarantee means.Our Parting ThanksLimitless Comics thanks each and every one of you for your kind support and generous pledges. Without your generosity and loyalty, we would not be what we are today. We have various titles in the works and this year you will be introduced to all of them.I want to give a heartfelt thanks to all of the previous pledgers and supporters who have believed in our comics since day one. My vision lives only because of your belief in what I can achieve. I would also love to give a special thanks and a big hug to the man who was gone too soon, but who left me the blueprint to success. Jack Prihoda. This one's for you, Papa.From myself, Jerry, Taylor, and the rest of the Limitless Comics family, welcome to the second book from the Limitless Comics vault: The Muffenman!

story: Trying to raise money to finish the comic and have it printed in time for San Diego Comic-Con 2015. I believe the concept and artwork are professional enough that the title can also be distributed through Diamond Distribution. The ultimate goal is to have ALL of Identity Comics distributed by Diamond Distribution and I can the gainfully employ several artists on a monthly basis. I have previously crowd funded my first comic successfully and was not only to print and release a first issue, I had enough money left over from the campaign to write, illustrate and print a SECOND ISSUE. I have a substantial following on Identity Comics' Facebook page as well as my comic having been positively reviewed by several comic book fan sites such as Fanboy Comics. I believe the humor and collectibility of this comic book will increase the fan base of Identity Comics as well as increase the reading interest of those who would otherwise not be interested in comics. Bud Man will open a door to a large industry. I am already attending San Diego Comic-Con as a trade professional I would like to use the opportunity to promote a comic that can attract a wider audience.

story:
THE DEFINITIVE WALL-MIGHT TRILOGY

In the spring of 2018, following the success of their book Thump: The First Bundred Days, first time creators Timothy Lim and Mark Pellegrini were encouraged by friends at Antarctic Press to take their unique brand of illustrated political humor to produce their first comic. That book was the best-selling, 8-time printed comic My Hero MAGAdemia: Wall-Might.

Created, drawn, and colored by Timothy Lim and written and co-created by Mark Pellegrini with additional colors by Brett R. Smith, My Hero MAGAdemia became one of the most wildly successful political comics in recent years, filling in a much-needed market gap at the cross-section of politics and pop culture.

Since then, the duo of Lim and Pellegrini have gone on to collaborate on 10 books in the last 2 years. Two hobbyists -- non professionals -- have produced or have been involved in the following works in their spare time, all stemming from one political parody:

  • My Hero MAGAdemia
  • Black Hops: Buns of the Patriots #1
  • Black Hops: Buns of the Patriots #2
  • Trump's Space Force
  • Wall-Might: First Term, Part 2
  • Soulfinder: Demon's Match
  • Black Hops, Volume 2: Hare Trigger
  • Kamen America, Volume 1: Stars and Strife
  • Wall-Might 3: The MAGAlorian
  • Black Hops, Volume 3: Hopocalypse Now

Their most recent work in publication, Kamen America, was a direct spin-off of the Wall-Might series. It has gone on to sell more than 2,000 copies -- digital and physical -- solely on the direct, independent market between Kickstarter and IndieGoGo pre-orders. A sequel is planned for the fall, as well as a retail printing.

Now, for the first time, the Wall-Might Trilogy is collected in one definitive volume.

My Hero MAGAdemia, Wall-Might, and Wall-Might 3: The MAGAlorian chronicle the rise of Donaldus Magnus after receiving the legacy ability known as the E Pluribus Unum. Granted the power of the people, he turns into the American champion Wall-Might as he works tirelessly for its citizens. Together with his wife -- FLOTUS -- and young protege, Maiku-Kun, he faces a rogues gallery of Deep State operatives, greasy politicians, and malicious Marxists through 100+ pages of greatness.

The best, really, everyone agrees.

Here's the deal with what you'll be getting:

  • The collected, original printings of My Hero MAGAdemia: Wall-Might, Wall-Might: First Term, Part II (the complete crowdfunded version), Wall-Might 3: The MAGAlorian (includes Wall-Might Side Story: GOPlin Slayer written by R.D. and Raymond Porse)
  • That's 110+ pages. HUGE!
  • All original covers and supplemental material, including the virgin version of Dave Dorman's MAGAlorian cover
  • Square-bound, with a fancy surprise on the cover. Probably gold.
  • A sticker with every physical purchase. Believe me, so good.
  • First 50 backers will receive a Trump's Space Force patch, from the first campaign we were affiliated with!
  • Delivered on time. Everything's already done and going to print!

The Wall-Might trilogy means a lot to us. It marks the conclusion of our political parodies while at the same time celebrating the root of our success: it is a physical example, we feel, of how anything can done well if treated seriously (even a farce, comedy, or parody). We have this series to thank for our 2 years of content and for being the springboard for countless ideas: for you, we hope that the the humor in our storytelling serves as a reminder of the roller coaster ride in the world of politics from 2016 to 2020.

story:
America's Deadliest Biological Weapon

BLACK HOPS tells the tale of U.S.A-*-G.I. , the dauntless, highly trained special missions rabbit who has worked with the United States military to take out high-profile targets for over half a century. Found in the atomic aftermath of World War II, the leporid that would eventually be U.S.A.-*-G.I. began to display abilities that superseded those typified for his species. These include but are not limited to:

  • Sub-human intelligence
  • Increased strength
  • Indefinite longevity
  • Optic camouflage
  • Communication with animals in and outside his own species

Task Force 22114 -- codenamed BLACK HOPS -- was commissioned by President Dwight D. Eisenhower and is the revolving support team that has escorted U.S.A.-*-G.I. on missions throughout the years.

 

BUNS OF THE PATRIOTS

After being decommissioned in the early 21st century, U.S.A.-*-G.I. retired to his family's home at the Freling Ranch in Belton, Texas.

It wasn't long before duty called once again, and he was sent into the heart of North Korea to prevent a ballistic missile from striking Hawaii in the morning hours of January 13, 2018.

 

HARE TRIGGER

At 1900 hours on July 3, 2019, the private military group Ningen (which was originally hired to protect the underground military base on Hart Island, New York) seized control of the island and the R&D being conducted in its underwater facilities. The leader of Ningen, Hare Trigger, has partnered with the paperclipped bio-terrorist leader, Apex Moth, who was being held captive underneath the island for his invaluable research.

U.S.A.-*-G.I. and Task Force 22114 have a three-fold objective:

  1. Destroy all biological weapons
  2. Cut off all possible escape routes
  3. Detain or eliminate Apex Moth and Hare Trigger

This time, U.S.A.-*-G.I will not be alone: he is joined by newcomers Patriot-R and Rigor Tortoise, who each have origins of their own.

What You'll Get:

Black Hops: Hare Trigger is both a direct sequel and a soft reboot, good for new readers as well as those who enjoyed the first volume. With this campaign, we are offering a 68 page book that tells one cohesive tale with two artists following U.S.A.-*-G.I. , Patriot-R, Rigor Tortoise, and Penelope separately in a unique form of visual and physical storytelling.

  • Mission: U.S.A.-*-G.I.
  • Mission: Patriot-R
  • Mission: Penelope (EXCLUSIVE to IndieGoGo)

We are also grateful this time around to have partnered with a handful of talented individuals to augment the finished product. This includes additional art by Reagan Long, covers by Kelsey Shannon, CuteSexyRobutts and Genzoman, graphic design by Jess and Stephanie Lopez, and a charity pinup by Weapon Outfitters, model River Breann, and her animal rescue Pacific Northwest Rescue. Many of these will be available at checkout as add-on items.

Partnering with first-time crowdfunded-comics publisher Iconic Comics and getting multimedia support from Spicy Ramen Productions, we are guaranteeing the book to be printed and fulfilled on or before December, 2019. 98% of the book is already completed, including the U.S.A.-*-G.I. portion.

 

Stretch Goals

As in our previous campaigns, increased funding simply means our customers are helping to build a better book. The goals we have are as follows:

  • $8,500: 68 page book is funded, which includes the Mission: Penelope backup story
  • $15,000: The squarebound option is added to give the book better binding
  • $20,000: Foil lettering will be added to the cover and cover stock upgraded
  • $35,000: Every backer gets a BLACK HOPS patch with their order
  • $40,000: An additional 4 pages will be added for a 72 page book in total

We Have The Men: We Have the Mission

When Black Hops debuted in 2018, it was an instant sleeper hit, selling out in stores nationwide. Debuting with covers by Dave Dorman and published by Antarctic Press, it sold out within 24 hours at Midtown Comics in Manhattan. U.S.A.-*-G.I. has since appeared as a cameo character in issues of Punchline and RAGS, with a team-up between all 3 properties scheduled to debut in 2020.

BLACK HOPS: Hare Trigger reunites the creative team of writer Mark Pellegrini and artist Timothy Lim. Joining them on Hare Trigger for the first time will be the Punchline creative team, with Matthew Weldon on art and Bill Williams lettering.

Timothy Lim is a professional illustrator and political cartoonist from the state of Arkansas. With more than 8 years of industry experience working as a freelance merchandising and cover artist for several franchises, he has created and illustrated multiple works with co-creator Mark Pellegrini within the last 2 years that have gone on to be major bestsellers. These include but are not limited to Thump: The First Bundred Days, Black Hops: U.S.A.-*-G.I., My Hero Magademia, and Wall-Might. He recently partnered with writer Chuck Dixon on Trump's Space Force and Douglas Ernst on Soulfinder: Demon's Match.

Matthew Weldon is a professional comic book artist whose work has been published by Antarctic Press, Image Comics, DC/Vertigo, Udon Entertainment, and Overground Comics. He was nominated for two Harvey Awards, and awarded Best All Ages Comic with Gladstone's School for World Conquerors in 2009 by MTV. Some of his works have appeared on the G4 channel and can even be found in the Guinness Book of World Records. He currently resides in Texas with his wife and children.

Bill Williams writes and letters PUNCHLINE, a monthly ongoing comic book from
Antarctic Press that was being featured on Free Comic Book Day 2019.  After starting as an inking assistant for Keith Wilson in the 1990’s, Bill created Amazon with Robb Phipps. He inked Bill Willingham’s Pantheon series as well as the Batman 66' / Wonder Woman '77 crossover. He also wrote Spike: The Devil You Know, Justice League Unlimited #26, and Robin #146 and #147 (with Bill Willingham). He currently lives in Austin, Texas.

story:
SAN DIABLOS

Veronica Valdez lives in San Diego with her family.  She has grown up here with her parents and two older twin brothers- Victor and Vicente. Veronica lives a regular life as a Catholic school teacher at Saint Pius X and spending time with her best friend Emily Chen, while her brother Vicente is manager of a bar Downtown.  Victor has been living in Colorado for a few years with his wife where he works as a firefighter, and has grown distant from his siblings over the last few years.

Everyone is thrown for a loop when their grandmother, and the matriarch of the family, passes away, bringing them together for the funeral.  When the body goes missing days before the funeral, they must investigate, but when Victor is kidnapped too, seemingly by the same thing, they must figure out what did this.

With the help of an underestimated rookie cop, Rebecca Holt, Veronica and Vicente discover an unknown world of demons throughout San Diego and must team up to stop them. All the demons, they notice, seem to come from Latin American myths, legends, and folklore.

This is San Diablos.

Meet the Characters

VERONICA VALDEZ

Veronica Valdez would not consider herself a badass. She's a Catholic school teacher who, between grading homework, living with her parents, and taking the bus to work, doesn't get to spend much time on herself. She spends every day going through the motions, but when she finds out about the world of demons living right under her nose, she makes the choice to not be passive and to do something about it.

REBECCA HOLT

Rebecca Holt recently moved from Miami to join the San Diego Police Department, and she's tired of being underestimated. She notices the weird and mysterious things that people tend to overlook or write off as coincidence, but no one ever believes her, even if she's right. She became a cop to help people and that's what she's going to do, even if she has to occasionally go outside the law to do it.

VICENTE VALDEZ

Vicente Valdez is a people person. He's energetic, personable, spontaneous, and great at thinking on his feet; it's what makes him such a great bartender. It also, coincidentally, makes him a great demon hunter too.

We need your help!

San Diablos has been a passion project of ours for a few years now. We've spent a long time discussing, developing, brainstorming, sketching, planning, writing, etc. Now that we're actually executing it, we want to make it a great experience for the audience and we'd love to produce the best quality work we can as quickly as possible! We don't want you to have to wait months or years between updates. We want to give you new content consistently, and we also want to eventually be able to print out copies of the completed issues in book form.

What we need to do that is some new equipment. Tablets, computers, photoshop, and other stuff we need can be expensive. We only need a little bit to offset the cost, so we don't have to worry about breaking the bank and our only concern is creating the best story we can.

Thank you!

Thank you for reading, donating, sharing, and supporting our work! For more updates, you can follow us on Twitter and Tumblr. We couldn't make San Diablos happen without you!

She's a Catholic school teacher who, between grading homework, living with her parents, and taking the bus to work, doesn't get to spend much time on herself. She spends every day going through the motions, but when she finds out about the world of demons living right under her nose, she makes the choice to not be passive and to do something about it.REBECCA HOLTRebecca Holt recently moved from Miami to join the San Diego Police Department, and she's tired of being underestimated. She notices the weird and mysterious things that people tend to overlook or write off as coincidence, but no one ever believes her, even if she's right. She became a cop to help people and that's what she's going to do, even if she has to occasionally go outside the law to do it.VICENTE VALDEZVicente Valdez is a people person. He's energetic, personable, spontaneous, and great at thinking on his feet; it's what makes him such a great bartender. It also, coincidentally, makes him a great demon hunter too.We need your help!San Diablos has been a passion project of ours for a few years now. We've spent a long time discussing, developing, brainstorming, sketching, planning, writing, etc. Now that we're actually executing it, we want to make it a great experience for the audience and we'd love to produce the best quality work we can as quickly as possible! We don't want you to have to wait months or years between updates. We want to give you new content consistently, and we also want to eventually be able to print out copies of the completed issues in book form.What we need to do that is some new equipment. Tablets, computers, photoshop, and other stuff we need can be expensive. We only need a little bit to offset the cost, so we don't have to worry about breaking the bank and our only concern is creating the best story we can.Thank you!Thank you for reading, donating, sharing, and supporting our work! For more updates, you can follow us on Twitter and Tumblr. We couldn't make San Diablos happen without you!

story:
For our next exciting comic anthology, Stache has chosen to explore the seven deadly sins. This collection of shorts will feature seven individual stories exploring these vices in different manners from humor, to action, to drama and using a variety of art styles and techniques. The comic will be standard sized, full color, with approximately 50 pages.

We are raising funds to print the comic to debut at Project Comic Con in St. Louis, MO.  All of the funds raised will go directly to printing and shipping costs. In short: the more we raise, the more books we can print.

What follows is an early taste of what the anthology has in store for backers. Keep in mind that these pages are just early works in progress; final pages may vary. 

Gluttony - Art by Ellis Ray III & Colors/Words by Anthony Mathenia

The world's "biggest" foodie travels to the jungles of Africa in search of something forbidden he hasn't tasted yet -- the other white meat.

Sloth by Jordan Williams

The world around her is drowned out by a flurry of button clicks.

Lust by Lauren Ousley

A glance at a girl across the coffee shop unleashes a poetic tale of love and longing.

Wrath  - Art by Aaron Pittman, Written by David Tickner

Spurned by a lover, a jilted gypsy unleashes a terrible curse.

Pride - Art by Barry Lincoln, Written by Nikki Gress

What happens when a celebrated pastor stops believing in God? 

Envy by Ryan Lawson

To his neighbors he appears to have it all, but the man in the mansion desires something that money can't buy. 

Greed - Art by Randy Jordan, Written by Drew Rose

On the night before his wedding, a gangster travels to Mexico to pull off a heist, only to find that someone is already robbing the bank.

 

ABOUT THE CREATORS

Stache is a creative collective engaged in the promotion of comic and sequential art in Southern Illinois. We do this by bringing together creators, artists, and writers to collaborate on comics like this anthology. Some of our key contributors had formerly never stepped foot into a comic book shop before. We are planning additional community outreach throughout Southern Illinois including sponsoring comic book programs for children. Why? Because we love comics and believe the format is a thrilling, engaging avenue for personal artistic expression and storytelling!

We sincerely appreciate your pledge that helps us to continue to keep telling our own stories! Please support this campaign by backing us and sharing. We can't do it without you!

Your friends at Stache!

story:
Probl-o-Matic is the story of Greg and his friends who are far more interesting than him. Observe the nose-bleed peaks, mundane tundra, and horrific valleys of his daily life as he fails to talk to girls, navigates imaginary friendship with his best frienemy, and steals time from his coworker whose wife may or may not believe they are gay for each other.

My name's George Alexopoulos. I've been writing and drawing this strip for almost ten years! Despite printing small runs of the series in the past, I've always wanted to collect all 500+ black and white strips into a single volume. Your contributions will help me assemble & edit the book, add bonus content, fund a sizable print run, and help me secure time to draw even more strips.

If this campaign exceeds its budget, I'd even love to animate a fully voiced mini-cartoon to celebrate!

Read the series archive on Webtoon, here: https://www.webtoons.com/en/challenge/probl-o-m...

My website: http://StudioNJ.com

story:
The RE-Creation Project is a comic book series about a former rapper who comes into the Knowledge of Self that he is God and when an invasion of inter-dimensional serpent humanoids invade Earth, he becomes humanity's only and last hope of survival as religion, philosophy, and the Universe all come into question...

At its core, this five issue limited comic book series is an examination of a multiplicity of ideas about God, mankind, religion, philosophy, Universe, and the human condition told through the vehicle of storytelling...  

Being an English teacher and former professor of Religion, I've put a lot of myself into The RE-Creation Project, my thoughts and ideas, matters that I have considered, but not as a method to evangelize because there's no religion dominant in the story. Rather, The RE-Creation Project is a religious and philosophical manifesto in comic book form that seeks to explore the human condition and all its potential, from the baseness of our instinct for survival to the high reaching possibility of our own divinity. This story is meant to challenge its readers as the characters course through some of humanity's worst fears come true.

The RE-Creation Project Issue 1 is a 32 page full-color comic. For right now, the story will be a five issue series created and written by me with art from Morgan Sawyer and Scappatticci.  The book is finished and we are seeking funding for production and distribution. This is truly an indie comic looking to find its niche and audience. 

Take a moment to...

Check out our cool perks. Everything is art based for the collector in all of us, with very specific exclusives. We truly hope that you will take this journey with us as we attempt to tell a thrilling apocalyptic story that challenges the convention. 

Please help us get the word out for this 18-day campaign, making as much noise as you can and boosting signals. If possible utilize the Indiegogo share tools as well! Thank you for your support and for supporting indie comics in general.

Read a preview of Issue 1 here: 

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1isyYHTRQFEA82...

story:
Building the Junkyard

 

 Art is my life. It provides me with comfort through difficult times and satisfies my creative impulses. It enables my imagination to soar and serves as a platform of inspiration to others. My art has allowed me to explore a great part of the United States and with access to the internet, art helped me to connect with so many people around the world! It has taken me to festivals in New York City and generated conversations between strangers and attracted the attention of curious children. Art has given me experiences to share.

   I began to win art contests in elementary school and my work began to sell in high school. Although my parents couldn’t afford to enroll me into an art school, I continued to create! I supported my work while performing janitorial tasks and as a laborer. The only happiness I discovered in any of those jobs, were through the friends I made with my art and the money they provided to purchase my supplies.

   Junkyard began in 1998 while working as a screen printer. I left work and went directly to New York Music to make my last payment on a Fender Stratocaster, a guitar I have wanted to own since I was a teenager. I stopped at Sully’s for dinner and didn’t want to leave the guitar in my vehicle, so I brought into the restaurant with me. A woman sitting a couple of tables over referred to me as a street rat and his guitar. My vision had arrived! Eugene “Blind Mellow” Jefferson was born!

   As Junkyard developed, so did my artistic skills! I began to work in the third dimension by sculpting the characters with polymer clay. I was so excited when I completed a whole set of 12! I showed them to my friends and family asked what I was planning to do with them. I created packaging for them and began took them to a few local craft shows. Children gravitated to them and parents asked how much are they. I knew that if I could get them massed produced, I could sell them all day long! Many others asked for the story surrounding them. I could only share a small amount of it in words because I didn’t have a book created to share with them. 

   In 2009, my job was lost due to a continuing lack of business. I went to school to learn how to put Junkyard together for a book or a cartoon. While attending ITT Technical Institute, I even assembled Junkyard into a board game! Before graduation, we had the chance to present our work at an open house. The whole Junkyard theme gained a lot of attention and the same feedback. It has huge potential, but money and location are two revolving stumbling blocks. 

   The amount of money I need to generate complete this mission is way out of my reach. I am hoping to bring my Junkyard dream into reality with your generous support. Together, we will inspire others with an uplifting story of courage and hope!

 

With your help

   Replication of scuplted figurines of the characters from the story, Screen printed t-shirts, Embroidered polos, Game replication, Full color graphic novels, Coffee mugs, Music soundtracks to accompnay the graphic novels, A trade show booth the resembles a junkyard, Display tables, Lighting for the display, Van with large format printing of Junkyard artwork to drive to comic cons around the United States, Marketing and Advertising expenses, Mascot costumes of 2 main characters to wear while promoting Junkyard, a website set up for ecommerce, Large posters, and any other unseen prodution expenses. I would even be willing to include the highest investor as a business partner!

story:
The Story

Fleeing the oppression of WWII Germany, Avery and her parents move to a remote town on the border of France. It is here she finds her new best friend, a cat named Nook. But, there is more to this cat than it seems.

Avery is swept up into a deadly cycle of violence, and she will come to both fear and love her fuzzy new friend as the dark and twisted history of her new home is revealed.

Origins

This story is a culmination of demented dreams, family history, and my love for Guillermo del Toro's style of storytelling. From The Devil's Backbone to Pan's Labyrinth and Crimson Peak, I love the way he uses ghosts and mystical creatures to create an atmosphere of terror to reflect deeper meanings and develop tragic stories. I'm always intrigued by stories that appear to be scary on the surface but have many more layers and meanings. 

Nook is inspired by these stories, and I hope when you experience it you will discover that there is much more to this little tale than meets the eye.

The Cycle Repeats

This book has become very timely and universaly relateable. It explores the cyclical nature of human tragedy and how we are doomed to repeat the past if we cannot learn from it.

Marcelo and I started work on this book through Patreon about a year and a half ago. We had no idea how timely the story would become. This is the tale of refugees and survivors; families torn apart by violence, greed, and hate. 

Sadly... the cycle is constantly repeating in our world.

 

The Team:

CALEB THUSAT

Creator/Writer

Creator and writer of Alter-Life, ZED, and Nook, I'm a former filmmaker turned comic book creator, and I'm looking to bring unique and exciting stories to the vast world of the independent comic industry. I have run 9 successful crowdfunding campaigns in the past 3 years including one other Hardcover Graphic Novel. It's my passion to create great comics. I love the process, and I am in love with the medium. 

Owner of Village Comics: www.villagecomicbooks.com

Village Comics Patreon: www.patreon.com/villagecomics

MARCELO BIOTT

Artist/Letterer

Marcelo Biott is an artist born and raised in Chicago. His art is heavily inspired by his life long love for comics, science fiction stories, and every bit of pop culture he can get his hands on. He creates images and stories you've never thought of, but wish you did. He enjoys robots, hot wings, and writing/illustrating his comic InfraCity.

Website: https://www.themarcelo.com

Infracity Webcomic: http://infracity.thecomicseries.com

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/infracity

Music for our Kickstarter Video was provided by www.bensound.com

 

Free 11 Page Preview

As a vote of confidence in the story we are creating, here is a preview of the first 11 pages.

story:
GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH IS STILL AVAILABLE!

Books and select perks can be ordered until the book goes to print!

 

ART UPDATE!

I'm working up a massive double-page spread.  Carnage!

 

 

WHAT IS GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH?

Martians kidnapped Nova Marcos' son! Her only chance to save him lies with an abandoned gunship and an inmate with a life sentence who commanded the ship decades before. But this gunship has a secret: It's alive!

After spending 30 years abandoned in a junk yard, their self-aware transforming gunship might have some trust issues.

 

THE BOOK

This is a 64 page (at least) perfect bound graphic novel in full color with letters by the most prolific letterer in indie comics today, Eric Weathers!

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS!

Stretch Goals Unlocked!

 

$30K STRETCH GOAL -UNLOCKED!

YOUR VERY OWN BLOCKHEDZ FIGURE (ONE WITH EVERY BOOK!)

At $30k every comic will come with your very own robot courtesy of http://www.blockhedz.com/

 

 

$25K STRETCH GOAL-UNLOCKED!

There will now be a fan art section added onto the book! If you want to submit your own GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH art, send it to gunshipthunderpunch@gmail.com by Aug 31st!

At the $25k mark I'm going to add a fan art section to the back of the book! That's right, your  GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH art right there to show off to the world! I've been getting some great images from you all, so I figured we might as well collect them all in one place!

 

$20K STRETCH GOAL-UNLOCKED!

At $20k each book will come with a collectible trading card set!

 

$15K STRETCH GOAL - UNLOCKED!

Announcing our first stretch goal! At $15k GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH will have a variant cover by IDW fan favorite Transformers artist ALEX MILNE!

Variant Cover Inks!

Robots and ships are my obsession and I love adventure. I'm chomping at the bit to get this story underway and in your hands!

 

 

 

WHAT CAN YOU GET?

In addition to the book itself you can get:

  • prints
  • bookmarks
  • original sketches
  • my 116 page art book, The Art of Brian Shearer Vol. 1! There's only a limited number of the art books left, so be sure to get in early if you'd like to snag it!
  • Stretch Goal Surprises!

Oh and if you haven't signed up for the mailing list be sure to get in on that! http://www.gunship-thunderpunch.com

 

This book is an absolute blast to draw and it's going to be an even bigger blast TO READ!

 

 

 

Thanks so much for coming aboard GUNSHIP THUNDERPUNCH! Help spread the word! Let's do this!
