story:
Alpha X: A Jam Comic by the Twin Cities Comic Collective


The Xenos are coming, and humanity's only hope is the world's most accomplished super soldier: Alpha X! This ass-kicking gal doesn't need any help protecting the solar system from the alien scourge--but we DO need YOU to make the battle possible! Your donation not only gets you some great original and independent artwork, but it also provides an opportunity for a group of 12 dedicated artists to bring their creation to Minnesota's largest comic convention audience at Wizard World Minneapolis!

As an homage to the golden age of pulp science fiction, the story and style of Alpha X harkens back to outer space adventure comics from the 1930s, 1940s, and 1950s. This was an era when the most talented comic creators worked together in legendary studios to churn out stories and images that would change our cultural landscape while projecting readers into the furthest reaches of the universe and into the deepest limits of human potential. Similarly, the members of the Twin Cities Comic Collective (TC3) have set out to work together to bring you an adventure that we hope will captivate your imagination in the same way that the comics of your youth did on lazy Saturday mornings. 

In creating Alpha X, nothing was done on an individual basis. The story creation and script writing were jointly completed by Lucas Munson and David Jensen, two talented comic authors with a passion for science fiction and stories of outer space. Page layout and design was discussed as a collective and then executed by Jeff Kulisek, an accomplished comic author and illustrator in his own right. Once layouts were completed, professional illustrators Doug Kallberg, Jack Kotz, Scott Rolfs, Jack Montgomery, Brad Perri, Brock Beauchamp, Phil Juliano, and Joe Rheault helped Jeff pencil and ink the pages. When one artist had completed penciling a page, he would pass it off to another artist to complete the inking. This method produced 34 distinctive illustrated styles—one for each page of story content seen throughout this ambitious comic book. After inking was completed, multi-talented artist Cory Fox added a classic color palette to bring the illustrations to life. Finally, Doug finished with color shading and detail throughout the book. As a result of this collaborative effort, every single page marries the talents of a minimum of six artists, creating a unique yet unified artistic style. It is a project unlike anything you've seen before, and it truly highlights the incredible skill that the members of the TC3 bring the the flourishing Twin Cities comic scene. 

This first 40-page full-color issue (part one of three) is bursting with original story ideas and artwork, concept illustrations, and companion materials. Printed in partnership with a family-owned Twin Cities press, every single step of the creative process celebrates local artistry and an independent aesthetic. With this in mind, we hope that our hard work and dedication to "thinking local" will make you proud to support our growing group of home-town hopefuls.

When thinking of how to reward those who choose to donate to our campaign, we wanted to provide exciting and original perks that are both one-of-a-kind and out-of-the-ordinary. These will all be handled with the care and professionalism that people expect from the TC3. Every piece is unique to this campaign, and we believe all of the items truly celebrate the independent nature of our artistry. 

As for timing, we know we are right on track with our goal. Currently, we are putting the finishing touches on coloring and detail work for the last half of the story pages. The entirety of the book will be ready in early April, and printing will be completed before the first day of Wizard World Minneapolis, May 1st. This is definitely not our first rodeo; as a group, we have self-released over 20 different comic projects--a few of which were also supported through crowd-funding endeavors. We are very confident in our ability to meet our deadlines, and we will not disappoint our backers. As soon as we receive our funding after the close of our campaign, we will begin creating and ordering all perk items. It is our goal to have all perks in the mail by May 31st. 

One additional note: we recognize that those donating to our fund are paying more than they usually would for some products that are for sale in comic shops or at conventions. Certainly, your donation goes toward covering the costs of producing our perks, but the vast majority of the earnings on this campaign will be used to create a presence at the Wizard World Comic Convention in Minneapolis, May 1st thought the 3rd. We will be paying for a bank of five artist tables ($350 each), banners, advertising, and promotional materials. The cost of these items, the fees spent on hosting this campaign, and the taxes for the “income” we earn from it will be covered if we are able to meet our goal of $2,000. Any additional funding raised above and beyond our goal will be put toward the printing of books and posters to be sold at future conventions and in local comic book shops. With your help, we will be able to avoid using our own funds for these endeavors and potentially create an opportunity to earn a modest profit on the books that we sell. Usually, our hundreds of hours of hard work are primarily rewarded by our love of our craft, the pride of a professionally completed project, and the sense of joy that we see in finding people that are interested in what we have made. Your donation gives us one more facet of success: a few dollars to help pay for our expenses. So, please, consider your donation more than just the purchase price of a physical item. Your donation goes toward so much more. We truly can not thank you enough for helping support our passion for making comic books. (However, we will try. Here goes…)

Thank you so very much from the bottom of our little ink-stained hearts. We love and appreciate each and every one of you.

Perk Details

Any Amount

We certainly appreciate all donations of any amount and never take generosity for granted. So, regardless of whether you donate to receive a perk or simply pass along the word to your friends through social media, every little bit helps. 

$5 Donation

At the $5 level (and any level above and beyond), you'll be one of the very first people to read issue #1 of Alpha X! We'll send you a 44+ page full-color PDF full of story, work-in-progress sketches and illustrations, supplementals, and anything else we find that we think you might enjoy. Based on our timeline, you should receive your PDF before the end of April. 


$10 Donation
At the $10 level, you'll receive the PDF and a hand-drawn sketch card from one member of the TC3. You'll choose the member, we'll choose an Alpha-X related image to create for you on an Alpha-X branded "trading card." Here are a selection of cards from our members that have been commissioned in the past:


$15 Donation
At $15, we will send you the PDF and an official Alpha X poster with artwork by Doug Kallberg. Signed by every member of the TC3, the poster features the cover art of issue #1. 


$20 Donation
$20 brings you the main event: issue #1 of Alpha X! This bad mama features 40 full-color pages, the complete first story arc, sketches, concept art, behind-the-scenes content, and more. Your issue will be signed by every member of the TC3 and will include a hand-drawn sketch on the inside cover. These will truly be one-of-a-kind! (And you'll get a PDF for early viewing while we wait for printing.)


$30 Donation
For the first 10 donors at the $30 level, we have a comic and poster bundle package. Everything that's included in the $15 and $20 level will be yours at a nice little discount. Thanks for being an early supporter! 


$40 Donation
So you want to show off our awesome Alpha X artwork everywhere you go? At $40, your donation gets you the deluxe PDF and an Alpha X t-shirt featuring the full-color cover image by Doug Kallberg. A 100% black cotton tee will be ordered in your requested size.


$50 Donation
Interested in putting some original artwork up on your wall? A $50 donation will get you the deluxe PDF and an 11"x17" original sketch from any requested member of the TC3. You'll name the subject, they'll do the artwork. This could be a detailed black-and-white inked image or a full-color pen-and-marker sketch. Everything is open to discussion. In fact, the concept for Alpha X came out of an original piece of commissioned art by Doug Kallberg (pictured below). 


$125 - $200 Donation
If you're as taken with the art in this book as we are, you might like to grab yourself an original page or two from issue #1 of Alpha X. Each page features the original inks, so you'll get to see everything before the digital removal of pencils and/or blue lines. If you love to see an artist's process, these are the items for you. Each page is signed by the artists responsible for pencils and inks and is embossed with the official TC3 seal of authenticity. They are all absolutely beautiful and obviously one-of-a-kind. Plus, you'll get the deluxe PDF and a physical copy of issue #1 as previously listed.

Page #12 features pencil work by Scott Rolfs and inks by Doug Kallberg. 
$125


Page # 20 features pencil work by Brock Beauchamp and inks by Doug Kallberg.
  $125


Page #21 features pencil work by Jeff Kulisek and inks by Jack Montgomery. 
$125


Pages #22-23 feature pencil work by Scott Rolfs and inks by Jeff Kulisek. 
$200


Pages #24-25 feature pencil work by Scott Rolfs and inks by Jack Montgomery. 
$200


Page #27 features pencil work by Jeff Kulisek and inks by Doug Kallberg. 
$125


Page #29 features pencil work by Doug Kallberg and inks by Jeff Kulisek. 
$125


Pages #32-33 feature pencil work by Jack Montgomery and inks by Jeff Kulisek. 
$200


Purchasers of original artwork, please note: in June of 2015, all original pages from Alpha X will be on display in the Rosemount library as a part of the RAAC Art Blast. Following the show, your original page(s) will be mailed to you in highly protective packaging with insurance and delivery confirmation. As a donor to this level of the campaign, you will be listed as a guest of honor at the show's opening reception. 


$250 Donation

Looking to be a big part of the future of Alpha X? Three lucky donors of $250 will be given the chance to be immortalized by the TC3 as a character in issue #2 of Alpha X! You'll receive an original inked page featuring your character signed by all artists responsible for the page's content. It will also be embossed with the official TC3 seal of authenticity. Plus, you'll get the deluxe PDF and a physical copy of issue #1 as previously listed.


$500 Donation

Finally, we've made it to the big one: the $500 "Honorary TC3 Member" Wizard World 2015 Alpha X release-party-guest-of-honor! Join us for all three days of the convention: we'll pay for your admission and your lunch each day, we'll have you hang with us behind the TC3 bank of tables (if you want--honorary members are allowed to celebrate with other people at the con, too--we get it--it's cool), we'll give you everything in the $5 through $50 dollar reward tiers, you'll get to be a character in issue #2 and keep your character's inked page, you'll get as many high-fives as we can muster, and if you're a betting person, I'd suggest putting money on getting a whole lot of other great stuff too! This weekend is going to be an absolute blast, and we hope you'll join us in the celebration! (Sorry--we cannot pay for your transportation to the show or weekend lodging.)



ONE LAST THING!

In the spirit of “stretch goals,” if we are able to raise $3,000 or more during this campaign, we will upgrade all of the printed books being delivered to our backers at no additional charge! Only available from this IndieGoGo campaign, your issue of Alpha X will feature a high-quality card stock cover (perfect for a more detailed original sketch) and will be numbered to commemorate the truly limited nature of this run of comics. 


Let's Wrap This Up

You did it! You read the whole thing! Since you're this invested, you might as well throw a couple bucks our way... I mean, it IS a cool project, right? 

Right. 

Again, thank you so much for your support and donations. This is truly going to be something special. And please be sure to spread the word about Alpha X--we know everyone who gets their hands on these exclusives will absolutely love them!
story_txt:
Alpha X: A Jam Comic by the Twin Cities Comic Collective

The Xenos are coming, and humanity's only hope is the world's most accomplished super soldier: Alpha X! This ass-kicking gal doesn't need any help protecting the solar system from the alien scourge--but we DO need YOU to make the battle possible! Your donation not only gets you some great original and independent artwork, but it also provides an opportunity for a group of 12 dedicated artists to bring their creation to Minnesota's largest comic convention audience at Wizard World Minneapolis!

As an homage to the golden age of pulp science fiction, the story and style of Alpha X harkens back to outer space adventure comics from the 1930s, 1940s, and 1950s. This was an era when the most talented comic creators worked together in legendary studios to churn out stories and images that would change our cultural landscape while projecting readers into the furthest reaches of the universe and into the deepest limits of human potential. Similarly, the members of the Twin Cities Comic Collective (TC3) have set out to work together to bring you an adventure that we hope will captivate your imagination in the same way that the comics of your youth did on lazy Saturday mornings. 

In creating Alpha X, nothing was done on an individual basis. The story creation and script writing were jointly completed by Lucas Munson and David Jensen, two talented comic authors with a passion for science fiction and stories of outer space. Page layout and design was discussed as a collective and then executed by Jeff Kulisek, an accomplished comic author and illustrator in his own right. Once layouts were completed, professional illustrators Doug Kallberg, Jack Kotz, Scott Rolfs, Jack Montgomery, Brad Perri, Brock Beauchamp, Phil Juliano, and Joe Rheault helped Jeff pencil and ink the pages. When one artist had completed penciling a page, he would pass it off to another artist to complete the inking. This method produced 34 distinctive illustrated styles—one for each page of story content seen throughout this ambitious comic book. After inking was completed, multi-talented artist Cory Fox added a classic color palette to bring the illustrations to life. Finally, Doug finished with color shading and detail throughout the book. As a result of this collaborative effort, every single page marries the talents of a minimum of six artists, creating a unique yet unified artistic style. It is a project unlike anything you've seen before, and it truly highlights the incredible skill that the members of the TC3 bring the the flourishing Twin Cities comic scene. This first 40-page full-color issue (part one of three) is bursting with original story ideas and artwork, concept illustrations, and companion materials. Printed in partnership with a family-owned Twin Cities press, every single step of the creative process celebrates local artistry and an independent aesthetic. With this in mind, we hope that our hard work and dedication to "thinking local" will make you proud to support our growing group of home-town hopefuls.

When thinking of how to reward those who choose to donate to our campaign, we wanted to provide exciting and original perks that are both one-of-a-kind and out-of-the-ordinary. These will all be handled with the care and professionalism that people expect from the TC3. Every piece is unique to this campaign, and we believe all of the items truly celebrate the independent nature of our artistry. 

As for timing, we know we are right on track with our goal. Currently, we are putting the finishing touches on coloring and detail work for the last half of the story pages. The entirety of the book will be ready in early April, and printing will be completed before the first day of Wizard World Minneapolis, May 1st. This is definitely not our first rodeo; as a group, we have self-released over 20 different comic projects--a few of which were also supported through crowd-funding endeavors. We are very confident in our ability to meet our deadlines, and we will not disappoint our backers. As soon as we receive our funding after the close of our campaign, we will begin creating and ordering all perk items. It is our goal to have all perks in the mail by May 31st. 

One additional note: we recognize that those donating to our fund are paying more than they usually would for some products that are for sale in comic shops or at conventions. Certainly, your donation goes toward covering the costs of producing our perks, but the vast majority of the earnings on this campaign will be used to create a presence at the Wizard World Comic Convention in Minneapolis, May 1st thought the 3rd. We will be paying for a bank of five artist tables ($350 each), banners, advertising, and promotional materials. The cost of these items, the fees spent on hosting this campaign, and the taxes for the “income” we earn from it will be covered if we are able to meet our goal of $2,000. Any additional funding raised above and beyond our goal will be put toward the printing of books and posters to be sold at future conventions and in local comic book shops. With your help, we will be able to avoid using our own funds for these endeavors and potentially create an opportunity to earn a modest profit on the books that we sell. Usually, our hundreds of hours of hard work are primarily rewarded by our love of our craft, the pride of a professionally completed project, and the sense of joy that we see in finding people that are interested in what we have made. Your donation gives us one more facet of success: a few dollars to help pay for our expenses. So, please, consider your donation more than just the purchase price of a physical item. Your donation goes toward so much more. We truly can not thank you enough for helping support our passion for making comic books. (However, we will try. Here goes…)

Thank you so very much from the bottom of our little ink-stained hearts. We love and appreciate each and every one of you.

story:
Welcome to the NEXT GENERATION of THE TRASH COMPACTOR SHOW merchandise!

We here at the TRASH COMPACTOR SHOW know how important your ADULT BEVERAGES are in ComicsGate and we proudly present to you this LIMITED EDITION CAN COOZY!!

Keep your Coors COLD and your Toddy's HOT with this HIGH QUALITY CAN COOZY.

EMBLAZENED with all your FAVORITE E-CELEBRITY SUPERSTARS from the #1 HIT SHOW on YOUTUBE... The TRASH COMPACTOR!

Join SOY RAGE, RUKUS, SUNSHINE, THE DETECTIVE, THE JAZZ CRAB, ALAZMAT, ELSEED, COMICSGATE CARL AND CARLA, DAILY BOGUS, MISTER YONOFUI, CIDER HYPE, GEORGE'S DINNER, REDD WOOKIE, WIGGLE WIGGLE, LIME'S DAD. and everyone's favorite host TESTEFY as you drink yourself into an alcholic stupor as you await COMICSGATE books that will never come.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your Money.

It's a CAN COOZY stupid.

 

 

The Impact

The impact on your social life will take a DRAMATIC turn for the better when you can show up at the next TWITTER BLOCK PARTY sporting this LIMITED EDITION COOZY.

Get that 2% female interaction when all the chumps are just standing there with NAKED SLIPPERY cans and you are the ONLY ONE holding this FASHIONABLE yet PRACTICAL item!

 

 

Did You Miss Out On Our First Campaign?... Not To Worry!

We only have a limited amount of the WWTD wristbands left.

Select the FEATURED perk to get the CAN COOZY and WRISTBAND together!

This way you can SHOW your TRASH COMPACTOR pride and go DOUBLE FISTING with a can in your hand and a band on your wrist!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Be one of the LESS THEN 50 people (allegedly) to watch the TRASH COMPACTOR SHOW live on YouTube at www.youtube.com/channel/UCyMIKDB-tnYKRPH85htp7dA

Share your support of the show on TWITTER, FACEBOOK and other SOCIAL MEDIA outlets so we can continue making these SUPERB PRODUCTS for you and your entire family.

story:
ZACK FRIDAY Sale

I'm packaging together all of the Perks that are in inventory at the Fulfillment Center:

  • THEOSOPHY Perk
  • IRON SIGHTS Perk
  • JAWBREAKERS Perk
  • SPLATTO Perk

IMMEDIATE FULFILLMENT

Because these Perks are already at the Fulfillment Center, all I need to do is generate a Backers List and they will be sent out the first week of December. Perks should arrive most countries before Christmas. Double-Check that your address is correct, because these will go out FAST.

ADD-ONS

In addition to the 4 Perk Tiers, you can Add-On extra Perks for no additional postage cost.

story:
Hop Dude leads a simple life with his brother and adopted baby. He's also the unknowing star of what could become the most popular video game franchise of all time.

What begins as a Mario parody comic slowly ascends into an exploration on the very nature of existence. Also, every comic's punchline is "Mama Mia." Funny, charming, and heartbreaking - the Hop Dude book will make a fantastic addition to your coffee table with this complete 250-page collection.

The Book

Available in both physical and digital editions, the Hop Dude complete collection is 8x6", full color, and nearly 250 pages. It's hardcover and the inside page weight is 105lb*. The plan is to order a super limited run of 1000, though we may make more if there's demand for it.

* Thanks to our backers, who unlocked these stretch goals!

If you want to power it up with a signature (and more!), you can choose from several special editions.  

Like this, but real!

Signed Edition

Your book will be signed, have a custom doodle inside, and I'll write you a short personal message based on whatever information you want to provide. A haiku about your favorite video game character? Musings on the philosophical importance of pasta? Whatever you're into, I'll write it!

Graffiti Edition

If you're feeling wild, get the super-limited "Graffiti Edition" - a copy of the book that's been personally vandalized throughout by the author. You'll get a nice, clean signed edition too. Only five available!

 

See something you like?

 

Funds breakdown

This math is approximate and subject to change if necessary.

story: I was looking around online because I knew I couldn't film this on my own, (I don't have the video cameras or anything) and I came across this place called 'Tacoma Productions'. T.P can make a movie out of anything you pay them, and I want to give them 1,500 because that should be enough for a ten minute movie. My ideal goal, is to raise more Epilepsy Awareness in the world, because that is a main issue in my book. Thanks for staying with me this far! :)

story:
My name is Susan Caldwell and I'm working on a graphic novel project titled "The Three Great Loves of Sean Bravo." It's a story about three very different women in love with the same man. I'll be releasing it in serialized chapters starting January 1 at www.threegreatloves.com.


The story is set in New York City in the year 2000, before the Twin Towers fell; before the market crashed; before gentrification came to Crown Heights, Bed-Stuy and Bushwick... 

(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Alan)

SEAN BRAVO is a deejay at a small but popular club in Manhattan nicknamed 730. He's essentially a cross between a ladies man and a serial monogamist, which gets him in trouble...

(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Danny Howard)

There's MARLENA, the fashion school dropout turned club promoter, who hired him to work at 730 when he was a nobody. She loves him to death, but her jealous streak gets the best of her. 

(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Bitch Cakes)

ALICIA is the object of Marlena's jealousy. She and Sean grew up together on the same block in Bushwick. She's always carried a torch for him but she knows she's not his type. A straight-A student, she's committed to her dream of becoming a doctor even though she has a young son to raise. 

(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Rustin)


KYLA appears out of nowhere and instantly steals Sean's heart. Fresh out of college, optimistic, ambitious, and eager for love, she moves from Alabama to New York to be with Sean and reinvent herself in the big city. 

SCENES FROM CHAPTER 1


Three Great Loves is more than a webcomic. In addition to the digital collage illustrations that tell the story online, I am also creating mixed-media collages that further explore the inner lives of the characters and reflect on the very special time and place that was New York City at the turn of the century. These mixed-media collages and print reproductions will be sold in the Three Great Loves Gift Shop as a way of monetizing the site. Your donations will help me pay for art supplies, printing and framing. Your donations will also help me market and promote the site (with flyers, posters, stickers, etc), pay the technical costs associated with maintaining a website, and pay my wonderful, beautiful, awesome models.



I'd greatly appreciate any and all support. I also welcome feedback. And please like Three Great Loves on facebook and check it out at www.threegreatloves.com.
story_txt:
My name is Susan Caldwell and I'm working on a graphic novel project titled "The Three Great Loves of Sean Bravo." It's a story about three very different women in love with the same man. I'll be releasing it in serialized chapters starting January 1 at www.threegreatloves.com.The story is set in New York City in the year 2000, before the Twin Towers fell; before the market crashed; before gentrification came to Crown Heights, Bed-Stuy and Bushwick... 


(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Alan)
SEAN BRAVO is a deejay at a small but popular club in Manhattan nicknamed 730. He's essentially a cross between a ladies man and a serial monogamist, which gets him in trouble...





(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Danny Howard)
There's MARLENA, the fashion school dropout turned club promoter, who hired him to work at 730 when he was a nobody. She loves him to death, but her jealous streak gets the best of her.

(background photo: Creative Commons image courtesy of Rustin)

story:
Suicidal immortal Kathryn Kennedy finds reasons to live -- and a way to die.

Disconnected and violent after 1,000 years as a Knight, she still saves the day, but then lets monsters kill her just to see if she'll stay dead. Biggest fan Erica could help her reconnect -- too bad Kathryn just stabbed her.

Kathryn doesn't know she holds the key to the world-changing power; terminal Jonathan MacKnight does, and he'll do anything to get it. Unless the man whose father Kathryn killed gets her first.

Hi, my name is Caley Tibbittz. I am trying to pay for the colorist I've hired for Eternal Knights by crowdfunding via IndieGoGo, and I could use your help.

This book means the world to me. Inspired by Disney's Gargoyles with a dash of Highlander, I have dedicated many years to honing the skills to bring it to life as a comic. Further inspired by the works of Joss Whedon and Warren Ellis, I been drawing and posting new pages of EK as a webcomic since March 2012. My regular readership and subscriber list are growing by the week.

I do all the writing, illustration, and lettering myself. I strive to complete 2 new pages per week around my day job and caring for my wife, who has cerebral palsy and uses a wheelchair. The only thing I DON'T do is COLOR the book -- I don't have time, nor enough computer color skill. I have found a wonderful colorist who brings out the best in my art. She charges a reasonable page rate, but...

I don't make a lot of money in my day job, where I have not gotten a raise in the three years I've been there. I can barely make ends meet month to month, and it would be an enormous strain to fund the coloring of Eternal Knights alone.

Eternal Knights is not just a fun flashy comic book -- it is a very personal story about trying to find meaning and reasons to live in the face of depression and suicidal ideation, something I suffered from for many years. That my wife has suffered the same and worse makes it resonate even more; she was at my side and assisting for much of the final major edit pass, and the heart of the story has become as much about her struggles as my own.

When I was at one of my lowest points, it was a nearby book with some helpful anti-suicide advice that saved my life; it is my hope that Eternal Knights will do the same for someone else. It's not a PSA, it's entertainment -- but it's entertainment built to resonate, to matter, to be a spark of light in the darkness if it needs to be.

I would be eternally (har) grateful to you for any contribution you can make, and any help you can provide in getting the word out for this campaign (there are share tools to use, yay).

All the funds raised will go toward coloring and printing the first issue. Any amount over the goal will be put toward coloring issue #2.


COOL REWARDS! Get new art done by me -- including a cover for your comic book -- or original art I made on the way to making Eternal Knights, featuring Spider-Man, Hellboy, Superman, and more! Lots of one of a kind treasures to be had.

Color will attract new online readers to EK, and will make the printed book more appealing at cons. Please help me in this first major step in making EK my day job. It's all I want to do.

Best Regards,

-Caley Tibbittz

story:
Our Story
Hello, my name is Leslie Carvery and I’m a full time Artist who lives to express myself creatively.
I‘ve been involved with many artistic forms over the years and this project is my passionate driving force; fueled by my sense of creativity, writing skills and passion for photography
This project allows me to bring friends and neighbors together, while working with and experiencing the 2 Cultures from which I’ve come to be; which is all part of a big dream.

The Impact
“Big Citi”, is the first of its kind. A photographic novel, with a story filled with great character. It has the potential to become a great source of entertainment for everyone. It is visual, yet poetic. It holds adventure, action and is believable with an exciting storyline. I desire the comic to be produced every other month; shooting at locations throughout Canada and beyond.

What We Need & What You Get
The funds raised will directly support the cost of printing. The proceeds, from selling the comic, will help pay the cast, wardrobe and other fees incurred.

Other Ways You Can Help
I am constantly seeking cool shooting locations, interesting people who want to be in the novel, props and vehicles to shoot in, like my fan pages. Please visit my site and bring good positive energy to my project. Thank you!

story:
For the fourth consecutive year, The Finest: A G.I. Joe Costume Club is proud to partner with K9s For Warriors – America’s largest provider of service dogs to veterans suffering from PTSD and other trauma as a result of military service post-9/11!

Since 2011, K9s For Warriors has graduated 524 veterans, and more than 1,000 dogs have been rescued! Every warrior that walks through the door is provided with a Service Canine, equipment, training, certification, seminars, legal instruction, vet care, housing, home cooked meals, unconditional love and listening, and a lifetime of services (including available lifelong healthcare for their dogs). The K9s program is 100% free for the veteran!

The Finest is proud to have many active duty service members and veterans in our ranks, and since our club was founded in 2007, we’ve strived to support charity organizations that help military service members after they return home in an impactful way. We are excited to continue supporting K9 For Warriors, but we need your help!

Perks!

To show our appreciation for your generous donations, we’ve created all-new items specifically for this campaign for you to choose from!

Official Patch! For our die-hard patch collectors, it’s the latest in our series of campaign donor patches! Wear or display yours with pride!

 

Collectible Coin! Inspired by the iconic cartoon episode, “Money to Burn”, now is your chance to own your very own Cobra Commander gold coin! Do NOT miss out on this iconic piece!

 

T-shirt! A new year… a new shirt! This “defiant” new design is out of this world! Available in blue or black. 

 

2020 Calendar! Back by popular demand! Twelve months of costumers on display in a full-color 2020 wall calendar!

 

“All In” Package! Get each item listed above and save!

*International shipping is available! If you are outside North America, email us your location and we will let you know what additional shipping charges may apply!

If you can't donate, that doesn't mean you can't help! Please share this campaign on social media and let your family and friends know about our amazing cause!

All proceeds will go directly to K9s For Warriors!  Help the Finest support the brave men and women who have sacrificed so much, and help us let them know that we value and appreciate their contributions and sacrifices!

Join with the Finest, and together, let’s use our love of G.I. Joe to give something back to the Real American Heroes! 

YO JOE!!!

For more info on K9s For Warriors, please visit www.K9sForWarriors.org

For more info on The Finest, please visit www.TheFinestCC.com

story:
Abby Appleby has always wanted to go into space. After several years of intense astronaut training, she finally gets her chance.

After amateur astronomers report sightings of strange creatures on the surface of the moon, Abby's recruited by  Ebon Flow, genius and owner of SpaceXXL, to blast off on a mission to the moon, set up a base, and investigate the creature sightings.

What danger, mystery, and naughty carnal action lies ahead for Abby? Will she find the creatures and if so, how will they respond to her?

Find out in ASSTRO #1, a fully-illustrated action-packed erotic adventure story that won't disappoint.

Preview of ASSTRO #1 pages:

ASSTRO #1 is a 24-page comic full of non-stop salacious action, adventure, mystery, and experimentation. The comic is in full color and the first part of a 3-issue arc.

The story is written by Bleu Riddle, with the pages illustrated and colored by Butterflies. The comic is fully illustrated, but we need your help to get it printed, get it noticed, and get the series going! And there's variant covers you can pick up depending on how much you pledge!

HOLOFOIL BUNDLE - 4 HOLOFOIL COPIES - ALL NO. 1s (ALL GONE)

Because all holofoils below are limited and numbered, we wanted to make it easy for the first backer to secure the first copy of each variant. If you pledge for this tier, you''ll get a total of FOUR limited edition Chrome holofoil variant covers (#1): Topless "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO” covers and the standard "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO” covers! A 5x7 Holofoil print and the digital copy of the comic is included too! This tier is limited to #1.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD

You get a digital PDF copy of ASSTRO #1 with “PEEKABOO" cover variant.

THE BOOK (2 OPTIONS)

You get a print copy of ASSTRO #1 with either the "BLAST OFF!" or “PEEKABOO" cover variant and a digital PDF copy.

HARDCORE TWO-BOOK COMBO

TWO Topless variants! Get the limited edition "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO" cover variants! The digital copy of the comic is included too!

HOLOFOIL VARIANT  (2 OPTIONS)

You get a Chrome Holofoil print copy with either the "BLAST OFF!" or “PEEKABOO" cover variant and a digital PDF copy of ASSTRO #1. Each variant will be numbered. The number you receive will be based on the order the pledges were made. If you're the first to pledge this tier, your comic would be numbered 2 of ##. If you would like the #1 print of each variant, see our Early Bird HOLOFOIL BUNDLE perk. A 5x7 Holofoil print and the digital copy of the comic is included too!

HOLOFOIL HARDCORE TWO-BOOK COMBO

TWO Topless variants! Get the limited edition "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO” Chrome HOLOFOIL variants! A 5x7 Holofoil print and the digital copy of the comic is included too! Each variant will be numbered.

T & A HOLOFOIL BIG BUNDLE

You''ll get a total of FOUR limited edition Chrome holofoil variant covers: Topless "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO” covers and the standard "BLAST OFF!" and “PEEKABOO” covers! Each variant will be numbered. A 5x7 Holofoil print and the digital copy of the comic is included too! Each variant will be numbered.

**ADD-ON PERK**

We added a new metal cover variant as an add-on perk you can select at checkout!

$750 - Every tier gets a collectible trading card featuring Abby Appleby

Do you like space, boobs, action, war, horny alien monsters, mystery, twists and turns, robot monkeys, insane geniuses, rockets, sexy scientists, and lots and lots of cheese presented in fully-colored illustrated glory? Then...this comic is for you.

story:
Scheda progetto in breve


Obiettivo:  Raccontare a fumetti il mio viaggio in solitaria sulla transmongolica dalla Russia fino al Giappone.
Durata: un mese
Finanziamento: Il progetto è autofinanziato quindi - a differenza di altre campagne di crowdfunding - lo realizzerò ugualmente a prescindere dal raggiungimento o meno dell'obiettivo della campagna (5000 euro mi permetteranno di coprire le spese del progetto).
Partecipazione:  Il racconto potrà essere letto online gratis ma se vorrai potrai sostenere il mio lavoro con una quota a scelta fra tre possibilità: 

 

Terza classe - 10 euro
Seconda classe - 20 euro
Prima classe - 40 euro



Dove leggerlo:
Le puntate del mio diario a fumetti saranno pubblicate su:
Il mio sito
ATTENZIONE: cliccando questo link troverete in ordine cronologico, e raccolte in un unico posto, tutte le tavole aggiunte man mano che saranno pubblicate
La mia pagina facebook
il mio canale instagram
il mio account twitter


Approfondimento



La transmongolica è un viaggio epico: tutti ne abbiamo sentito parlare (cioè, io sì).
Sei curioso di sapere come sarà attraversare tanti fusi orari? Come si vive per giorni su un treno russo? Com'è arrivare a Pechino in treno? E la cosa che mi preoccupa di più: in Giappone che mangio, ché a me il sushi mi fa uno schifo incredibile? 
La formula è semplice: prendi un vignettista e spediscilo a raccontarti com'è attraversare mezzo mondo. Il risultato sarà probabilmente un disastro.
Forse scomparirò, perdendo qualche coincidenza in qualche città siberiana.
Ma se tutto va bene sarà invece un reportage di viaggio a fumetti online, in diretta, per raccontare tutto quello che riuscirò a fare andare storto.
Il mio compagno di viaggio?
Tu.

 



13.000 km (1/29° della distanza tra la Terra e a Luna, 432 volte la distanza tra Palermo e Milano) senza aerei. Un viaggio lento (molto lento) in treno attraverso otto fusi orari e quattro paesi:
Russia, Mongolia, Cina e Giappone.
Partenza: Luglio 2019
Durata del viaggio: un mese.
Si parte dalla Russia per poi attraversare la Siberia, lambire il lago Baikal e scendere in Mongolia, nella terra di Gengis Khan. Di nuovo in treno attraverserò il deserto del Gobi per poi arrivare in Cina, alle porte della Città Proibita.
Dalla Cina (unica tappa, ovviamente, non in treno) continua il viaggio lento - lentissimo - con due giorni di nave per raggiungere il Giappone.
Ecco l'itinerario di viaggio dettagliato:






Il mio progetto ha due caratteristiche:
1) completamente autofinanziato
2) gratuitamente leggibile online, in diretta dalla transmongolica.
Un progetto del tutto mio, insomma, perché ho sempre voluto farlo.
Ho deciso di rendere il mio lavoro leggibile per tutti online sul mio blog e i miei canali social  ma ho anche deciso di dare la possibilità, a chi avesse voglia di seguirmi in questa avventura, di sostenermi con una quota.
E qui entri in gioco tu che stai leggendo.

La realizzazione del progetto ha un costo che ho scelto di sostenere autonomamente quindi i costi del viaggio, degli strumenti che mi serviranno per raccontarlo (che pare niente ma...) e tutto il resto sono stati completamente coperti da me.
Il reportage andrà online e potrà essere letto da chiunque lo vorrà su:

  • Il mio blog
  • la mia pagina facebook
  • Il mio profilo twitter
  • Il mio canale instagram

E allora perché pagare se è gratis?
Perché, in effetti, niente è davvero gratis e se ne hai voglia, se ci credi, se pensi che il mio lavoro valga la spesa e se hai letto e apprezzato i miei lavori in passato ora hai la possibilità di sostenermi per la prima volta in un progetto del tutto mio, senza alcun intermediario.
Con una piccola o una grande quota puoi decidere in che misura sostenermi. Oltre alle donazioni (per le quali puoi scegliere tu l'importo) ho previsto tre possibilità: 

  • Terza classe - 10 euro
  • Seconda classe - 20 euro
  • Prima classe - 40 euro


Sarà come viaggiare con me fino all'altra parte del mondo.
Oppure comprare un libro,
ma comprandolo una pagina alla volta
ogni giorno
appena sfornata.
Una specie di panificio, insomma.
 


 

Mi chiamo Mario Natangelo, sono vignettista e giornalista.
Ho 33 anni, sono nato a Napoli e - dopo un breve periodo in Spagna - ora vivo a Roma dove lavoro dal 2009 per Il Fatto Quotidiano per il quale realizzo vignette satiriche oltre a reportage a fumetti. Collaboro con vari siti e testate e ho pubblicato diversi libri. Ho vinto qualche premio, molti anni fa. Poi ho smesso.
Ho realizzato molti reportage a fumetti raccontando eventi, manifestazioni, viaggi e posti speciali sia in Italia che all'estero. Sono stato al Cairo due mesi dopo l'omicidio di Giulio Regeni, nella moschea di Molenbeek cercando gli attentati di Bruxelles; nel villaggio di Babbo Natale in Lapponia, sul cammino di Santiago, nella zona di alienazione di Chernobyl, nella casa più infestata di Svezia, con i migranti sulla rotta balcanica dalla Serbia fino all'Austria e via dicendo.
Questo è quanto, ora sta a te.

Leggimi, se vuoi.
Partecipa, se ti va.
E, in ogni caso, passaparola.
story_txt:
Scheda progetto in breveObiettivo:  Raccontare a fumetti il mio viaggio in solitaria sulla transmongolica dalla Russia fino al Giappone.Durata: un meseFinanziamento: Il progetto è autofinanziato quindi - a differenza di altre campagne di crowdfunding - lo realizzerò ugualmente a prescindere dal raggiungimento o meno dell'obiettivo della campagna (5000 euro mi permetteranno di coprire le spese del progetto).Partecipazione:  Il racconto potrà essere letto online gratis ma se vorrai potrai sostenere il mio lavoro con una quota a scelta fra tre possibilità:  Terza classe - 10 euroSeconda classe - 20 euroPrima classe - 40 euroDove leggerlo:Le puntate del mio diario a fumetti saranno pubblicate su:Il mio sitoATTENZIONE: cliccando questo link troverete in ordine cronologico, e raccolte in un unico posto, tutte le tavole aggiunte man mano che saranno pubblicateLa mia pagina facebookil mio canale instagramil mio account twitterApprofondimentoLa transmongolica è un viaggio epico: tutti ne abbiamo sentito parlare (cioè, io sì).Sei curioso di sapere come sarà attraversare tanti fusi orari? Come si vive per giorni su un treno russo? Com'è arrivare a Pechino in treno? E la cosa che mi preoccupa di più: in Giappone che mangio, ché a me il sushi mi fa uno schifo incredibile? La formula è semplice: prendi un vignettista e spediscilo a raccontarti com'è attraversare mezzo mondo. Il risultato sarà probabilmente un disastro.Forse scomparirò, perdendo qualche coincidenza in qualche città siberiana.Ma se tutto va bene sarà invece un reportage di viaggio a fumetti online, in diretta, per raccontare tutto quello che riuscirò a fare andare storto.Il mio compagno di viaggio?Tu. 13.000 km (1/29° della distanza tra la Terra e a Luna, 432 volte la distanza tra Palermo e Milano) senza aerei. Un viaggio lento (molto lento) in treno attraverso otto fusi orari e quattro paesi:Russia, Mongolia, Cina e Giappone.Partenza: Luglio 2019Durata del viaggio: un mese.Si parte dalla Russia per poi attraversare la Siberia, lambire il lago Baikal e scendere in Mongolia, nella terra di Gengis Khan. Di nuovo in treno attraverserò il deserto del Gobi per poi arrivare in Cina, alle porte della Città Proibita.Dalla Cina (unica tappa, ovviamente, non in treno) continua il viaggio lento - lentissimo - con due giorni di nave per raggiungere il Giappone.Ecco l'itinerario di viaggio dettagliato:Il mio progetto ha due caratteristiche:1) completamente autofinanziato2) gratuitamente leggibile online, in diretta dalla transmongolica.Un progetto del tutto mio, insomma, perché ho sempre voluto farlo.Ho deciso di rendere il mio lavoro leggibile per tutti online sul mio blog e i miei canali social  ma ho anche deciso di dare la possibilità, a chi avesse voglia di seguirmi in questa avventura, di sostenermi con una quota.E qui entri in gioco tu che stai leggendo.La realizzazione del progetto ha un costo che ho scelto di sostenere autonomamente quindi i costi del viaggio, degli strumenti che mi serviranno per raccontarlo (che pare niente ma...) e tutto il resto sono stati completamente coperti da me.Il reportage andrà online e potrà essere letto da chiunque lo vorrà su:
Il mio blog
la mia pagina facebook
Il mio profilo twitter
Il mio canale instagram
E allora perché pagare se è gratis?Perché, in effetti, niente è davvero gratis e se ne hai voglia, se ci credi, se pensi che il mio lavoro valga la spesa e se hai letto e apprezzato i miei lavori in passato ora hai la possibilità di sostenermi per la prima volta in un progetto del tutto mio, senza alcun intermediario.Con una piccola o una grande quota puoi decidere in che misura sostenermi. Oltre alle donazioni (per le quali puoi scegliere tu l'importo) ho previsto tre possibilità: 
Terza classe - 10 euro
Seconda classe - 20 euro
Prima classe - 40 euro
Sarà come viaggiare con me fino all'altra parte del mondo.Oppure comprare un libro,ma comprandolo una pagina alla voltaogni giornoappena sfornata.Una specie di panificio, insomma.  Mi chiamo Mario Natangelo, sono vignettista e giornalista.Ho 33 anni, sono nato a Napoli e - dopo un breve periodo in Spagna - ora vivo a Roma dove lavoro dal 2009 per Il Fatto Quotidiano per il quale realizzo vignette satiriche oltre a reportage a fumetti. Collaboro con vari siti e testate e ho pubblicato diversi libri. Ho vinto qualche premio, molti anni fa. Poi ho smesso.Ho realizzato molti reportage a fumetti raccontando eventi, manifestazioni, viaggi e posti speciali sia in Italia che all'estero. Sono stato al Cairo due mesi dopo l'omicidio di Giulio Regeni, nella moschea di Molenbeek cercando gli attentati di Bruxelles; nel villaggio di Babbo Natale in Lapponia, sul cammino di Santiago, nella zona di alienazione di Chernobyl, nella casa più infestata di Svezia, con i migranti sulla rotta balcanica dalla Serbia fino all'Austria e via dicendo.Questo è quanto, ora sta a te.Leggimi, se vuoi.Partecipa, se ti va.E, in ogni caso, passaparola.

story:
Your favorite supernatural gangster is BACK on Indiegogo! JOHNNY PHANTASM IN THE TALES OF NEW DETROIT, 1977 features the original story that put him on the map! A LIMITED SERIES format of 3 individual 32 page comic books on classic newsprint! Riot Press, along with the Alterna Press's Printing Partnership Program, are bringing this story back to life one last time!

                                                HAVE COMICS SHIPPED TO YOUR DOOR!!!

Read the origin and first adventure of JOHNNY PHANTASM in this beautifully illustrated 3 issue limited run collection. Showcasing 3 brand new covers with art by Patrick Thomas Parnell! Edited by Dr. Andrea Lorenzo Molinari (Scout Comics, Caliber Comics). And an added NEW never-before published back-up story featuring a brand new character—Mr. Ink!!! 

                                                           You can get issues 1 - 3 for $15!!!

This limited series is the perfect collectible for established Johnny diehards, but also a terrific jumping off point for new fans of the New Detroit universe.

If you love ghosts, if your heart beats for gangsters, this fun and exciting series is for you!

This book is Beetlejuice meets Scarface. But also for fans of Batman, Joker, Daredevil and The Mask.

                                          The books are completed and are at the printers!

 

                                                        Featured: A Full House for $45

 

Artwork:

 

 

 

New 8 page story in the back of the 3rd issue!

Stretch goal $8k : Every backer gets 4 Topp's style Detroit 1977 trading cards !UNLOCKED

Stretch goal $10k: Johnny Phantasm poker chips

Stretch goal $12k: TBA

                                              $10K GOAL!!!!! $10K GOAL!!!!! $10K GOAL!!!!!

Johnny Phantasm finished it's first 30 days!Now In Demand! Alterna has informed me that the books our on their way!There's time for one more stretch goal before the books arrive!Once we hit $10k everyone gets a JP poker chips! Share!!!

So far everyone is getting a set of four 1977 themed Topp’s style trading cards. But once we get to $10k everyone are getting new JP poker chips!

 

Evan K. Pozios is a professional writer and attorney from Detroit, MI. Most notably, Evan is the creator of Time Grunts, published by Caliber Comics.

 

Patrick Thomas Parnell is a professional illustrator and college instructor from Sarasota, FL. Patrick has worked on projects such as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Mega Man and Sonic the Hedgehog. 

 

Edited by Dr. Andrea Lorenzo Molinari (Scout Comics, Caliber Caliber), writer of The Shepherd (Caliber Comics). 

After successfully collaborating on Time Grunts for Caliber Comics, Patrick and Evan are bringing BACK their newest creator-owned title to IndieGoGo . . . JOHNNY PHANTASM!!! 

This will be the last time the comics will be available and the ONLY time in this rare 3 issue newsprint run! If you're new to Johnny, give it a try! If you already bought the original graphic novel, we thank you!!!! But we also want to entice you to grab this collectors' edition with a NEW story added to the original and a classic newsprint look!

                                                           ORIGINAL PAGES FOR SALE!!!! (not in order)

story:
About Iron Skies

Hi! I am Kristopher Rue, and I am a storyteller. I've spent my life crafting stories, and I have been published in the literary journal Pilcrow and Dagger. In 2009, I started writing the Iron Skies Chronicles for friends and family. I started to put pieces together and build a world, and quickly fell in love with the setting and characters. The chronicles were changed and adapted over the years as I distilled them for more impact.

One thing has never changed - I have always imagined Iron Skies as a visual medium. Thanks to my amazing team, I am able to realize that vision and bring you the epic I've been wanting to tell for a decade.

Author - Kristopher Rue

Artist - Renan Shody and Victor Cappola

Color Artist - Dijjo Lima

Letterer - Eric Weathers

Cover Artist - Caanan White

Airship Design - Mariana Sampaio

What We Need & What You Get

I have an awesome team that is putting out top quality work, but to keep that up I need your help! I have been able to personally fund a portion of the project, but Iron Skies is a huge endeavor, and the only way I can get the first issue made and in your hands is if we can hit our goal. Without you, the story ends here.

Supporting the project will net you one of the perks, and make you an historic part of this saga!

Stretch Goals

15K - Poster 2 unlocked

25K - Issue 2 unlocked

35K - Patch of the Iron Skies logo included with any of the signed copy tiers or higher

40K - Poster 3 unlocked

 

Unlocking issue 2 will net an approximately 80 page comic and can be told in 6 parts. If the page count sticks to right at 80, I can keep the floppy format. If it goes higher, it may need to come in graphic novel format (squarebound). The additional posters are only available with tiers containing the "Premium Poster Pack."

Risks & Challenges

This will be my first self published work, so it is possible that there will be obstacles along the way. The artwork does take some time - so there will be a delay if the stretch goals are met - however, I am confident that it will also give you the most "bang for your buck," and I will be keeping all backers updated as pages are done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to contribute, but still want to snag a signed copy there is another option! If you can influence 3 friends to help fund the project (will need to be verified by email addresses) I will ship you a free signed copy!

(The Fine Print: Each free issue applies to unique funders only.)

Thank you!

story:
A short summary

I'm Michael Jantze, the creator of The Norm comic strip and professor. I am asking for help to pay for legal representation to fight a frivolous lawsuit.

In a scenario all too common to creators, I am being forced to defend myself in a frivolous and abusive lawsuit. The legal fees could total more than my yearly salary as a professor. 

     "I'm mad as hell and I'm not going to take it anymore."
               -- Network, written by Paddy Chayefsky, directed by Sidney Lumet

As artists, who hasn’t been asked to wait for payment? Draw for free? Write for a future percentage? Take a reduced salary? Create intellectual property in a work-for-hire case?

This person claims I owe HIM money. You can read the complaints on my gallery page and follow the schedule on the Chatham County Court website. It’s frivolous, and I will not stand for bullying.

 

Skip this part if you don't like reading

I can’t speak of the actual courtcase details since it’s still pending, but I’ll do my best to shed some light on what’s in the public documents.

As an director and animation consultant, I was asked by this person to do a great many things for the benefit of his business, which, in his claim, he flips and says he was helping me. My counterclaim states those differences in argument and fact.

As a professor, I stayed involved in this project for the benefit of placing my students in industry jobs. Even though the outcome for me has been this lawsuit, my previous contacts with the studio execs in Atlanta and Los Angeles have placed more than five students in full time positions in the last two months. In that regard I’ve been successful.

As an animation studio, I brought more than US$10,000 of equipment and books and furniture into his office, all of which this person still has possession of. Fair? Equitable? Not my right to use my own equipment?

As a creator this person was trying to get a hold of my comic strip “The Norm” and other film script treatments and intellectual property, to possibly try to “help me sell them”. When I declined, the trouble began.

This fight began because this person felt that I promised them investment income, which in a court of law will be proven false. Hopefully, my counter claims will be proven true and this person will return my possessions, etc.

So as a CREATOR WITH RIGHTS, one who’s not just a cartoonist but also a writer and director and a working studio, one with decades of contacts in publishing, animation and comics, I feel my rights of been trampled on egregiously and this lawsuit is frivolous and mean spirited. It’s meant to put me back in my proper “creator” place.

Of course that’s my opinion and one can agree or disagree at will, I don’t seek to convince people of my side of all this but only raise money so that I can prove this in a court of law, which, as we all know, is prohibitively expensive but, ultimately, the proper way to handle this.

My strength in this matter is dependent on you — your sharing/broadcasting of this campaign to raise money for my fight and your donations. Any amount counts and any amount of friends and family you share this with counts.

I will do the same for any other creator in distress one day.

I am confident I will win this case, but I suspect this person is hoping to outspend me. Trust me, that’s already happened. I’ve found a great lawyer who’s countered this adversary in the past, now I need to find the money to fund this fight. 

 

The Perks

Where are they? Well, I didn't set up this campaign like many on Indiegogo, so there aren't any fabulous prizes. This lawsuit is already taking up most of my time. But I have turned on free ebooks for your Amazon Kindle, Kindle app and iBooks app for iPad. The links are here:

- KINDLE BOOKS: http://bit.ly/U6U8CO

- IBOOKS: https://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/michael-jant...

 

The Gallery

Please keep an eye on my gallery (see tab at the top of the page) to see some new "The Norm" comics and videos. Go look now,I've already posted some new work! Also look for updates and new art added throughout this campaign.

 

Other ways to help

Finally, please use the share tools at the top of this page to tweet, e-mail, or otherwise let people know about my fight.
 
Even if you're unable to contribute, you can still help me fund this fight by spreading the word about this campaign.

And when it's over, I'll go back to making happiness as a professor, and speaker and NEVER work for free again. And I promise to create more comics and cartoons for you all.

Thank you for your attention and I look forward getting through this; I'll keep you updated via this page as the story unwinds.

story:
A message from Peter Simeti on Alterna's facebook page....

July 24, 2012... 11:50am

"in case people think that Alterna is some massive company trying to beg for money here... it's not. it's one person. this guy right here - Peter Simeti - me.  putting everything on the line all the time for everyone's books.  i search through submissions and evaluate them, by myself. i set up the website and facebook pages and maintain them, by myself.  anything that's done with Alterna, is done by me.  I'm not trying to cast a pity party here, but i think there might be some confusion with our fundraiser.

i'm personally in about $30K in debt from Alterna's early start-up years (mostly years one and two) because honestly, we had a few books and creators that completely flaked out on us, leaving me with thousands of books and thousands of debt.  the past few years have been much better than those early ones, but not good enough to erase the years past.

sites like kickstarter and indiegogo didn't really exist back then (and if they did, i didn't know anyone that was using them and i wasn't aware of them) so all my financing involved my own savings, credit cards, and the like.  we couldn't get a bank loan because the company wasn't making enough money - apparently you have to be rich to get a loan and paying your bills on time just isn't enough.  

so now here we are years later. i know we had a fundraiser last year to save Alterna from bankruptcy and while we managed to raise around $1,500 - it only helped us to kick around for another year.  We needed at least $5,000 last year to really do some big time permanent damage.   It's such a small amount in terms of it (if all our friends donated $1 we'd have hit the goal already) but it's tremendous on its impact to Alterna, the creators of books that are published here, and honestly - to myself.  

I know this is long-winded and might come across as desperate - but that's what i am right now ... desperate.  i haven't even taken a check or payment from Alterna in 3 years because the money just isn't there.  And that includes surrendering the royalties to my own books too.

so if you have a few dollars to spare and you care about the books we have here - or even if you just want to support a completely creator-owned company and get something awesome in return - please donate.  thanks."

-Peter

 

 

Some background on Alterna Comics...

Peter Simeti created Alterna Comics in 2006 to provide an alternative for comic creators that had been rejected by other companies.  In a way, it was a last resort kind of publishing company.  Today, their mindset is still the same but they've managed to become a first choice for many creators, instead of the "only" choice.
 
As the sole operator and financer of Alterna, Peter's put everything he has into the company.  When the credit card bubble burst a few years back, Alterna's growth and means of funding completely stopped.  They weren't able to acquire new capital or get a loan from the bank and essentially should be dead in the water right now.

 

 

 

What's a "Reverse Fundraiser" you ask?

Since they are not looking to raise funds to print these books, this fundraiser kind of acts like a time machine.  The money raised will go towards paying down the debt that was originally built when paying for the creation of these books.  So it's still a funding campaign of sorts, they're just a few years late.

When these books originally went to print, fundraising sites like kickstarter and indie gogo weren't super popular so Peter ended up putting print runs on credit cards.  He's still in a bit of debt because of this, but it's getting better every year.  Interest fees though, are what's really killing the growth of Alterna, as they lose about $6,000 a year towards paying interest associated with that initial debt.

But because of the terrific community aspect of Alterna - their creators banded together and have managed to soldier on.   They're not doing fantastic - but they're also not out of business. 

They're calling upon the generosity of this community once again by holding a "reverse fundraiser" to try and bite down on the credit card debt that those past print runs accumulated.

Hopefully with your help, they will still be around for years to come.

 

 

   

 

The REWARDS!

There's a plethora of rewards available here, afterall we aren't asking for donations - we want you to know that you'll be rewarded for your contribution!

GRAPHIC NOVELS

AMERICAN TERROR VOL.1

November 11th, 2041. Nobody celebrates Veteran's Day anymore. Victor Sheppard is an old man in a new world of peace and equality. Millions of people died and the world is a better place, but nobody remembers why. Haunted by his dead comrades, Victor decides to do the one thing he thought he'd never do: Spill his guts.

 

AMERICAN TERROR VOL.2

Powerful corporations are enslaving the third world; slaughtering millions of people in the process. In this volume, Victor recalls his first journey with Homer Hegal (the original smart bomb) as they traveled across the United States recruiting mercenaries to help level the playing field.

 

THE CHAIR

Richard Sullivan has spent the past 10 years on death row, witnessing the torture and murder of each of his fellow inmates.  As the sole remaining inmate in the prison, Sullivan must find a way to escape his fate or let the insane events of the prison finally consume him.

 

THE DEADBEAT

A humorous and poignant 'slice of super life' graphic novel, THE DEADBEAT revolves around a down-on-his-luck former superhero and his long-lost daughter. As tempers flare and they come to terms with one another, they realize that the events that drove a wedge between them years ago were just the tip of the iceberg.

 

FORMERA VOL.1

A young boy named Darian discovers he's ended up on the planet Formera and his only companion is a girl named Keisha that speaks an unknown language.  Meanwhile, a mysterious and powerful stranger seeks to put an end to Darian's search for home.

 

FORMERA VOL.2

After healing from an explosive battle, Darian begins a search for a mystical object. But with Keisha being held hostage, Darian must find his way around Formera with the help of a masked girl named Dee Dee.  Can this unlikely duo survive traveling deep into the heart of Formera, where no one has ever come out alive?

 

HELLO DO YOU WORK HERE?

Featuring 100% true stories submitted from people across the country, "Hello, do YOU work here?" celebrates the insane, mundane, and everything
in-between. With accompanying illustrations from
over 20 different artists, this book is the ultimate
pick-me-up when you’ve got a case of the Mondays!

 

JESUS HATES ZOMBIES VOL.4

Las Vegas. Sin City. It's a place where millions of dreams have been born - and even more have died. So it's as fitting a place as any for the ultimate gamble - a showdown between Jesus and his crew and the evil forces that have been gathering against them. But with the combined forces of the mysterious Hooded Man, Zombie Angel Gabriel, a zombified werewolf, and a virtual army of the walking dead, are the odds insurmountably stacked against them? Or will a new alliance and the revelation of a secret none of them saw coming be enough to even the score?

 

MORBID MYTHS

Following in the horror anthology tradition of
"Tales from the Crypt", MORBID MYTHS is a collection
of stories brought to you by Hard Way Studios. The mysterious narrator of the macabre, Job, will be your guide to 100 pages of bone-chilling and side-tickling horror.

 

MR. SCOOTLES

When two college students watch a cursed film reel starring the forgotten 1930's cartoon character Mr. Scootles, they unknowingly set off a chain of events that could lead to Hell on Earth. Featuring a cast that includes a beautiful skirt-wearing demon, a bloodthirsty professor, a warrior angel, Judas, and the Devil herself. Mr. Scootles is a mystery-filled tale that is a tribute to the art of animation and its creators.

 

NOVO VOL.1.

The Aquans and Terans spent their existences blaming each other for their own faults, warring until there was only one Aquan, a male, and one Teran, a female. Together in love and desperation, they created Novo - a savior born to a world that no longer had use for one. Now trying to discover a history he will never be a part of, can the mystery of his past give him the clues to his future?

 

NOVO VOL.2

Novo, the wasted messiah of the Aquans and the Terans, finds himself stranded on a new and foreign world, populated by a powerful feline tribe known as the Xennons. Finding an immediate connection with a species whose women and children are threatened by horrid beasts known only as The Enemy, Novo realizes that he may be able to help this world in a way he could never help his own.

 

NOVO VOL.3

Novo arrives on a desolate planet where the atmosphere has been devastated by war. Now living in a dome sealed off from the outside world, Novo works among the remaining inhabitants trying to reignite life under the watchful eye and iron fist of the corpulent Prettar. But behind the scenes a sinister conspiracy is brewing, one that threatens to shatter the lives of everyone - including Novo.

 

NOVO VOL.4

The hunt is on as Novo knows the secret that will change everything.  He struggles to enlighten the dulled masses of downtrodden and drunken workers, while Prettar tries to protect himself from the people he has used for so long.  How long will Prettar's house of lies stand tall?

 

NOVO VOL.5

THE FINAL CHAPTER! After finally learning the sinister motives of the Mama deity, Novo has been transported against his will to a civilization at the peak of its technological evolution.  Instead of searching again for a mission, Novo decides to just quietly exist, hiding among the crowd that resides in the decaying megalopolis. But just as soon as Novo finds peace for himself, he is confronted by this world’s inescapable flaws and must fight pride, greed and corruption one final time in the hopes that he can prevent a disaster of apocalyptic proportions.

 

RISERS

Annette Thomas is one of the living dead - literally. She is intelligent, has memories and emotions, and like other Risers - she's come back to fulfill a purpose.  What that purpose is remains to be unclear and her journey towards self-discovery has brought her back from the grave. With the help of Ned, an instructor at a Riser facility, Annette must confront her past if she ever hopes to finally rest in peace.

 

SHERLOCK HOLMES: THE PAINFUL PREDICAMENT OF ALICE FAULKNER

Alice Faulkner is in possession of documents that could cause a devastating royal scandal. Unfortunately, she has fallen into the hands of a pair of unscrupulous people who wish to use her possessions for their own ill benefit. So it is up to England's most famous consulting detective along with the help of his trusted friend, Doctor Watson, to rescue this unfortunate young woman and avert the impending scandal.

 

THE UNLIKELY TRIO

A story of three unlikely friends, Lil'Bit the mouse, Mrs. Butters the cat, and Abby the Collie dog that join together to brave the last barn on the left in their small town. The only problem is that a scary monster is said to lurk in the shadows of the barn! 



ALTERNA ORIGINALS TRADING CARDS

 
A $50 donation gets you 10 Trading card packs from our first set (due out in September).  50 different artists worked on this card set, contributing rare and valuable sketch cards that are inserted 1 out of every 2 packs!
 
 
sketch card artist roster: Daniel Gorman, Kelly Williams, Brian Beardsley, j(ay), Jiba Molei Anderson, John J.C. Bulmer, Peter Simeti, Michael Bracco, Bret Herholz, Jeff McComsey, Jeremy Massie, Rafer Roberts, Neil Makohon, Gary Kezele, Thomas Makoto, Stephanie O'Donnell, Rusty Gilligan, Mike Thomas, George Amaru, Joe Palumbo, Chadwick Haverland, Jason Shoemaker, Nicholas P. Meyers, Erin Kohut, Kevin Christensen, Bianca Thompson, Laura Inglis, Joseph Miller, Scott Ethan Glenn, Jason Roussel, Hector Garcia, Michael Kasaboski, Mickey Clausen, Steven Russell Black, Tom Kelly, Brian McCranie, Mark Nasso, Kristen Bellatti, Jay Pangan, Jason Flowers, Randy Bishop, Nate Getz, Puis Calzada, Jesse Hughes, Douglas Draper Jr., Chris McJunkin, Mike Czerniawski, Will Perkins, Steve Willhite, and Alex Schumacher!
 
 
         
 

DIGITAL COMICS

PDF versions of our printed comics!  Get our entire digital collection (28 books) for the low price of only $10!

 

ORIGINAL ART & SKETCHES

Sketched & Signed copies of our books, original commissioned art pieces, and original art from several different Alterna books!  This reward provides you with a great chance to own a piece of original art from an Alterna artist!

 

ADVERTISING ON OUR WEBSITE

Our website gets roughly 50,000 hits a month and now there's a great opportunity to take advantage of that traffic with banner ads on the bottom of 5 pages on our site!

 

 

 

Money's tight and you can't donate? Please spread the word instead!

If you can't contribute because money's tight for you as well, then that's fine and perfectly understandable.  If you could spread the word though and just share our link on your facebook, twitter, or website - that would be wonderful.

The more awareness we can drum up, the more likely we are to hit our goal!

A message from Peter Simeti on Alterna's facebook page....
July 24, 2012... 11:50am
"in case people think that Alterna is some massive company trying to beg for money here... it's not. it's one person. this guy right here - Peter Simeti - me.  putting everything on the line all the time for everyone's books.  i search through submissions and evaluate them, by myself. i set up the website and facebook pages and maintain them, by myself.  anything that's done with Alterna, is done by me.  I'm not trying to cast a pity party here, but i think there might be some confusion with our fundraiser.i'm personally in about $30K in debt from Alterna's early start-up years (mostly years one and two) because honestly, we had a few books and creators that completely flaked out on us, leaving me with thousands of books and thousands of debt.  the past few years have been much better than those early ones, but not good enough to erase the years past.sites like kickstarter and indiegogo didn't really exist back then (and if they did, i didn't know anyone that was using them and i wasn't aware of them) so all my financing involved my own savings, credit cards, and the like.  we couldn't get a bank loan because the company wasn't making enough money - apparently you have to be rich to get a loan and paying your bills on time just isn't enough.  so now here we are years later. i know we had a fundraiser last year to save Alterna from bankruptcy and while we managed to raise around $1,500 - it only helped us to kick around for another year.  We needed at least $5,000 last year to really do some big time permanent damage.   It's such a small amount in terms of it (if all our friends donated $1 we'd have hit the goal already) but it's tremendous on its impact to Alterna, the creators of books that are published here, and honestly - story:
Hi, IndieGOGO! My name is Furanku Moore, or Fu for short, and I represent a group of artists and writers called Project Manga. We are made up or two writers, two artists, and one editor and come from all walks of life, but we each share a passion for manga and graphic novels. One thing leads to another and we all inevitably got to thinking, “How cool would it be to write a manga?” We want to unveil for you all our project, “My Kingdom,” a fantasy-action one-shot to be released at Anime Boston this coming May, 2013.

The 46-page manga will follow the story of Kyo Mora, an American-Japanese NEET, who wants real life to be more like the exciting world in his favorite MMORPG and whose wish is abruptly granted, trusting him into a world of wizards, warriors, and wide-open plains full of dangerous beasts. The tale will follow his discovery of the strange new world, Asukni, as well as his meeting with a duo of hunters that he befriends and travels with as he tries to find a place he can call home in this strange world.

 

Funding Goal

1,500 - Printing Costs

2,000 - Staff Costs

4,000 -Anime Boston Costs/fees

5,000 - Funding Reached!!

7,000 - Go for Serialization

10,000 - Printing costs for Edition 1 and 2!

Concept Art

 

 

THE DUNGEON PARTY – A FIVE-MAN

Our group is made up of two artists, two writers, and one editor. Our artist duo consists of [Sam and Roy info]. Writing “My Kingdom” is a job that belongs to Patrick Grogan and me, Furanku Moore. I am a CGD (Concept Game Designer) who has designed many game worlds for Fuism Studios. Patrick, on the other hand, is our young, hopeful writer, looking to get into the industry of writing graphic novels. Much like the dreamer Kyo, Patrick dreams of getting more involved in the graphic novel industry as a writer. Last, but certainly not least, is Brandi Mullen, our editor who keeps us in line and who motivates (and intimidates) us to do better and better! By helping us publish and print “My Kingdom,” you are helping hopefuls enter the industry with a bang, bring an amazing story to the public, and help our Sam have a honey moon his wife can be proud of.

 

OUR GOAL, A FINAL BOSS

To be fully funded, we will need $5,000. This includes the costs for printing 100 finished copies of the manga to be sold at Anime Boston, and to help pay the crew of five people working on the project. Any money we receive that goes surpasses our initial goal will be used to fund future projects by [Project Manga] or to cover expenses that might pop up. While we are very sure the later will not occur, more money means that we will be able to pursue more projects in the future and assure that this will not be the last you see or hear from [Project Manga]. In the end if we get a good following we would love to create a series of our manga for everyone.

 

DPS CHECK – CAN WE MAKE IT?

We are very confident in our ability to build a powerful and enthusiastic community around “My Kingdom”, but what if we can’t reach our goal? Because we are over shooting printing costs with this goal in order to pay [Project Manga] in advance, we might be able to tackle this if we can get enough funding. But we would be cutting it very, very close, something we do not want to do because of how important this project is too us, and because of how dedicated we are to making sure both our supporters at IndieGOGO and potential fans at Anime Boston can enjoy “My Kingdom.” We do not want to deprive anyone of a good book, and I think everyone can appreciate a group of creators who want to share a story they loved working on.

 

CALLED TO BATTLE – WHAT YOU CAN DO

We understand if you love our product, but are tight on cash. If you feel that you want to do more to help out, we welcome all the help you can give us! Spread the word! While Kyo thinks the real world and its people are disappointing, we beg to differ because we know how powerful social networking is. Get the word out and tell people you think might be interested! Tweet our project or share our artist’s web-pages to help give them a well-deserved following for all their hard work. Every dollar, every share, every tweet, text, click, and name drop of “My Kingdom” will bring us one step closer to helping us share our project with you.

We hope to see you all real soon. And, if any backers plan to come to Anime Boston, we’ll tell you where you can find us so we can hang for a bit and talk about the book. We’d love to meet you! Any friend of Kyo’s is a friend of ours, after all! If you are at Anime Boston this year we would love meet you as well! We all are eager and hopeful this project will end up begin funded.
