This includes the costs for printing 100 finished copies of the manga to be sold at Anime Boston, and to help pay the crew of five people working on the project. Any money we receive that goes surpasses our initial goal will be used to fund future projects by [Project Manga] or to cover expenses that might pop up. While we are very sure the later will not occur, more money means that we will be able to pursue more projects in the future and assure that this will not be the last you see or hear from [Project Manga]. In the end if we get a good following we would love to create a series of our manga for everyone.
 
DPS CHECK – CAN WE MAKE IT?
We are very confident in our ability to build a powerful and enthusiastic community around “My Kingdom”, but what if we can’t reach our goal? Because we are over shooting printing costs with this goal in order to pay [Project Manga] in advance, we might be able to tackle this if we can get enough funding. But we would be cutting it very, very close, something we do not want to do because of how important this project is too us, and because of how dedicated we are to making sure both our supporters at IndieGOGO and potential fans at Anime Boston can enjoy “My Kingdom.” We do not want to deprive anyone of a good book, and I think everyone can appreciate a group of creators who want to share a story they loved working on.
 
CALLED TO BATTLE – WHAT YOU CAN DO
We understand if you love our product, but are tight on cash. If you feel that you want to do more to help out, we welcome all the help you can give us! Spread the word! While Kyo thinks the real world and its people are disappointing, we beg to differ because we know how powerful social networking is. Get the word out and tell people you think might be interested! Tweet our project or share our artist’s web-pages to help give them a well-deserved following for all their hard work. Every dollar, every share, every tweet, text, click, and name drop of “My Kingdom” will bring us one step closer to helping us share our project with you.
We hope to see you all real soon. And, if any backers plan to come to Anime Boston, we’ll tell you where you can find us so we can hang for a bit and talk about the book. We’d love to meet you! Any friend of Kyo’s is a friend of ours, after all! If you are at Anime Boston this year we would love meet you as well! We all are eager and hopeful this project will end up begin funded.

story:
Tuesday Smornings

Since 2012 in the Nooner days, the West Coast gang has been regaling your earholes with showbiz anecdotes, vague political "facts" and general silliness, all thanks the mastery and hardware of one James Franco, Jr.
We love doing it and we strive to give you top quality podcastery.  But with DJammaster James having moved to Sacramento, we need to buy new equipment to deliver the same multimedia experience.
Won't you help?

Where We Stand

As every entertainer worth their salt knows, the show must go on.  And so we have, thanks to the foolish idea of using credit cards.
With said credit cards, we have purchased the bare minimum of what we need to keep the podcast running, but with your help we'd love to: A) Pay off the credit cards; and, B) Buy more equipment to get streaming video and phone conferencing included into the show.
So why not join in?  Not only will you be helping our credit rating, but you'll be improving the show and getting rewards in return.

Bottom Line

Here's the thing: The show succeeds because you all are involved.  Whether it's through tweeting or emailing or telling a friend or just listening while you're stuck in traffic, that's why the show works.  And we love it.  
This show is really important to us.  If you feel the same way, please help if you're able.
We're not asking for life-changing money, but it helps us financially and it also lets us know you give a shit.  And that means a ton.
If you read down this far, thanks.  If you gave, too?  Thanks a buttload.

story:
Who am I and What's the project?

About me: My name is Joe Kisch and I'm the creator of an exciting project I really want you all to get on board with me on. The project is Drago Bentley: Space Detective and is a sci-fi tech noir story set in the 22nd century.  It is envisaged as a graphic novel of 8 chapters.

As an amateur screenwriter, I have won awards for short screenplays (in partnership with Bruce Davie and Chris Reavell) and have placed highly in international screenplay competitions for several of my feature films over the last six years (including Barrio Chino, Swimming Against the Currents, and Devil's Machine). Do a search and you'll see this is true.  I hope this proves to you that I have a successful track record of writing stories and characters that are solid, resonating and appealing.

Apart from writing screenplays, I've also produced and/or directed short films and was Assistant Director on six more.  I mention this in the hope this goes some way to show that I am really passionate about film, story and screenwriting.

The campaign

Up until now, I have financed the completion of five issues of the eight issue graphic novel Drago Bentley: Space Detective - a story based on a script written in 2006. But the funds have run out and I really need your financial  support to complete this great story. 

What I need

I need $9,000 to complete the series.  Thus far, each chapter has cost around $3,000 to produce.  That covers drawing, inking, colouring, texting, printing, and promotional products for comic expos (like T shirts, postcards and posters).

I've structured this campaign so that everyone gets something of value for their contribution/donation to completing stage 1 of the strategy - to get the graphic novel completed.

Why it's important to me

I'm soooo close to the finish line that it would be a sin not to finish this story, especially when there are fans out there that hang on every issue.  I can't, won't, let them down.  You have to help me finish it.  But it does cost money to produce.  Give me the money to finish it and I promise you a producer will be so impressed with the graphic novel that he/she will option it and make it into a live action film.  I just know it in my DNA.

What you'll help me achieve

There are three stages I want to complete for this project: completion of the graphic novel (about 250 pages); completion of motion comics of all 8 chapters (2 are done already); and to sell the concept to a producer to turn the story into a live action feature film.

The story is written and my passionate artistic crew (of Dave Acosta, Teddy Pavon, Mark Martin) are ready to help me complete this story.

Your contributions will make this project succeed and, not only that, if you contribute, I make this pledge: I will make each and every contributor part of the Drago Bentley: Space Detective experience - eg by giving you a credit on the graphic novel.

What You Get

I've designed the perks so that you get good value for your donation.  Donate $25 and get a motion comic; $50 gets you an autographed graphic novel; $100 gets you the above plus you get to be an extra in the comic; $250 gets you all the above plus a credit in the comic; $500 gets you the above pluse you'll be a real voice over character in the story; and $1000 gets you the works. 

A note: although the Perks section below says I will deliver the perks by 31 December 2012, that doesn't mean you won't get perks like downloads, T-shirts, posters and signed issues ahead of that date.  So don't be put off by the delivery date specified below.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know there are some people who just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Here's what you can do:

Join my website - http://dragobentleycomic.canberrafilms.com - it's FREE;

Buy online when you can afford it; and

Get the word out by adding a blurb that talks up the project - make some noise about the campaign.

Look, I make this pledge to you that you won't be sorry you participated in this campaign.  Make a contribution and set the Drago Bentley train a-rolling on to its destination of becoming a live action film.  You'll be able to brag to your friends that you were there at the inception of the project and you will have your names immortalised in the comic.

Thanks a million.

Dear Alums,

Klearly you cannot get enough of KDR through spam, why not see everything LIVE?

Wanna katch whose having sex on Phil's table?
Wanna watch Phil chase a brother with a cleaver?
Wanna see who rubs one out on the pool table?
Wanna know who those stains on the couch comes from?
Wanna see what Ari really does in him room? (Jk we already know whats up there)

Just kidding, you might not, and most likely will not see any of that. In fact, this might just be the most boring live feed you will pay for. But please, pay us:
WE NEED YOUR MONEY.

24-hour live customer service number: [s]1-800-WE-DONT-CARE[/s]. 403-607-BETA

$$$$$$$$$-> <3

story:
SPECIAL NOTE:  We realize that we are releasing this campaign in the midst of COVID-19. If you did not know, this is causing some turmoil in the comic book industry, as many retailers are shutting down during this pandemic, so many of the orders of the books we print are being canceled or order-adjusted at much lower levels of sales. This campaign is one of those financial instruments that will help us directly in these current times. Now if you are undergoing economic hardship, we completely understand, but maybe give us a shout-out on social media to help promote this campaign. We appreciate any support that you can give. 

If you're not familiar with us, my name is Joeming Dunn, and I run Antarctic Press, a small, independent comic company started in 1984. I have personally collected comics of almost every type and genre since 1974, and I can say that during the past 30 years, we have published some of the greatest and best independent comics out there. Our publishing history includes titles like Gold Digger and Ninja High School. The comic industry has changed over the years, so we have started this Kickstarter program to help introduce new projects from our talented group of creators. You may have seen some of our other successful and fulfilled campaigns.

Over the years, we have published a number of series. Prominent among these is Fred Perry's ingenious title, Gold Digger, which Fred describes as a mixture of Indiana Jones and Final Fantasy. The idea for Gold Digger was first conceived during Fred's tour of duty in the first Gulf War, and it debuted in Antarctic Press's anthology comic, Mangazine, in 1991. A four-issue miniseries followed in 1992, and a regular monthly black-and-white series followed starting in 1993. The current color series began in 1999 and has continued since then. It is the second-longest-running solo-created title in the industry, and the only second-longest-running female-lead comic series after Wonder Woman. In 2013, Fred was honored at Comic Con International in San Diego, where he received an Inkpot Award for his work on Gold Digger.

One of our most frequently received fan requests over the years is, "When can I see the original black-and-white series of Gold Digger in color?"

Getting a book colored is not an easy proposition due to the cost and time involved, and both of those commodities are scarce in the independent publishing world. But with Kickstarter, it is now possible to achieve that goal. We experimented with a previous Kickstarter (Gold Brick 7), and due to its success, we were able to color the first two issues of the black-and-white series. So back in June of 2016, we ran the first part of this campaign, and we were able to COLORIZE 5 ISSUES. With such encouraging response, we made successive colorizing campaigns.  Out of the 50 black-and-white issues, a total of 18 have been colorized thus far. Here is a small sample of what's been done. Below are original and colored pages from Gold Digger #6, colorized thanks to one of our previous Kickstarters.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What we would like to do is to continue this process with issue #19 of the series, since the first 18 issues are already funded and complete.

Here is a PDF link for Gold Digger #19...

http://antarcticpresslibrary.com/gdbw/gdbw19.pdf

The money collected will go to paying the colorist to perform the task of coloring. And for each $1200 we collect beyond the first, we will color the next issue. For instance, if we collect a total of $2300 with this campaign, we will then proceed to color issue #20; if we collect at least $3400, we'll have issue #21 colored, and so forth and so on. Supporters will receive the PDFs of each completed issue that is colored, and those in the upper pledge tiers will also get the issues that have already been colorized. 

We are so close in getting the first 25 issues of Gold Digger colorized...when that happens we can release the entire first 25 issues in one Gold Digger Gold Brick

How we budget the money...  $1200 Goal

$120 Kickstarter Fees (Kickstarter takes 10% for various fees)

$150 for Fred...for all his hard work

$130 Administration...to manage and send the PDF's to all the supporters

$800 for our esteemed colorists...each issues is from 24 to 30 pages long, so that comes to about $25 to $30 per page for them.

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • STRETCH GOAL #1 - $2300 - Colorize Gold Digger #20
  • STRETCH GOAL #2 - $3400 - Colorize Gold Digger #21
  • STRETCH GOAL #3 - $4500 - Colorize Gold Digger #22

 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks inherent in any project. This project has very few risks: All that we will need to do is raise the funds, pay the colorists, and get it made. Our biggest risk is that we won't get the funding, and then the coloring will not be done. Our colorists have a great deal of experience working with a multitude of publishers besides ourselves. We believe in full disclosure, and we will make sure to keep you all updated on the progress of the book and all the incentives. We have COMPLETELY fulfilled and completed other Kickstarters and, as can be seen in our comment sections, we address all problems in a timely manner.

story:
About This Project

Commemorating the beginning of Hoxwinder Hall, I'd like to create a high-quality, limited edition, printed collection for fans of my comic strip.

In addition to the first 30-days of Hoxwinder Hall strips, this volume will also include a plethora of development sketches, discussion of my creative process, an interview, reflections on the Washington Post contest that started it all and the Rick Kirkman mentorship that was awarded to me in the Cartoonist Studio contest.

The book will be over 100 pages, printed on high quality paper stock in a hard cover binding. When finished, a small number of people will be the proud owners of the very first Hoxwinder Hall treasury. Each book will be signed and shipped to your door.

Funds will go toward the hefty costs associated with the design, creation, and production of this high quality collectible book.

Thank you for your help and support!
               
My Very Best Regards,
Daniel Boris 

-------------

UPDATE!

I'm incredibly happy to report that I've reached my original goal in just the first 12 DAYS of the campaign!! Thanks to everyone for your support and goodwill! I’m staggered and very much appreciate the interest and support for this project! It makes me realize that Hoxwinder Hall has stronger appeal then I realized, and because of that I will rededicate myself to continuing on with the strip. So you all have my sincere thanks for that also!

This campaign remains OPEN for the rest of its run, so anyone who still wants a copy of the book are still very welcome to contribute.

And if you can't afford it, please help me spread the word! Every time you tell someone or share it online really helps the campaign!

Also, everyone who selected a perk with an original sketch, please send your character preference to me at: hoxwinderdb@gmail.com

Again - THANK YOU!!!

- Daniel Boris


-------------

UPDATE!


I'd like to give a big thank you to Michael Cavna, ("Comic Riffs" blog writer and Washington Post editor) for writing a beautiful Foreword for this book!
THANK YOU, Sir!

story:
Know more about the time and place of this story on Nau Negra, the Black Ship files http://naunegra.blogspot.pt/

Informações e esclarecimentos de dúvidas  em português no blog http://urso-relvas.blogspot.pt/


A more detailed text ("playing with received ideas") related to this video may be found on the blog Hard Line.


“Nau Negra. One Boatman, Two Ships”, is a graphic novel with a touch of burlesque, slightly different from what you may expect. It is a pirate story where you won't see any pirates and a samurai story where you hardly see a samurai or two for most of it, but where you may meet merchants and smugglers with their worries and fears, priests with their secrets, soldiers, slaves, sailors and the works of the Devil, a Portuguese captain and his pilot set on defying the shadow of a corsair ship against the will of the passengers, or you may cross briefly the path of an English samurai or an Italian spy. You will surely meet the Boatman, the Japanese narrator, and his hallucinated memories of his samurai years, mainly of a three-day assault on a similar Black Ship (Nau Negra) he had completely forgotten, and Reimau, a former African slave and hit-man at the service of the pilot, both with dark stories to tell.

My name is Fernando Relvas, I am a Portuguese author of graphic novels and I am the author of the story about Nau Negra, which means Black Ship, in this case the last of its kind, that made the trip Macau - Nagasaki, in the beginning of the 17th century. 

I carry this project on my luggage for some 25 years, when I got a book about the Japanese Namban screens in the Museu Nacional de Arte Antiga in Lisboa and I told myself I should make a story inspired on them someday. But I needed funding to settle and do it, so I kept doing other things, doing sketches and polishing the idea. Finally, by the end of last year, I could start financing the project with the sale of some of my original artwork, upgrade to a more recent computer, get used to a new software, and depart for the definitive version of the story.

But that was last year, the trip is half its way, and now we are running out of wind in our sails, and there's nothing captains dread more than looking at a immense flat sea all around, the sails hanging limp as the sailors go drained of all energy.

We thank you in advance for your participation in this project. This ship is now ready to take the Honorable new crew members on board and, with your special contribution, make this trip a collective success.

As crew members usually did, you may dislike the company of the passengers, their haughty manners and their habit of addressing each other by Your Grace, Your Lordship or Your Excellency, mainly when they are not entitled to it. You may call them that, if you wish, just pay attention not to call Excellency someone that you are not sure it is a Duke in the presence of a close relative of a real Duke. This one may threaten to cut one of your ears.

Don't worry, even sailors could be almost as powerful as the lords on board, at times, because in the hands of the sailors lay the fate of the ship. And sailors would use that power whenever they could. But beware of the soldiery, gentry seeking fortune, and the private swordsmen, they cause trouble for nothing.

You may choose your place on board. On a big Nau (also written Nao) there is a good amount of soldiers and sailors and, going up, carpenters, coopers and ropemakers (no ship's cook, you must do it yourself, and take care of your chicken, if you own one), with luck a surgeon, the purser, the contramestre (sort of boatswain), the mestre (the shipmaster), the sota-piloto (2nd pilot, possibly even a 3rd pilot), the main pilot and the captain, amid other staff like servants, clerks and officers of justice. In many cases the main pilot acted as the actual commander of the ship, captaincy being frequently attributed by favor or, as is the case of the Black Ships of the trade Macau-Nagasaki, leased.


“Nau Negra” is based on documented events from the 17th century port of Nagasaki. The fate of the ship I'm inviting you to join is registered on the diaries of Richard Cocks, the English factor of Hirado, based partially on information supplied by Will Adams, known as the English pilot who became a samurai. This and much more came from several sources collected and interpreted by the historian Charles Ralph Boxer. The other great source of information and inspiration are the already mentioned Japanese Namban screens depicting the arrival of the Kurofune, or Black Ship. As for the rest, we have to take the risk of trusting the scarred memories of the Boatman.

The Story

From the Introduction.

By the end of the year 1608 the crew of two Japanese Shuinsen or Vermillion Seal Ships, at dock in the port of Macau, got involved in a fight with the Portuguese.

Most probably, not even then, one could know for sure who started the fight, but the Captain-general of Macau and owner of the annual trip to Japan – made by the large Nau known as Kurofune or Black Ship – surrounded and punished severely the Japanese crews.

The following year, the Daimyo owner of the Vermillion Seal Ships complained to the Shogun and demanded that the Black Ship be seized on arrival at Nagasaki.

The Captain-general refused to be judged by the Shogun and fortified himself on his ship. On the first days of 1610 a samurai force of the Daimyo gave the assault.

Without wind and having touched ground, the ship became a fortress under siege. After three days and three nights of fierce fight, the explosion of the gunpowder magazine finally sank her with all her valuable cargo, killing most of the crew and some of the attacking party.

In less than ten years after those events the last of the black ships would make the trip between Nagasaki and Macau. This was not a dramatic trip like the one that rocked the port of Nagasaki almost ten years before, but an agonizing one. During the entire month of January and part of February of 1618, the big Nau, full of rich goods, sailed on view of the land of the Daimyo of Omura, under the threat of an invisible Dutch corsair.

The destiny of these two large and obsolete ships is not only linked by the commerce of silk and silver between Macau and Nagasaki, by the similarities and differences among several cultures present on board and by the shadow of corsairs and typhoons, but also by the scars in the body and in the memory of the Boatman.

The First Chapter

The following pages are in Portuguese. Here is a description of the action in English.

1 – The Boatman

“I saw them coming from a leisure trip to the islands.” The narrator describes what he saw. His conclusion: “Worms!” But he has seen them in a different mood. Gunshots in a dark alley,

“They” have them surrounded. Exchange of insults, “sons of an ox” for “smelly worms.” Narrator's conclusion: “We understood each other.” The narrator translates to Japanese that “they” promise to let them go free if they sign a document taking the blame for starting the fight.

An ample harbor seen from a nearby hill. “It was the last thing I translated, before I became a boatman.” The boatman is speaking with a samurai. After the events in the previous scene, says the samurai, there was a fierce three day fight in Nagasaki, with the Black Ship, “like the one in the harbor.” The boatman says he doesn't remember the fight. The samurai is sure he was there. He asks the boatman to go to the ship in the harbor.

On the way to the ship, he takes two passengers. Upon arrival, he discovers one of them is a priest. They have a secret. Then, he starts hallucinating, the ship is on fire, there is a big silent explosion. “It all happened in my spirit,” he concludes, because he is now inside the ship, waiting for His Excellency.

The progress of the story slowed down in July and was interrupted in August. It will resume as soon as the campaign is over. I would put progress at 50% of the scheduled 100 pages, considering there are still some gaps to fill (text and art are being worked at the same time, from my notes, instead of following a script.) It is being written in Portuguese but will be put into English as soon as possible.

What do we need the money for? Finishing the story (plus the translation into English and professional revision) may require six more months work. Two more months for fine tuning with the publishers (still to be settled) and it should be ready to go on print in Portuguese, and print-on-demand and e-book in English. It includes publishing fees, commissions and perks. If the campaign doesn't reach its goal, we will make do with what we've got. We are not going to give up. If it goes well beyond its goal, we have already in mind another smaller project related to this one.

Your name will be on the ship's list of crew members as parrot, sailor, carpenter, cooper, purser, boatswain, shipmaster, 2nd pilot, pilot, captain. You may choose to be several of these. You'll receive souvenirs in the form of postcards, depicting items related to your function on the ship. From boatswain up you will receive, according to your position, high-quality reproductions or original works. There will be also a pdf of the book with extra material and books to distribute. All this will be detailed further on.

Even if you don't contribute in any other form, please help spread the news to the most remote shores.

The Team

Fernando Relvas, a Portuguese author of graphic novels. Not exactly an emerging artist. I'll be 60 this September and I am telling stories with drawings since my early twenties. I even managed to make a living of it, although, as the title of one of my blogs says, it has sometimes been a hard line.

By now I have behind me some thirty titles, a mix of long and short stories for the Portuguese press, had nine books printed, some with old stories, and a short animated movie, released in 2012. “Ask a Palmyra: How Can Transgenic Fish Make You Sex Crazy?” is the most recent title, available on print-on-demand and e-book (CCB Publishing, 2013.)

Nina Govedarica, a Croatian artist. We are married. Although Nina has no direct part in the making of the story, she has on this campaign. Also, we are a team in several other ways and her opinions and her own work obviously influence my choices and the direction of my work.

Bellow: an unfinished page of Nau Negra.

Perks

Here are some postcards, parrot, sailor, carpenter and pilot.

Still in progress. Soon you will see more of it here.
Bellow, some of the  wonderful perks reserved for the top officers. Paintings by Nina Govedarica.

Know more about the time and place of this story on Nau Negra, the Black Ship files http://naunegra.blogspot.pt/Informações e esclarecimentos de dúvidas  em português no blog http://urso-relvas.blogspot.pt/A more detailed text ("playing with received ideas") related to this video may be found on the blog Hard Line.“Nau
Negra. One Boatman, Two Ships”, is a graphic novel with a touch of
burlesque, slightly different from what you may expect. It is a
pirate story where you won't see any pirates and a samurai story
where you hardly see a samurai or two for most of it, but where you
may meet merchants and smugglers with their worries and fears,
priests with their secrets, soldiers, slaves, sailors and the works
of the Devil, a Portuguese captain and his pilot set on defying the
shadow of a corsair ship against the will of the passengers, or you
may cross briefly the path of an English samurai or an Italian spy.
You will surely meet the Boatman, the Japanese narrator, and his
hallucinated memories of his samurai years, mainly of a three-day
assault on a similar Black Ship (Nau Negra) he had completely forgotten, and
Reimau, a former African slave and hit-man at the service of the
pilot, both with dark stories to tell.My
name is Fernando Relvas, I am a Portuguese author of graphic
novels and I am the author of the story about Nau Negra, which means Black Ship, in this case the last of its kind, that made the trip Macau - Nagasaki, in the beginning of the 17th century. I carry this project on my luggage for some 25 years, when I
got a book about the Japanese Namban screens in the Museu Nacional de
Arte Antiga in Lisboa and I told myself I should make a story
inspired on them someday. But I needed funding to settle and do it, so I kept
doing other things, doing sketches and polishing the idea. Finally, by the end of last year, I could start financing the project with the sale of some of my original artwork, upgrade to a more recent computer, get used to a new software, and depart for the definitive version of the story.
But
that was last year, the trip is half its way, and now we are running
out of wind in our sails, and there's nothing captains dread more
than looking at a immense flat sea all around, the sails hanging limp
as the sailors go drained of all energy.

story:
The Book

True Patriot is a comic book anthology featuring Canadian superheroes written and drawn by some of your favourite Canadian comic book creators. Most of us working on this project grew up reading Alpha Flight, Captain Canuck, or Wolverine comics and we’ve always thought that there should be more Canadian superheroes out there. So, we're putting together a 100-page, full-colour anthology for your reading pleasure (and ours)!

"We" being: Adrian Alphona (Runaways), Andy B. (Kill Shakespeare), J. Bone (Super Friends), Jack Briglio (Scooby Doo), Scott Chantler (Two Generals), Tom Fowler (Hulk: Season One), Agnes Garbowska (Girl Comics), Faith Erin Hicks (Adventure Time), Tim Levins (Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes), Ramon Perez (A Tale of Sand), Ron Salas (28 Days Later), Jay Stephens (Secret Saturdays), J. Torres (Teen Titans Go), Howard Wong (After the Cape).

 

The Ask

We're hoping to raise $20,000 to pay for the cost of printing and shipping the books and perks, cover Indiegogo/PayPal/bank fees, as well as pay the creators a small honorarium. Should we manage to raise more money, then we'll pay the creators more for their hard work and artistry. Additional funds may also go towards a larger print run, which will depend on the demand.

 

The Perks

To raise this money, we're offering a straight-foward "just give me the comic" pre-order (PDF and hardcover book*) as well as cool "experience" perks involving some of our creators. Check out the perk sidebar for details.

Please note: Book Pre-Orders include postage, so please select the appropriate one for your location (Canada, US, or International).

Also, please note: the $65 Sketch + Book Pre-Order is only for shipping within Canada. For the US, please add $5. International, please add $10 for shipping.

But wait, there's more! Since we're only allowed to offer 12 perks at a time, there are a few additional perks we have waiting in the wings. As some of the current perks are claimed, we'll add the new ones.

 

The Gallery

Please keep an eye on our gallery (see tab at the top of the page) to meet the cast of True Patriot and see concept sketches, layouts, and other behind-the-scenes material. Go look now, we've already posted some stuff! Also look for updates and new art added throughout this campaign.
 
 

The Word


Finally, please use the share tools at the top of this page to tweet, e-mail, or otherwise let people know about True Patriot.
 
Even if you're unable to contribute, you can still help us make True Patriot happen by spreading the word about this campaign.

Thank you for your attention and we look forward to you showing us some True Patriot love!

story:
FINKTOONS PRESENTS: THE SPREAD

We are publishing a comic book and we need your help.  Please take a look at our video pitch above, then read on...


THE SPREAD

In short, "The Spread" is a comic book about a sexually transmitted disease that turns the majority of the world into brain-hungry zombies.  If that doesn't do it for you, let us assure you that this book will not be like any horror or undead story you will ever read. It's a magnificent project, a story that takes us from today until the end of civilization, a story of human beings from every walk of life, and a story about the most fundamental human needs for freedom, lust, and survival.  And of course, there's tons of zombies eating peoples brains.  The comic blends some of the darkest, black-humor you will ever read, horror, science fiction, and maybe just a little bit of social commentary, all under the guise of a graphic and violent story about a zombie apocalypse.


SYNOPSIS

In the year 2011, an outbreak of a highly contagious and deadly disease envelops the globe. It is more horrific than anything the world has ever seen and quickly consumes nearly 3/4 of the earths population. The cause of the disease is unknown, there is no cure, and only a few pieces of information exist as to how and why this catastrophe has occurred. 


WE ONLY KNOW TWO THINGS.  First: the disease is sexually transmitted, and spreads more rapidly and impossible to prevent than any other sexually transmitted disease in history. Second: the disease turns those infected into sex-crazed, brain-eating zombies.


"The Spread" is a zombie story like none ever told before. Follow an epic cast of characters throughout a ten year period as they try to survive, by any means necessary, and cope with not only the fact that the world is crumbling around them, but that the only way to survive is to suppress their most basic human instincts.  We follow a vast cast of characters from across the globe as the disease takes hold of the planet, and witness the reaction in all spectrums of humanity as the earth's citizens are forced between a choice of infinite celibacy, or certain death.


FAQ:  SO WHO ARE THESE FUNKTOONS GUYS?

That's a good question.  We're actually called FINKTOONS, not Funktoons, but it's an honest mistake.  Also we are an art collective, sketch-comedy, animation, and now, comic book troupe from San Francisco, California.  In late 2009, Brandon Fink and Tyler Moazed created Finktoons.  They started as a sketch comedy troupe, launching a series of super short, highly volatile and generally insane cartoons and skits on top of the world wide web.  What began as two friends making cheap and raunchy cartoons in their basement quickly grew beyond their lowly aspirations.  In two years Finktoons has become a creative force-from directing independent films, to animating pieces for Disney and BMW, but all the while has maintained their independent DIY approach to their work.  The collective has added countless collaborators, but now the core team of Fink and Moazed are back, partnering with Michael Morgan, one of the most phenomenal illustrators in San Francisco, to bring you their grandest endeavor to date, "The Spread."

www.finktoons.com

http://michaeldmorgan.tumblr.com/


What We Need & What You Get

Our plan for this comic is straight forward.  We want to self-publish the first issue, as a sort of "pilot" for the series, and distribute them ourselves.  "The Spread" will be an ongoing, serialized comic book, as opposed to a graphic novel.  Our goal is to raise $2500 to print 1,000 high-quality, uniquely printed copies of the first issue.  We have so much faith in this project, and sincerely hope you do to, and we know that if and when the first issue comes to fruition, it will have legs of its own.  In the long run we plan to raise the funding or sell enough issues to keep the series in print ourselves for a long, long time.  


What we need from all of our friends and future collaborators out there is either of two simple things:

YOUR TIME:

-Spread the word about "The Spread."  Show everyone you know the trailer.  Direct all of your friends to this Indie Go Go page, to finktoons.com, and to our Facebook.  

-Blog about how excited you are for this comic, and pass the word along as well.  When we do inevitably print this book, we need people to be ready for it.

YOUR MONEY:

-We need to raise $2500 to print the first issue and work on some minor publicity for the release, and anything you can help us with is truly appreciated.  Donate 50 cents if it's all you have, and if you don't have that ask a friend to help.  Also check out the list of rewards we have for those who donate, there's some really cool stuff you can walk away with, aside from the general satisfaction of knowing that you helped make a story about sex crazed zombies come to life.


THANK YOU!

Anyone who got through this lengthy rant, thank you already.  If you couldn't tell, we're incredibly excited about this project, and we really hope it grabs you anywhere near as much as it's taken ahold of us.  Thank you even more if you contribute in any way, again, take a look at the rewards we have to offer, and we can't wait to show you what comes next.


Sincerely,

Brandon, Mike, Tyler, and the rest of the Finktoons crew

Follow an epic cast of characters throughout a ten year period as they try to survive, by any means necessary, and cope with not only the fact that the world is crumbling around them, but that the only way to survive is to suppress their most basic human instincts.  We follow a vast cast of characters from across the globe as the disease takes hold of the planet, and witness the reaction in all spectrums of humanity as the earth's citizens are forced between a choice of infinite celibacy, or certain death.

FAQ:  SO WHO ARE THESE FUNKTOONS GUYS?
That's a good question.  We're actually called FINKTOONS, not Funktoons, but it's an honest mistake.  Also we are an art collective, sketch-comedy, animation, and now, comic book troupe from San Francisco, California.  In late 2009, Brandon Fink and Tyler Moazed created Finktoons.  They started as a sketch comedy troupe, launching a series of super short, highly volatile and generally insane cartoons and skits on top of the world wide web.  What began as two friends making cheap and raunchy cartoons in their basement quickly grew beyond their lowly aspirations.  In two years Finktoons has become a creative force-from directing independent films, to animating pieces for Disney and BMW, but all the while has maintained their independent DIY approach to their work.  The collective has added countless collaborators, but now the core team of Fink and Moazed are back, partnering with Michael Morgan, one of the most phenomenal illustrators in San Francisco, to bring you their grandest endeavor to date, "The Spread."
www.finktoons.com
http://michaeldmorgan.tumblr.com/

What We Need & What You Get
Our plan for this comic is straight forward.  We want to self-publish the first issue, as a sort of "pilot" for the series, and distribute them ourselves.  "The Spread" will be an ongoing, serialized comic book, as opposed to a graphic novel.  Our goal is to raise $2500 to print 1,000 high-quality, uniquely printed copies of the first issue.  We have so much faith in this project, and sincerely hope you do to, and we know that if and when the first issue comes to fruition, it will have legs of its own.  In the long run we plan to raise the funding or sell enough issues to keep the series in print ourselves for a long, long time.  

What we need from all of our friends and future collaborators out there is either of two simple things:
YOUR TIME:
-Spread the word about "The Spread."  Show everyone you know the trailer.  Direct all of your friends to this Indie Go Go page, to finktoons.com, and to our Facebook.  
-Blog about how excited you are for this comic, and pass the word along as well.  When we do inevitably print this book, we need people to be ready for it.
YOUR MONEY:
-We need to raise $2500 to print the first issue and work on some minor publicity for the release, and anything you can help us with is truly appreciated.  Donate 50 cents if it's all you have, and if you don't have that ask a friend to help.  Also check out the list of rewards we have for those who donate, there's some really cool stuff you can walk away with, aside from the general satisfaction of knowing that you helped make a story about sex crazed zombies come to life.

THANK YOU!
Anyone who got through this lengthy rant, thank you already.  If you couldn't tell, we're incredibly excited about this project, and we really hope it grabs you anywhere near as much as it's taken ahold of us.  Thank you even more if you contribute in any way, again, take a look at the rewards we have to offer, and we can't wait to show you what comes next.

Sincerely,
Brandon, Mike, Tyler, and the rest of the Finktoons crew

story:
Thanks Everyone for making the campaign a success! 

 

To keep in touch just visit the website/twitter links below. We will still be accepting individual orders until we go to print.

 

 

This will be a coveted collector's item: 72 full-colour pages of graphic novel goodness, wrapped in hardcover (so you can take it on the stagecoach with you). It's a stand-alone story: the further adventures of Modo, star of The Hunchback Assignments novels. He's been trained by the British to be a secret agent and is a hunchback with a special ability: he can change his shape to look like other people.

The four bestselling novels in the series were the inspiration:

Now see the characters come to life in a full colour graphic novel. In Ember's End, Modo and his fellow agent, Octavia, find themselves in the Wild West. 

They stumble across the town of Ember's End, built by the mad scientist Ebenenezer Ember, who has vanished but has left behind his beguiling daughter.

There's a rumour that Ebenezer has invented a device that will end all wars. This has brought the mercenary, Ogden Bull, to town. It becomes a race to find the device and to see who will use it first...

Think: action, over-the-top adventure, a huge dollop of fantastical fun and enough humour to tickle your innards.

 

Arthur Slade is the author of seventeen bestselling novels (including Dust, Jolted and The Hunchback Assignments) and Hallowed Knight, a four-part comic book series. His writing has won numerous awards including the Governor General's Award (Canada) and Le Grande Priz L'imaginaire (France). Christopher Steininger is an illustrator whose work has appeared in comics like DeadHeaven, Worlds of Dungeons & Dragons, Avengelyne, and also games like Spec Ops: The Line.

 

We're looking for enough greenbacks to print a full-colour collector's edition of Ember's End. (It's gonna look real purrrty.) The artist and author will also be paid for their work. More importantly, we have several awesome stretch rewards in mind should we surpass our funding goal. Will it be buttons? T-shirts? Airships for everyone? Stay tuned.

It's been our longstanding dream to create a graphic novel inspired by The Hunchback Assignments. Now you can be a part of that dream. And pick up some cool swag too.

Reach out and telegraph the world!

We'd love your help getting the buzz going about our project. Click the "share" tools to Tweet or Facebook or Google+ or telegraph the world about Modo: Ember's End.
